collection1.title: Looking for something different? Work that matters? It's not baloney (San Francisco)

body.text:
It is, however, a horrible pseudo-pun.
Public Outreach Fundraising
Public Outreach, specializing in face-to-face fundraising for non-profit organizations, is unlike any work experience you have ever had before! We are hiring committed, caring, passionate individuals to do direct fundraising with the public.
You must:
Love the outdoors
Enjoy meeting and talking with new people
Want to make a positive change in the world
Be committed to helping these incredible charities get the donor support they need
If you fit this description you may be a great fit with Public Outreach! Fight against today's most pressing issues while working alongside some of the world's largest and most influential international non-profit organizations! 
You will get to:
Have the opportunity to work on behalf of the most respected not-for-profit charities
Instill passion in the public
Work on a guaranteed hourly wage, with consistent, regular raises
Better your communication skills
Know your city and the wonderful people in it
Enjoy staff perks (including full benefits for long-term staff)
No experience? No problem. The only prerequisite is a passion for changing the world, strong communication skills and a positive attitude.
We pay $11/hr to start, with a raise to $14/hr after completing the first week evaluation, and are looking for long-term, full-time staff, though some part-time positions may be available.
Click here to apply
Not Ready to Apply?
Keywords: Fundraising, Charity, Non-Profit, Nonprofit, Fundraise, Customer Service, Sales, Fun, Hourly, opportunity, interface, people, interact, Canvasser, Public Outreach, Fundraiser, Outdoors, Political, Face-to-face, Activist, Benefits, Philanthropy, Canvassing, NPO

collection1.title: Operatons Associate (Train to be a Business Manager) (downtown / civic / van ness)
collection1.body:
Operations Associate (Train to be an Operations Manager or Business Manager)
Small growing international business seeks operations associate (business manager in training) to assist senior management with operations for the agency. Join a fast-paced, start-up environment and gain valuable business experience. 
We are seeking someone with sharp computer skills (Excel, email, attachments, document processing), excellent communication skills, willingness to learn all aspects of this dynamic international business. Training provided. Work with executive level business managers.
Location: Van Ness Street (near Clay Street), San Francisco, CA (free parking!) 
Job Duties
-Bookkeeping (will train):
-Quickbooks: Client invoicing; Cut checks; enter transactions and payments
-Maintain spreadsheets; manage credit card statements
-File receipts and send out bills and payments
-Monitor Petty Cash, balance and allocate
-Go to the bank, obtain cashier's checks and required cash denominations/quarters
Operations Tasks:
-Maintain spreadsheets 
-Work with overseas clients on processing and refining online documents
-Scan documents & insert into PDF files on server
-Manage Vendor files: maintain building leases; work with maintenance
-Supervise operations projects (be liaison for new furniture; water delivery)
-Purchase and manage office supplies
-Set up and prepare for meetings (prepare binders, order food, manage schedule)
-Purchase food for meetings, arrange catering
-Create letters, proofread and send out (audit letters)
-Maintain and record client Extension documents; departure information
-Book flights; arrange hotels; arrange transportation (possibly accompany clients in taxi)
-Mail FEDEX, post office letters, get stamps, pick up hardware 
International Agent Tasks:
-Maintain International Agent Manual and procedures
-Perform Skype calls with International Clients overseas (accommodate World Clock time differences)
-Speak to international and local clients to help resolve issues and transmit information
Executive Assistant Tasks and Special Projects:
-Assist president and director of operations on special projects
-Take incoming calls; act as "gatekeeper" for directors
-Check voice mail, return calls as required
Skills and Experience Needed:
-At least 2 years work experience (in any field); at least 1 year working in an office
-Confidentiality 
-Perform tasks with poise and confidence
-Stellar computer skills (comfortable with email attachments, spreadsheets, editing, etc).
-At least 2 years of college (pursing Degree OK)
-"Can-do" attitude; willing to pitch in where necessary
-Must have confident and pleasant phone manner
-Able to gracefully juggle constantly shifting priorities
-Comfortable working with non-native English speakers at times
-Be a team player
-Drivers license and/or car a + (but not necessary)
-Second language a + (but not necessary). Spanish speaker a +.
This is an exciting office atmosphere with a lot of activity. We are looking for a low-drama addition to our team who is willing to pitch in and help us get things done so we can continue to grow. Opportunities abound! Must be able to work in the office, during business hours and complete required tasks between Mon-Thursday. Hours are 15-25 per week TBA, plus one weekend per month (from home/ on-call). Additional hours possible during the summer. 
Please write a short paragraph about yourself about why you are interested in this job. We regret we cannot answer all inquiries. This job is a contract position for 3 months, with the possibility of extension. Bonus paid at end of term. Form 1099; company is unable to offer benefits at this time.

collection1.title: #1566 | Event Manager - Tech Exp. - [Talent Avenue]

Location: San Francisco

Excel

collection1.title: Ad Operations Manager (financial district)
collection1.body:
Adlogica is a start-up of under 20 people with expertise in search and viral marketing, localization, traffic monetization, and building impactful consumer Internet brands. Previously, our founding team started and grew hi5.com to the third largest social network globally. Each month, Adlogica properties reach over 10 million unique users and drives millions of advertiser leads through the combination of techniques and technology in search demand discovery, precision ad targeting, and a highly scalable infrastructure. We are already profitable and seeking to grow our team and our business rapidly. The role consists of learning and managing all aspects of monetization & yields optimization for our websites.
The Job
-Continually find new innovative ways to improve yields
-Translate high level business goals into metrics (KPI's) to track
-Analyze traffic performance based on KPI's & adjust priority & impression levels accordingly
-Ensure revenue goals are met by continually optimizing traffic through inventory control & strategic ad placements (not by selling more, but by selling more efficiently)
-Identify new opportunities to improve processes and systems to meet strategic goals
-Act as technical account manager for monetization partners, working closely with them set them up on our system, to discuss available inventory, technical problems, & negotiate prices
-Proactively seek new solutions and tools that can address evolving BI needs
-Provide executive level dashboard (BI) reporting on key metrics of revenue and inventory, including volume, pricing, yield, and overall performance
-Scope and implement ad hoc projects that might involve outside vendors
-Identify & build out roles needed to scale the team, & then manage to strategic goals
Requirements
-1-4 years of experience in online advertising or related tech job
-Strong math skills & a quantitative mindset
-Hands on & ready to contribute to the completion of any task
-Strong technical aptitude & able to learn & effectively use new technologies as needed
-Familiarity with how the internet, ad serving, and websites work
-Able to effectively use & troubleshoot issues on Windows/Mac/Linux
-Strong written & oral communication skills with both business & technical teams
-Able to scope out complex projects with little supervision
-Master of excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.)
Pluses
-Familiarity with software languages including MYSQL, PHP, HTML/CSS
-Working knowledge of BI tools like Mixpanel & Tableau
-Experience working with databases & data management
-Experience with project management tools
-Experience managing technical & business teams
-Strong familiarity with Windows installers

collection1.title: Customer Service, Sales Support & Administrative Representative (potre (SOMA / south beach)
collection1.body:
Customer Service, Sales Support & Administrative Representative (potrero hill)
Interior Design Showroom located in San Francisco Design Center is seeking qualified candidates for the position of full-time Customer Service, Sales Support & Administrative Representative. The company specializes in furniture and textiles to the Interior Design Trade.
Candidates should be familiar with providing customer service of the highest level to our customers and sales team. Qualified individuals should also understand the concept of high quality products and the service this is expected to support it. 
As a small company, each employee must possess good inter-personal skills and be able to multitask and lend a "helping hand" where needed. Applicants should be motivated, well organized, detail oriented, energetic and able to work independently as well as efficiently. Excellent telephone skills and personality are also highly favorable as well as comfort and speed with technology. 
Our ideal candidate will have previous experience with textile and/or furniture order processes, and knowledge of vendor procedures within the interior design profession. 
Hours: Monday-Friday 9:00 AM -- 5:30PM 
Benefits: Medical, Dental and Life Insurance, 401(K), Paid Vacation & Sick Leave 
To Apply: Please submit a cover letter, resume, and include 2-3 professional references:
Tell us about yourself and your idea of excellent customer service. 
GENERAL DUTIES INCLUDE
Customer Service Duties:
- Handle incoming phone calls: routing calls to other staff/taking messages, answering customer inquiries for stock/pricing, order status and other general information
- Receive and review purchase orders received from clients and generating purchase orders to vendors
- Follow up with vendors and clients on all pending and existing orders; Problem solving and conflict resolution
- Provide backup for other Customer Service representatives and Sales representatives
Administrative Duties:
- Maintain and update vendor and client database
- General office duties such as filing, faxing, preparing correspondence, and processing mail
- Cross train to support other Customer Service representatives and Accounting staff
- Any other projects assigned by the Management
Selected Individuals will be called and interviewed
Please, no phone calls about this job! 
Compensation: DOE
Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.
Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.

collection1.title: Tenting Crew Lead Needed!! (downtown / civic / van ness)
collection1.body:
Job Title: Event Services Representative III -- Festival Lead
Department: Distribution Operations
Reports To: Operations Manager
FLSA Status: Non-Exempt
Summary (This job is in Mukilteo Washington, applicant must be willing to relocate.)
The Festival Lead position will focus heavily on large scale events throughout Washington State. As a Festival Lead you will be required to load a truck, drive it to a specific destination, unload the truck, direct crews onsite which include and are not limited to temps, new hires, and other company staff. Interaction with customers, sales staff, and the operations department will all be big parts of your day, so you will have to be an effective communicator. 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Able to effectively build a frame, jumbo track, structure, or pole tent in a variety of configurations and locations.
• Able to multi-task, meet timelines and handle stressful situations in a calm manner.
• Coordinates between sales staff, operations, customers and vendors to resolve service issues in a timely and efficient manner.
• Available or on call 24 hours a day and 7 days a week.
• Available for travel and overnight stays.
• Coordinates event setup, timeline and expectations with Project Manager or Salesperson.
• Proactively plans event setup and delegates tasks to helpers and temp crew.
• Provides customers with friendly and professional service.
• Communicates arrivals, progress, and issues with Operations Management and Customer.
• Trains delivery helpers, temporary staff and new employees on proper handling of equipment according to best demonstrated practices.
• Loads and oversees the counting of product into truck, and checks product against contract.
• Protects product from damage using best demonstrated practices.
• Loads truck, distributing weight evenly, forming compact load, and utilizing space.
• Maintains awareness of weight loads and informs Operations Manager on potential DOT violations.
• Conducts pre-use inspections and services truck.
• Safely drives truck to destination and unloads cargo.
• Cleans and make minor repairs to product.
• Responsible for maintaining paperwork and turning paperwork into Operations Manager.
• More responsibilities may be required as the job demands
Supervisory Responsibilities 
This job has oversight of helper and temp crews and provides feedback on performance to Operations Manager.
Competencies 
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
• Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Responds to requests for service and assistance.
• Teamwork - Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
• Ethics - Treats people with respect; Keeps commitments; Works ethically and with integrity; Upholds organizational values.
• Judgment - Exhibits sound and accurate judgment.
• Planning/Organizing - Uses time efficiently.
• Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Accepts responsibility for own actions.
• Quality - Monitors own work to ensure quality.
• Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures; Determines appropriate action beyond guidelines; Reports potentially unsafe conditions ; Uses equipment and materials properly.
• Adaptability - Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
• Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time; Arrives at meetings and appointments on time.
• Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals.
Qualifications :
Education and/or Experience 
HS Diploma or GED, three to six years of related experience or one year of trade school, or any combination there of.
Language Skills 
Fluent in English both written and verbally, you must be able to communicate with the customer, sales staff, operations, and your crew both verbally and in writing.
Reasoning Ability 
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations 
Current state driver's license and medical DOT card. (DOT card can be obtained when you are hired.)
Other Qualifications 
Must be able to work overtime as needed to include: long hours, odd hours, and weekends.
Must have a clean MVR for the past 3 years and maintain an MVR with less than 5 points throughout employment. Must maintain a valid license throughout employment..
Must have a clean criminal background check for the past 5 years.
Must be able to pass a pre-hire drug check and continually be able to pass random drug checks.
Must follow all safety rules, truck backing safety rules, and warehouse safety rules.
Must be able to occasionally stay overnight out of town while making pick-ups and deliveries.
Physical Demands 
Must be able to lift 50-100 lbs frequently. Must be physically fit and able to walk, run, bend, rotate at the waist and neck, reach and crawl. This is a physically demanding job, much like framing, or general construction.
Work Environment 
While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is frequently exposed to outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.
Compensation
$15.00-$19.00 DOE

collection1.title: Hiring Line Cooks NOW! AM or PM
collection1.body:
Players Sports Grill specializes in classic American cuisine: Burgers, Steaks, Ribs, Seafood, ect.
Line cooks must be able to thrive in a stressful environment. We need solid cooks with a good attitude. Pay is very competitive.
Qualifications we are looking for include:
• You have a good attitude -- show satisfaction in doing good work and good cooking 
• You are familiar with all stations on the line & have a working knowledge of standard restaurant equipment.
• You stay focused under pressure -- expect to be in the weeds and work your way out of it
• You pay attention to what is happening around you -- if the cook next to you is starting to get buried, help him/her out
• You can handle anything that is thrown at you with a smile
• You are conscious of minimizing waste -- each $1.00 saved in waste is worth about $1.30 in revenue
• You are fast, clean, efficient, and organized
• You jump to help when needed -- without being asked
• You cook the dish exactly as the chef taught you and the recipe states -- the same way every time
• You do it right, without cutting corners
• You clean as you go (CAYG)
• You do not call in sick or get arrested -- this affects your entire work family
• You always respond to the chef loudly and clearly -- you always call back orders and directions
• You taste your food -- proper seasoning is 50% of the battle
• You have the ability to work flexible hours including weekend and holidays 
You must have your food handler certificate
Pay is negotiable, based on experience and commitment. $12.50-$15.50
Please respond with your resume pasted in the email.

collection1.title: EMPLOYMENT SPECIALIST (SOMA / south beach)

body.text:
EMPLOYMENT SPECIALIST -- Education & Employment-705 Natoma St.-- #SK25- Mon- Fri- Part Time -20 hrs/week
Episcopal Community Services is a not-for-profit organization which is dedicated to helping homeless and very low-income people move with dignity toward self-sufficiency by providing, each and everyday, compassionate, individualized services, with access to comprehensive resources in the San Francisco community.
The published hourly wage is $17.43 per hour. Full-time employees and those working over twenty hours per week enjoy a comprehensive benefit package.
POSITION SUMMARY: Under the supervision of the Conquering Homelessness through Employment in Food Service (CHEFS) Support Services Manager, the Employment Specialist conducts intake interviews and evaluations, designs individual employment plans for students in the CHEFS program and co-facilitates Life Skills classes. As part of the Chefs program team the position serves as a liaison to the community establishing and maintaining strong relationships with service providers, potential employers, and internship sites.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
Key responsibilities:
1. Conduct outreach and participate in orientation to CHEFS Program.
2. Schedule and conduct intakes for perspective applicants.
3. Participate in assessing program applicants for participation in the program, present application profiles to CHEFS team in weekly client review.
4. Facilitate weekly Life Skills classes designed to help students develop the "soft skills" necessary to prepare them for seeking and keeping employment. 
5. Maintain a caseload of clients who are participating in CHEFS, provide on-going retention support for participants in external internship programs or employment positions providing structure, guidance and support.
6. Design and implement Individualized Employment Plans for program participants.
7. Provide intensive individualized support and guidance to students engaged in the job search process.
8. Provide participants information on training and employment opportunities then prepare and refer them appropriately. 
9. Responsible for job placement of participants into competitive employment and when necessary provide job coaching to support the needs of the participant and employer for successful employment and retention.
10. Participate on the CHEFS team, attend meetings, support and coordinate as necessary.
11. Actively cultivate and maintain collaborative working relationships with potential employers and job opportunities for potential future placement activities.
12. Maintain attendance, contact, performance, and other necessary records.
Performs other relevant duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Bachelors Degree in Vocational or Career Counseling Education or a related field desired. Significant demonstrated related work experience can substitute for education.
2. Two years experience carrying out functions similar to the Employment Specialist role. 
3. Experience working with a multi-cultural, low-income population. 
4. Experience in pre-employment and placement services. 
5. Excellent written and oral communications skills. 
6. Excellent interpersonal skills. 
7. Demonstrable knowledge of IBM and Microsoft Word.
8. Must abide by confidentiality policy and procedures.
9. Experience providing career counseling or life skills training to homeless adults. 
10. Knowledge of substance abuse dynamics and mental health issues. 
11. Healthy work ethic that models professional conduct at all times, including establishing and maintaining healthy boundaries.
OTHER: Must secure and pass finger image screening, a background check, and annual TB screenings. The incumbent will honor and abide by Episcopal Community Services' organizational values and its policies and procedures.
To apply for any of the above-mentioned positions, follow the link below: 
https://home.eease.com/recruit/?id=8727071
If the online application process is not your best option, you may still fax your cover letter and resume to the following fax number and your application will be forwarded to the appropriate hiring manager. Please ensure that you include the specific Position Number of the position for which you are applying: Fax: (415) 252-1743. Please note that the online application process allows you to upload your resume. 
EPISCOPAL COMMUNITY SERVICES IN AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

collection1.title: Registered Nurse (PT, 25hr/wk) (bilingual in English/Cantonese) (richmond / seacliff)

body.text:
Who we are?
Founded in 1966, Self-Help for the Elderly is a community-based organization committed to promoting the independence, dignity, and self-worth of seniors. Each year the agency serves over 35,000 seniors in San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara and Alameda Counties by providing a comprehensive range of multicultural and multilingual services to empower seniors to help themselves and others. Our vision is to be the premier provider of senior services in the San Francisco Bay Area with a commitment to excellence and achievement. Over 90% of our clients come from low-income minority community. 
Why Self-Help?
At Self-Help, we are firmly committed to the senior's security, freedom, and peace of mind. If you enjoy working with seniors. . . if you believe in giving back to the community. . . if helping others makes you happy. . . come join us in making a difference together! 
Summary: Provides skilled nursing assessment, planning and care in order to maximize the comfort and health of Adult Day Services participants. 
Essential Functions:
1. Conducts initial, quarterly, and 6-month nursing assessments of participants; develops and implements nursing care plans.
2. Acts as a liaison to participants' primary care physicians.
3. Provides routine counseling to participants and caregivers; develops and implements self-medication and continence training programs and assists families in the management of incontinence.
4. Provides health education presentations to the participants.
5. Evaluates participants' need(s) for evaluation and/or services by registered dietitian, speech therapist, psychiatric consultant, podiatrist, and/or other medical services; makes referrals according to the program's procedures.
6. Maintains appropriate nursing records in participants' charts.
7. Oversees the administration of personal care services by program aides.
8. Provides in-service training for staff on health-related topics and medical consultation to other staff.
9. Maintains an inventory of medical supplies and equipment, medications ordered by personal physicians, and PRN medications. 
10. Dispenses medications and disposes medications, needles, syringes, and hazardous waste materials according to the program's procedures.
11. Participates in morning huddles, multidisciplinary team meetings and staff meetings as schedule permits, and other meetings as assigned.
12. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
1. Current California Licensed Registered Nurse.
2. Previous nursing experience working with the elderly or the chronically ill, or experience in home health, public health, or acute care preferred.
3. Good interpersonal skills with the ability to work well in a multidisciplinary team.
4. Excellent written and oral communication skills in English and Cantonese.
5. Familiar with different patient transferring techniques. Must pass a strength test for physical fitness for the job: able to lift up to 40lbs from floor to waist level.
6. Must have TB clearance within 12 months prior to employment and maintain clearance annually thereafter.
7. Must acquire CPR and First Aid certificates within 6 months of employment and maintain current certificates thereafter.
8. Must be able to travel via public transportation or personal vehicle for performance of job duties. If driving, must have and maintain a valid CA driver license, satisfactory driving record, and auto insurance coverage as specified in Self-Help's policy.
Salary: DOE
Benefits: We offer a comprehensive benefits package including a multiple range of medical and dental plans, commuter benefits, flexible benefits plan, retirement plan, paid time off, paid holiday, and etc.
To apply: Please click on the link below to complete an online application. 
https://home.eease.adp.com/recruit/?id=532155
Self-Help for the Elderly is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to embracing diversity. We consider all applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, religion, medical condition including genetic characteristics, disability, marital status, citizenship, military service, or any other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We participate in E-Verify Employment Verification Program.

collection1.title: Need Healthy Volunteers! (41-80)- San Francisco, CA (ingleside / SFSU / CCSF)
collection1.compensation: compensation: You will be compensated for your time commitment and you will be given transportation allowance.
collection1.body:
WHAT: Biometrix, Inc. is looking for healthy volunteers, both male and female, to participate in a study to assess the efficacy of topical agents in dermal marker expression. The study involves collection of 3mm tissue samples (7 samples) from the forearm area.
WHERE: All procedures will be performed at Biometrix, Inc. San Francisco. 
WHEN: 7 visits (Day 0, Day 1, Day 4, Day 8, Day 12, Day 22)
ELIGIBILITY: Ages 41-80, with moderate to severe photo damage on the dorsal forearm. 
COMPENSATION: You will be compensated for your time commitment and you will be given transportation allowance.
CONTACT US: Biometrix, Inc. at (415)239-8006 then press 4
Principle Investigators: Dr. John Ademola, PhD, and Dr. Martin Miller, MD.

collection1.title: Physical Therapist (On-Call) (richmond / seacliff)

body.text:
Who we are?
Founded in 1966, Self-Help for the Elderly is a community-based organization committed to promoting the independence, dignity, and self-worth of seniors. Each year the agency serves over 35,000 seniors in San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara and Alameda Counties by providing a comprehensive range of multicultural and multilingual services to empower seniors to help themselves and others. Our vision is to be the premier provider of senior services in the San Francisco Bay Area with a commitment to excellence and achievement. Over 90% of our clients come from low-income minority community. 
Why Self-Help?
At Self-Help, we are firmly committed to the senior's security, freedom, and peace of mind. If you enjoy working with seniors. . . if you believe in giving back to the community. . . if helping others makes you happy. . . come join us in making a difference together! 
Summary: Instructs participants in a therapeutic regime to maximize function of body parts and muscles and to maximize endurance.
Essential Functions:
1. Conducts initial, quarterly, and 6-month assessments of participants' physical condition and functional status to determine if physical therapy services or maintenance program services are appropriate.
2. Develops and implements individual treatment plans to administer physical therapy or maintenance program for participants; records treatments and maintains progress notes in participants' health records.
3. Reevaluates participants as their conditions change and modifies treatment goals consistent with these changes.
4. Orders equipment required by participants and assesses correct fit for all assistive devices of participants.
5. Instructs caregivers in relevant methods of care and treatment which they can carry out at home.
6. Trains and supervises the rehabilitation aides in the provision of maintenance program services.
7. Provides in-service training and consultation to staff on principles of physical therapy as needed.
8. Ensures that therapy equipment in the gym is in good working order; repairs or arranges for repair any broken equipment.
9. Provides back-up support for occupational therapy functions when necessary.
10. Participates in weekly multidisciplinary team meetings if schedule allows for and other meetings as assigned.
11. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
1. Licensed by the Physical Therapy Board of California.
2. One year of experience working with the frail elderly or the chronically ill.
3. Experience in home health, public health, or acute care and/or experience in working as a member of a multidisciplinary team highly preferred.
4. Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
5. Bilingual in English and Chinese preferred.
6. Familiar with different patient transferring techniques. Must pass a strength test for physical fitness for the job: able to lift up to 40lbs from floor to waist level.
7. Must have TB clearance within 12 months prior to employment and maintain clearance annually thereafter.
8. Must acquire CPR and First Aid certificates within 6 months of employment and maintain current certificates thereafter.
9. Must be able to travel via public transportation or personal vehicle for performance of job duties. If driving, must have and maintain a valid CA driver license, satisfactory driving record, and auto insurance coverage as specified in Self-Help's policy.
Salary: DOE
Benefits: We offer a comprehensive benefits package including a multiple range of medical and dental plans, commuter benefits, flexible benefits plan, retirement plan, paid time off, paid holiday, and etc.
To apply: Please click on the link below to complete an online application. 
https://home.eease.adp.com/recruit/?id=8876641
Self-Help for the Elderly is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to embracing diversity. We consider all applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, religion, medical condition including genetic characteristics, disability, marital status, citizenship, military service, or any other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We participate in E-Verify Employment Verification Program.

collection1.title: Kitchen Prep (laurel hts / presidio)
collection1.body:
The Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy is the nonprofit support partner of the Golden Gate National Parks--84,000 acres of national parkland throughout the Bay Area, including Muir Woods, Ocean Beach, Crissy Field, and Alcatraz. The Parks Conservancy is a membership organization created to preserve the Golden Gate National Parks, enhance the experiences of park visitors, and build a community dedicated to conserving the parks for the future. Park projects and programs include the Crissy Field Center, the promoting of leadership and environmental justice training for youth; the Native Plant Nurseries, which grows over 100,000 plants annually to restore habitat; Trails Forever, which is at work building and rehabilitating miles of trails throughout the parks; and volunteer programs that inspire 35,000 people annually to take action in support the parks.
Position Overview
This is a unique opportunity for the aspiring chef.
You will join our fast paced cafés in Crissy Café located in San Francisco's beautiful national park. The Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy is expanding. Our kitchen is seeking an energetic prep cook. We are a green business dedicated to presenting an ever-growing, local, delicious, sustainable menu. 
Key Duties and Responsibilities
• Read and cook established recipes.
• Operate basic commercial kitchen equipment including convection ovens and Robocoupe.
• Assist kitchen manager in creating new menu items.
• Produce sandwiches, salads, soups and assorted sides quickly.
• Excellent with time and temperature control. 
• Supervise assistant prep associates.
• Maintain kitchen in inspection condition at all times.
• Maintain positive, productive relations with coworkers and vendors. 
• Other duties as assigned by kitchen manager.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
• Culinary degree
• Familiar with application of all cooking methods and must be able to apply them 
• Professional knife skills
• Commercial kitchen production skills for mass catering
• Some experience with fast pack / grab and go packaging process 
• Manager Level food safety certification
• Ability to multi-task quickly and consistently 
• Valid CA driver's license and insurable
• Demonstrated willingness and ability to learn
• Outstanding attendance
• Industry standard uniform and grooming for food service
• Ability to lift and move up to 50 lbs. a short distance
• Must be able to work standing.
• Must be able to work weekends and Holidays
• Must be able to work well with minimal directive on kitchen manager's days off 
Physical Requirements and Work Environment
• Work is performed in a kitchen setting 
• Work is primarily performed standing or walking
• Work requires squatting and kneeling
• Frequently lifts, carries and positions objects weighing up to 40 pounds 
Compensation
This is a full time benefited position. The salary for this position will be commensurate with work experience, skills and educational background.
To Apply
Please submit a thoughtful cover letter and resume. Include "Kitchen Prep" in the subject line of your email.
Please no phone calls about this position.
The Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy is dedicated to representing the community it serves. We encourage candidates that would bring diversity to the Conservancy to apply.

To apply, please send your resume and cover letter. In your cover letter, please include your hours of availability. In the subject of your email, write "CAFE ASSOCIATE"
* ONLY APPLICATIONS WITH THE ABOVE REQUIREMENTS WILL BE CONSIDERED.

collection1.title: Job Coach (San Francisco)

body.text:
Position Title:
Job Coach
Program/Dept:
Jobs Plus / San Mateo County and San Francisco 
Reports to:
Job Plus Developer
Classification:
Casual, Non-Exempt
Salary Range:
$14.07 hourly
Agency Description: Caminar is a nonprofit agency with over 49 years of experience providing community-based support services for people with disabilities. 
Caminar services are designed to enable adults and older adults with mental health, 
physical and developmental disabilities to live and work in their community in accordance with their ability and desire. 
Our mission is to improve the quality of life for people with disabilities by providing opportunities to live in the community with dignity and independence. 
The agency employs approximately 300 of the most dedicated and professional staff serving the communities of San Mateo, Solano and Butte counties.
Position Description: Under supervision of the Job Developer, the Job Coach is responsible for analyzing job tasks of clients in the Jobs Plus program so that s/he can provide on-the-job training to clients with serious mental illness. S/he must develop and maintain productive working relationships with employers and clients to ensure continuation of the good reputation of the agency for providing quality employees who have disabilities. This is an On-Call position with irregular hours and requires the ability to maintain a flexible work schedule.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Provide supervision to consumers with mental and/or developmental disability; Observe and assess consumers' work skills ensuring that consumer's work performance meets job requirements and employer's standards. Identify client learning needs and make appropriate recommendations..
Analyze job tasks and develop a job training program for each position.
Evaluate and document clients' job performance; Provide constructive feedback as needed.
Ensure consumer's safety in the community by following established employer's safety practices; negotiate work site accommodation (as needed) with the employer or volunteer site.
Report suspected abuse of clients and complete incident reports in a timely manner.
Act as a role model for clients, demonstrating productive work skills and professional behavior..
Provide support services to clients, their families, employers, and care providers as necessary..
Promote the services of Jobs Plus.
Develop and maintain a respectful, caring, tolerant, ethical, and empowering relationship with all individuals served.
Develop and maintain productive working relationships with other system providers and actively participate in meetings that affect the program, as assigned.
Comply with all state Department of Rehabilitation (DOR) regulations and CARF standards, as well as all agency policies and procedures. 
Ensure that all client records are properly maintained, stored, and kept confidential at all times.
Attend training events as assigned by supervisor..
Attend and participate in a weekly staff meeting.
Participate in the effort to keep program offices clean, safe, attractive and comfortable at all times.
Relieve other Job Coaches, as assigned..
Negotiate stairs of employer facilities and other job-related venues and maintain the ability to carry items weighing up to 25 pounds so that job functions can be carried out effectively and in a timely manner.
Submit accurate time sheets and mileage/expense reimbursement reports to program management in a timely manner..
Drive own or agency vehicle to job sites and other venues, as required; documenting and reporting mileage according to agency procedures, so that services can be provided in a timely manner; comply with agency vehicle policy at all times..
Promote within the agency and with the general public the philosophy and practice of social rehabilitation.
Actively nurture and advance the cooperative, harmonious and teamwork oriented environment Caminar strives to promote within the workplace; Through daily efforts and presentation promote an atmosphere of dignity and respect in line with the organization's mission, philosophy, policies and procedures.
Perform other related duties, responsibilities and special projects as assigned.
Requirements, Qualifications, Skills & Abilities:
Must be passionate about Caminar's mission. 
Must be available to work evening and weekend shifts on a short notice, and to work overtime when required. Ability to keep a flexible work schedule is therefore essential. 
High School Diploma or GED is required. BA in psychology or related field is preferred. 
A minimum of one year of direct service provision to people with disabilities, preferably in a social rehabilitation or vocational setting is preferred.. 
Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment including email and Internet navigation required. Experience with Human Service Information Systems strongly preferred.Experience with web based time and attendance and staff training and development system is strongly preferred. 
Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality, a professional demeanor and to represent the organization in a positive manner at all times.
Must demonstrate acceptable level of maturity, good judgment, and emotional stability.
Problem solving-identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner and gathers and analyzes information skillfully. 
Customer Service-manages difficult customer situations, responds promptly to customer needs and solicits customer feedback to improve service. 
Oral and written communication-speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations, demonstrates group presentation skills and conducts meetings. Completes written progress notes and other formal communications skillfully and professionally.
Quality management-looks for ways to improve and promote quality and demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness. 
Planning/organizing-prioritizes and plans work activities, uses time efficiently and develops realistic action plans.
Adaptability-adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
Dependability-is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.
Safety and security-actively promotes and personally observes safety and security procedures, and uses equipment and materials properly. 
Must be a dynamic self-starter with demonstrated ability to work independently on special projects.
Physical, Environmental and Mental Requirements:
Physical: Occasionally required to push/pull objects up to 50 lbs, and to lift/carry objects up to 25 lbs. Frequently required to perform moderately difficult manipulative tasks such as typing, writing, etc. Must be able to walk, stand, sit for extended periods. 
Sensory: Frequently required to read documents, written reports, and plans. Must be able to distinguish normal sounds with some background noise, as in answering the phone, interacting with residents and staff, etc. Must be able to speak clearly and understand/be understood using the English language. 
Cognitive: Frequently required to concentrate on moderate detail with constant interruption. Must be able to attend to a task/function for 20-45 minutes at a time. Frequently required to understand and relate to specific ideas, several at a time. Must be able to remember multiple tasks/assignments given to self and others over a period of several days. 
Environmental Conditions: Frequent exposure to varied office and mixed (residential/office) environments. Occasional exposure to toxins and poisonous substances, dust, and loud noises. 
Equipment: Frequently required to use a computer, phone, and fax machine.
Special Requirements:
Must be able to meet and receive a criminal records clearance, as required by Title XXII, other licensing regulations, and Caminar practices.
This position will require frequent driving to and from Caminar's branch offices so maintaining a valid driver license, reliable personal automobile, a clean driving record, and current insurance as required by law are essential job requirements. 
Must be able to pass post-offer, pre-employment medical and drug tests as required under State Community Care Licensing regulations and/or agency policies.
May be required to obtain and maintain CPR and First aid certification.
How to Apply: 
Please send a letter of interest and current resume to jobs@caminar.org 
(include "SM /SF JC" in the subject header of your email). No Phone Calls Please
Caminar is a leader in providing innovative client-oriented mental health services. We are an equal opportunity employer. Please visit our web site at www.caminar.org.

collection1.title: Wanna Be One Of The Best Pet Sitters In Town? (All SF Neighborhoods)
collection1.compensation: compensation: A large percentage of the fee to the client + 100% of gratuities

body.text:
Visit our website at www.theanimalnanny.com
The Animal Nanny was founded in 2001. We have become one of the Bay Area's top choices for high-quality pet sitting and dog walking services. We currently serve 3 regions: San Francisco, the Tri-Valley, and the Tri Cities. We are NOT a franchise. We pride ourselves on our attention to detail and the personalized attention we give to each client and their pets. Pet sitting is a service business and we take the concept of service seriously! 
The position being offered:
Independent Contractor Pet Sitter/Dog Walker (Nanny)
The Nanny serves the city of San Francisco only 
Is a 1 year contract commitment (which may be eligible for renewal after 1 year) 
You must be available to perform morning visits from 6:00am - 10:00am, and evening visits from 5:00pm - 8:00pm. You will not have visits to perform during all of these hours, but you must be willing to take visits during these hours 
Additional availability to perform visits during the mid day hours, from 11:00am - 4:00pm is a plus. 
You must be willing to perform visits 7 days a week, including holidays (the same Nanny performs every visit throughout the entire service for each client)
You must be available for Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Years, particularly November 22 - November 30, and December 19 - January 2; this is our busiest time of the year 
You will receive a large percentage of the fee to the client for each visit completed, as well as 100% of gratuities from the client. The earnings are anticipated to be $10,000-$20,000 per year, however there is no guarantee as to how much you will actually earn 
Job Tasks:
Walking dogs 
Feeding animals
Washing food and water bowls 
Poop patrol in the client's yard, and on walks 
Cleaning litter boxes 
Playing and/or hanging out with pets 
Administering medications (pills, liquids, injections) 
Collecting mail, newspapers, packages, or fliers which have arrived at the client's home
Taking garbage containers to and from the curb 
Watering plants 
Writing notes to clients letting them know how their pets did under our care 
Why do you want to be a Nanny for The Animal Nanny? 
We are dedicated professionals who are passionate about animals!
Our Nannies get to spend their time working with the animals and not with the people - we recognize that animal people aren't always people people 
You will always be paid for the pet sitting and dog walking visits you complete 
You will not be asked to walk any groups of dogs, we only do private walks 
We have a team mentality. Even though our Nannies work alone most of the time, we all function as a team and support each other in our work!
You will not have to do scheduling, marketing/promotion, or other administrative tasks - that's the company's responsibility 
You will be able to build ongoing relationships with the pets you care for; we have a high rate of client retention and many of our clients use our service several times throughout the year
Minimum Job Eligibility Requirements:
The position being offered is a 1 year contract commitment, which may be renewed after 1 year. If you do not meet the minimum job eligibility requirements, do not send us a resume, we will discard it.
Passionate about animals
Are a minimum age of 20
Live in San Francisco 
Able to meet the scheduling requirements listed above 
Have previous experience working with animals (if it's not on your resume, explain what your experience is in your cover letter) 
Willing to submit to and pass a background check 
Honest and reliable with a high standard of excellence for yourself 
Have the integrity and trustworthiness to work with little direct supervision 
Possess that all too uncommon, common sense 
Have a reliable car (or other motorized vehicle) to get to and from clients' homes 
Have a cell phone with texting capability, smartphone is a plus 
Have daily access to a computer with internet access and a reliable printer 
Are physically fit enough to walk large dogs, lift a 25-30 lb. bag of cat litter, kneel down to pet and play with smaller animals and clean litter boxes, plus perform other tasks - all in the same day
Are willing to do a day or two of "ride along" visits with one of our current Nannies to get a better idea of what the job is (only applies to qualified candidates as the last phase of our interview process)
Applying:
Submit a cover letter explaining why you want to become a Nanny for The Animal Nanny, and a resume by email only to: jobs@theanimalnanny.com
We will not consider applicants who do not include a resume and a cover letter in their response to this ad 
It may take us several days to respond to applicants, as we want to be able to review resumes carefully before responding
Please no phone calls! 
Visit our website at www.theanimalnanny.com

collection1.title: Manager of HIV/STI Testing Services (Portland, OR)
collection1.body:
JOB POSTING
Manager of HIV/STI Testing Services
Description: Cascade AIDS Project (CAP) is the oldest and largest AIDS Service Organization (ASO) in Oregon and Southwest Washington. We are seeking a Manager of HIV/STI Testing Services to develop and manage Cascade AIDS Project's HIV and STI testing services as well as oversee our CDC funded programs serving people living with HIV. This position will work in collaboration with the Director of Prevention and Education Services, the Manager of Education Services, and the Manager of Prevention Services.
The incumbent develops programs consistent with the agency's mission and strategic plan, primarily focused on men who have sex with men (MSM) who are at high risk for transmission of or infection with HIV and other sexually transmitted infections (STIs). Duties include: development and oversight of CAP's HIV and STI testing policies and procedures; provision, coordination, and oversight of employee and volunteer HIV/STI training; HIV/STI quality assurance and monitoring; managing testing supplies; and data collection and reporting. This position will also oversee our CDC-funded programs for people living with HIV including: Linkage to Care, Service Navigation, and our evidence-based intervention, Health Relationships.
Additional duties include: supervising personnel (4.0 FTE); budget development and oversight, contract and grant monitoring and reporting; assuring that programs and services are of the highest quality; creating and strengthening community partnerships; working with the Volunteer Resources department on volunteer recruitment, training, management, and retention; and working with the grants coordinator to fund raise for program continuity and expansion. As a member of the agency's management team, the Manager of HIV/STI Testing Services will help determine and implement agency policies and procedures and provide leadership both within and outside the organization.
This full-time position reports to the Director of Prevention and Education Services and will work out of CAP's Portland office with some travel as needed.
Minimum Qualifications: 
• Bachelor's degree in Social Work, Public Health, Education or related human services field or two years equivalent professional experience 
• Two years professional experience in management including personnel supervision, budget management, and program development
• Previous experience conducting HIV and/or STI screenings
• Experience with or knowledge of HIV/AIDS prevention issues 
• Previous experience with development and oversight of policies and procedures, preferably in a clinical or medical setting
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including experience conducting trainings to small groups of people
• Ability to cultivate and maintain professional relationships across a multicultural spectrum of organizations and professionals
• Strong understanding of gay/bi men's issues and how they affect or influence service delivery 
• Strong initiative & self-starter with the ability to effectively solve problems
• Ability to work independently with accountability; exercise sound judgment and discretion
• Successful experience working with ethnic, racial, economic and sexually diverse populations
• Proficient in MS office products
• Available to travel and work evening/weekend hours
• Previous experience with volunteer recruitment, training, and management
Preferred Qualifications: 
• Master's degree in Social Work, Public Health, Education or related human services field
• Verbal and written fluency in English and Spanish
• Previous experience working with insurance billing systems
• Experience with or knowledge of HIV/AIDS clinical care issues such as linkage to HIV care
• Previous experience conducting phlebotomy
Compensation: $48,500 - $54,600 at 1.0 FTE annually, depending on experience; employer-paid health, dental, vision, short-term and long-term disability and life insurance; 401(k) retirement plan with generous employer matching contribution, 125C cafeteria savings plan; generous vacation and health leave benefits.
Position will be open until filled with resume review beginning April 16, 2014. To apply for this position, mail, email or deliver the following three documents: 1) your resume, 2) a cover letter that addresses how you meet the minimum qualifications specific to the position you are applying for, and 3) a completed CAP employment application (available at www.cascadeaids.org) to:
Cascade AIDS Project
Manager of HIV/STI Testing Services 
208 SW Fifth Avenue, Suite 800
Portland, Oregon 97204
or by email to: jobs@cascadeaids.org
Cascade AIDS Project is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer

collection1.title: Graphic Arts Instructor (potrero hill)
collection1.body:
Bayview Hunters Point Center for Arts and Technology
BAYCAT
Graphic Arts Instructor
Part-time Temporary Position
BAYCAT is seeking an energetic, creative, and resourceful Graphic Arts Instructor to be part of this exciting nonprofit social enterprise. We are in search of a values-driven individual with a strong commitment to our mission, and the desire to grow professionally. Join us as we build a dream team that values creativity, professionalism and an inclusive environment.
ORGANIZATION MISSION AND VISION
The mission of BAYCAT is to educate, empower and employ underserved youth and young adults to produce digital media that tells their unique stories and engages them to positively transform themselves, their communities and the world. BAYCAT believes every person's story matters. We envision a world where media and technology facilitate the telling and the hearing of stories from the broadest possible range of experiences in a way that moves people to create positive change in their communities. To learn more about BAYCAT, please visit www.baycat.org.
PRIMARY ROLE
The Graphic Arts Instructor is responsible for designing, teaching, and managing project-based motion graphics or graphic design course during the summer session of youth programming at BAYCAT. While mentoring our youth media-producing students, the Graphic Arts Instructor will be responsible for producing projects with a positive social impact for Bayview Hunters Point and other underserved communities. The Graphic Arts Instructor collaborates fully with the BAYCAT team. This position will report to the Program Coordinator.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
- Teach students Adobe Photoshop / Illustrator and Adobe After Effects techniques and functions
- Design effective project-based media arts curriculum for youth media producers
- Integrate youth development, social justice and media literacy principles into programming
- Reflect and document day-to-day classroom activities
- Lead students through the process of developing a concept, creation, and bringing projects to completion
- Collaboratively guide student projects and assemble work into the final class project
- Establish positive relationships with students, their families, BAYCAT team, and the community-at-large
- Manage students at different stages of development with a variety of learning strengths and styles
- Manage, organize and archive project media
- Align project priorities with the overall BAYCAT vision & mission
- Prioritize and produce project work in a timely manner according to project deadlines
- Be a team player
- Provide leadership and perform other duties as BAYCAT needs require
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
- Demonstrable level of skill and experience in motion graphics and/or graphic design
- Skilled in collaborative teaching methodologies and multiple-intelligences
- Creative approach to teaching and a warm, patient classroom demeanor
- Knowledge of current issues in media arts, the demands of the professional field, and of the tools, technologies and resources inherent to the discipline
- Proficient and technically savvy of the Mac environment
- Passion for using design and media as a tool to create community impact
- Communications skills that are effective with students
- Physical ability to travel throughout San Francisco
- Commitment to personal and professional growth, and aligned with BAYCAT's core values
- Experience teaching middle, high school and young adult students 
- Fluency in Adobe design suite
- Ability to lift 25 lbs at a time
PREFERED QUALIFICATIONS
- Education: BA or MFA degree in design, fine arts, or related field
- Teaching Credential
- Fluency in a second language (especially Spanish, Tagalog, Somoan, Mandarin or Cantonese)
- Familiar with underserved communities
TO APPLY
Please send cover letter, resume and URLs of your own work and your students' work (if available) electronically to email above by Monday, April 14th.
No phone calls please.
Only applicants who send resumes, cover letters and work examples will be considered.
COMPENSATION DOE
This is a part-time temporary position for the duration of our Summer Media Camp, which runs on Monday - Thursday 1-5pm.
Commitment is from 6/2-8/15, 15-20 hours a week.
EOE We strive for a workforce as diverse as the community we serve. Women, LGBTQ and people of color are encouraged to apply.

collection1.title: Account Executive for Awesome Tech Startup (SOMA / south beach)

collection1.title: General Dentist Wanted for Las Vegas (Las Vegas, NV)

body.text:
As an industry leader, Gentle Dental provides a large network of resources, including an experienced practice management staff, cutting edge technology, and outstanding benefits to help our affiliated dentists and employees grow in their careers. Are you a Dentist just wanting to focus on building relationships with your patients and providing quality care? With Gentle Dental, you can count on us to manage the nitty gritty of your office so that you can focus on dentistry. You will also have plenty of dental professionals supporting you to confer and collaborate with as you continue to grow in your career.
Gentle Dental has delivered high quality care with a personal touch for over 30 years. We have the resources you need to achieve true personal and career success. We aim to provide our network of affiliated doctors and staff with a competitive benefits package, which include: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401K plan, PTO, CE credits, and career opportunities to advance with the company.
We'll handle the details, you focus on your patients, let's practice together.

collection1.title: Programmer / Coder (San Francisco)
collection1.body:
Chatango.com is a small and growing company founded by an MIT alum, with a large, vibrant and interesting community of users. 
We are a no hype company. We simply desire to make quality tools driven by users' needs. 
We are looking for a recent graduate or a student to work on our live community tools for news, media and gaming sites, as well as a mobile app. 
What we offer:
• Our team is small: your work will have a direct and immediate impact on our product and users.
• Work with innovative technology: custom TCP servers and web clients with persistent socket connections. 
• We initially offer full or part time contracts for a couple of discrete tasks. Then if there is a good fit, continue with recurrent contracts or a full-time job as one of the early employees.
• Our office is in San Francisco SOMA. In certain cases, some remote work is possible.
• Join talented programmers coding Chatango: MIT, Caltech and Berkeley students and graduates.
What we are looking for:
• Ability to meet deadlines
• Fluency in C/C++, Java and/or Python. 
• Understanding of asynchronous, event-driven programming 
• Understanding of MVC model is a big plus
• Familiarity with JavaScript, DOM model, HTML5 and CSS3 standards is a plus
• Familiarity with Android and development on Linux is a plus, but not necessary. 
Please introduce yourself in one or two short paragraphs and send us any relevant links to your projects to jobsr@chatango.com

collection1.title: Foundation Communications Associate (marina / cow hollow)

body.text:
About the Rappaport Family Foundation
Founded in 2003 by Andy and Deborah Rappaport, the Rappaport Family Foundation (RFF) is a private family foundation based in San Francisco, CA. Since our inception, we have awarded more than $5 million to organizations led by young people. We support and foster the arts and civic engagement. To learn more, go to: http://rappaportfamilyfoundation.org
The RFF Spark Initiative is the Rappaport Family's Foundation's biggest and boldest project to date, focused on investing in organizations with promising but untested ideas to build leadership among community college students. RFF Spark supports projects and organizations that prepare students in community colleges to be committed and skilled life-long leaders. To learn more, go to: http://rffspark.org.
Job Description & Responsibilities
**This is a role for a self-starter with a keen eye and mind for raising the Foundation's profile across a variety of channels.
**Under the supervision of the Foundation's Vice President, and close communication with the Foundation's President, this person will be responsible for implementing RFF's marketing and communications' plan. 
**This role is 50% FTE.
Key responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:
**Structuring, writing and publishing a regular newsletter
**Writing and disseminating a blog
**Managing the Foundation's social media presence
**Maintaining an editorial and conference presentation calendar
**Collecting content from grantees, reports, and other sources to include across channels
**Research and writing as needed
**Assistance with conference planning, creating presentations, submitting applications, etc.
**Coordinating and implementing RFF convenings held in San Francisco, or in other cities
**Contributing to innovative ways the Foundation can increase its thought leadership
**Other administrative support as needed
Minimum Qualifications
**1-2 years experience with marketing and communications tasks
**Self-starter who can work independently
**Strong attention to detail
**Excellent writing and research skills
**Strong organizational skills
**Bachelor's degree
**Able to work well in a team
**Sense of humor
**Ability to occasionally work outside of normal business hours 
**Familiarity with the field of philanthropy preferred
**Familiarity with civic engagement, leadership development, community college a plus
To Apply:
**Send a cover letter and resume in PDF format with "I Believe in Investing in Young People" in the subject line. 
**Attach a writing sample (PDF format) that highlights your writing and research skills.

collection1.title: Member Services Associate (San Francisco, CA)

body.text: About TaskRabbit:TaskRabbit is all about empowering people to do what they love - our TaskRabbits, our TaskPosters and importantly, our employees. We were founded back in 2008 and are one of the pioneers of the Sharing Economy.  Since then, we've been building a peer-to-peer marketplace that safely and reliably connects neighbors to get things done through the melding of social, location-based, and mobile technologies.We've raised close to $40 million to date through notable investors including Founders Fund, First Round Capital, Floodgate Fund, LightSpeed Venture Partners, Baseline Ventures and Shasta Ventures.We're a mission-driven company.  Our culture is collaborative, scrappy and fast-paced.  We're looking for talented, entrepreneurially minded and data-driven people who also have a passion for helping people do what they love - and having a ton of fun while they're at it.About the job: Member Services AssociateThe Member Services Associate will be a part of a team helping to ensure above and beyond "Wow" level user experiences across all regions of product interactions. You will be primarily providing telephone support, as well as handling communications via live chat & email. You would be managing the relationship with our users and be the first point of contact when issues arise. You will have the support of the Member Services Manager and the amazing TaskRabbit team. This is a full-time job at a bustling, dog friendly startup, that includes early morning, late night and/or weekend hours.  We're hiring for this position ASAP, so hop to it and apply! Responsibilities: Understand the entire online and offline TaskRabbit experience from A to Z. Handle member issues efficiently as it pertains to their accounts and/or Tasks. Handle dispute escalation in accordance to existing policies and procedures. Work with the management team and peers to effectively resolve high priority member issues. Walk potential members through the TaskRabbit posting/bidding experience. Record and communicate bugs and feedback to the developers and the management team. Stay informed of all site and policy changes as they occur and be able to articulate them accurately. Requirements: An unmistakeable love for TaskRabbit: You know who we are, and you think we're the best!  You also must have a TaskRabbit account and posted at least 1 Task. Experienced: Previous experience in a call center or fast paced customer service environment with a ticketing system. Outstanding phone support skills are a must. Excellent customer service skills: The individual must exhibit courtesy, kindness, efficiency and helpfulness. Excellent writing skills: The individual must have a good command of grammar, spelling and syntax. Problem solving: Can identify and resolves problems efficiently, while gathering and analyzing data skillfully. Interpersonal skills: Remains open to others' ideas and exhibits willingness to try new things. Communication skills: The individual speaks clearly, calmly and persuasively, in positive or negative situations. Dependability: The individual is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance. Education: Bachelor's degree (preferable but not required) plus a minimum of 2 - 3 years of related work experience. Schedule flexibility: This position is full-time and may include early mornings, nights, and/or weekends. Perks:In addition to working with the smartest team of entrepreneurs, advisors, and investors on the planet, TaskRabbit team members get a ton of perks: Dolla Billz: Cash comp paired with equity -- we are looking for the best and will pay them accordingly Challenge: The opportunity for growth in a fast-paced, progressive company is yours for the taking Tasks: A monthly Task stipend, which is sort of like having your own 24/7 concierge army Benefits: Great health coverage with dental and vision benefits, a flexible spending account, 401k plans and ample PTO Education: A series of Lunch and Learn events -- we call it Learnch -- along with in-office mentoring opportunities and access to the TaskRabbit library Office: A huge, dog-friendly SOMA loft built to accommodate collaboration, with two fully stocked kitchens and a game room. Plus, daily lunches on the company's dime Entertainment: Tons of video games, ping pong and awesome quarterly off-site adventures! Click Here to Apply
