collection1.title: Payroll Director - San Francisco Unified School District (downtown / civic / van ness)

body.text:
San Francisco Unified School District IT Department
0993 Payroll Director - SFUSD
One (1) Position, Permanent Exempt (PEX)
Competitive $102,605 - $118,390/year
CLICK HERE TO APPLY
Appointment Type:
Permanent Exempt Civil Service (PEX)
Introduction:
The San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) is the highest performing large urban school district in the state of California, educating over 55,000 students every year. The mission of the San Francisco Unified School District is to provide each student with an equal opportunity to succeed by promoting intellectual growth, creativity, self-discipline, cultural and linguistic sensitivity, democratic responsibility, economic competence, and physical and mental health so that each student can achieve his or her maximum potential.
The San Francisco Unified School District is recruiting for a talented Payroll Director to lead the Payroll Operations Department. The SFUSD Payroll Operations Department consists of a dedicated team of Payroll Specialists who perform all payroll related operations. The Payroll operations team performs highly skilled work in our multi-departmental unionized organization to process payroll for multiple payroll cycles.
Position Description:
Under general direction, manages the operations of the Payroll functions for the San Francisco Unified School District, including the processing of payroll for all SFUSD employees, certificated and classified on varying pay schedules. The Director oversees budget, resource management and strategic planning, as well as integration of related business functions (Human Resources, Information Technology, and Finance Budget) as they affect payroll operations.
Distinguishing Features:
The position reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer, and manages plans anddirects the Payroll System for the San Francisco Unified School District
Supervision Exercised
The Payroll Director - SFUSD manages a variety of managerial, professional, technical and clerical staff.
Examples of Important and Essential Duties:
Manages and directs payroll functions of the SFUSD, which supports 10,000 certificated and classified personnel employed in approximately 135 school sites and administrative facilities, which utilize web-based time reporting systems.
Develops and monitors division budget for personnel, equipment and supplies.
Ensures efficiency and effectiveness of organizational staffing patterns, service levels, and administrative systems; directs the identification and analyses of service enhancements.
Provides consultation, advice and support to functional managers; oversees the processing of all postpay, garnishments, Tax Sheltered Annuities (TSA), general deductions, retirement deductions and journal entries; ensures timely and accurate printing, sorting and mailing of pay warrants, direct deposits, W2's, and quarterly taxes.
Monitors compliance with all applicable laws, ordinances and regulations, including California Labor Code; oversees the preparation and submission of State and Federal mandated reports.
Prepares statistical analysis and reports.
Provides staff training in methods, procedures and utilization of payroll software for payroll staff and site-based timekeepers; develops and implements District payroll, and timekeeping policies and procedures in compliance with Federal and State laws and Board of Education policies and administrative regulations.
Performs related duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge of: Federal, State and local labor laws and regulations; computerized payroll systems; payroll tax laws; payroll procedures of a large organization; payroll principles and practices including collective bargaining agreements-derived requirements.
Ability to: Analyze and prepare detailed plans and schedules; organize, direct and facilitate task completion; communicate effectively through both verbal and written means including production of operations manuals and checklists, systems descriptions, applications specifications, and internal and external memos and letters; supervise managerial, professional, technical and clerical staff; utilize standard office equipment and software, including Microsoft Office, PeopleSoft HRMS 8.3 and PeopleSoft Financials 8.4.
Minimum Qualifications:
TRAINING: Possession of a baccalaureate degree in Business Administration, Public Administration or closely related field from an accredited college or university.
AND;
EXPERIENCE: At least seven (7) years of supervisory experience, five (5) of which must be at management level supervising supervisors in a large payroll division with computer payroll systems.
(One (1) year of experience is equivalent to 2000 hours)
*Please note: Meeting the Minimum Qualifications does not guarantee applicants an interview or further advancement in the selection process.
Substitution:
Any combination of training and experience as described above that could likely provide the required knowledge and abilities may be qualifying.
Desirable Qualifications:
Experience supervising a payroll division in a school district - responsible for processing certificated and classified employees' pay treatment through a computerized payroll system.
Knowledge of California Education Code employment provisions.
Practices and procedures of the California State Teachers' Retirement System (CalSTRS). 
Practices and procedures of the San Francisco City and County Employees' Retirement System (SFERS). 
*The stated desirable qualifications may be used to identify job finalists at the end of the selection process when candidates are referred for hiring.
How to Apply:
Applications for City and County of San Francisco jobs are being accepted through an online process. Visit www.jobaps.com/sf to register an account (if you have not already done so) and begin the application process.
Select the desired job announcement 
Select "Apply" and read and acknowledge the information 
Select either "I am a New User" if you have not previously registered, or "I have Registered Previously" 
Follow instructions on the screen 
Computers are available for the public (from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday) to file online applications in the lobby of the Dept. of Human Resources at 1 South Van Ness Avenue, 4th Floor, San Francisco.
Applicants may be contacted by email about this announcement and, therefore, it is their responsibility to ensure that their registered email address is accurate and kept up-to-date. Also, applicants must ensure that email from CCSF is not blocked on their computer by a spam filter. To prevent blocking, applicants should set up their email to accept CCSF mail from the following addresses (@sfusd.edu, @sfgov.org, @sfdpw.org, @sfport.com, @flysfo.com, @sfwater.org, @sfdph.org, @asianart.org, @sfmta.com, @sfpl.org).
Applicants will receive a confirmation email that their online application has been received in response to every announcement for which they file. Applicants should retain this confirmation email for their records. Failure to receive this email means that the online application was not submitted or received.
All work experience, education, training and other information substantiating how you meet the minimum qualifications must be included on your application by the filing deadline. Information submitted after the filing deadline will not be considered in determining whether you meet the minimum qualifications.
Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, disqualification or may lead to lower scores.
If you have any questions regarding this recruitment or application process, please contact the exam analyst, Scott DeWolfe, by telephone at 415-241-6101 or by email at dewolfes@sfusd.edu.
Note:
You must attach an updated cover letter and resume to the application; however, resumes will not be accepted in lieu of a completed application.
Make sure that your application and any attachments to the application submitted at the time of filing are complete and accurate and include details on all experience, education, training and other information that qualifies you for this position. Failure to submit a complete and accurate application at the time of filing may result in your ineligibility for this position or inability to receive full credit for scoring purposes. Any new information concerning work experience, education, training and other information that is submitted after the filing deadline may not be used for scoring or considered to determine whether you meet the minimum qualifications. 
Conclusion:
Verification: 
Applicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point in the application, examination or departmental selection process. Note: Falsifying one's education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco.
http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#verification
Requests:
Applicants with disabilities who meet the minimum eligibility requirements for this job announcement can find information on requesting a reasonable ADA Accommodation at: 
http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#applicantswithdisabilities 
Information regarding requests for Veterans Preference can be found at: 
http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#veteranspreference
Seniority Credit in Promotional Exams:Information regarding seniority credit can be found at: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#senioritycredit
General Information concerning City and County of San Francisco Employment Policies and Procedures:
Important Employment Information for the City and County of San Francisco can be obtained at http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20 or hard copy at 1 South Van Ness Avenue, 4th Floor.
Terms Of Announcement:Applicants must be guided solely by the provisions of this announcement, including requirements, time periods and other particulars, except when superseded by federal, state or local laws, rules or regulations. Clerical errors may be corrected by the posting the correction on the Department of Human Resources website at
www.jobaps.com/sf
The terms of this announcement may be appealed under Civil Service Commission (CSC) Rule 111A.35.1. The standard for the review of such appeals is 'abuse of discretion' or 'no rational basis' for establishing the position description, the minimum qualifications and/or the certification rule. Appeals must include a written statement of the item(s) being contested and the specific reason(s) why the cited item(s) constitute(s) abuse of discretion by the Human Resources Director. Appeals must be submitted to the Executive Officer of the CSC within five (5) business days of the announcement issuance date.
Copies of Application Documents:
Applicants are encouraged to keep copies of all documents submitted. Submitted documents become a permanent part of the exam records and will not be returned. The hiring department may require applicants to submit the same documents and/or additional documents at a later date.
Right to Work:
All persons entering the City and County of San Francisco workforce are required to provide verification of authorization to work in the United States.
The San Francisco Unified School District is committed to maintaining an educational environment where all persons who participate in school programs and activities can work and learn together in an atmosphere free of all forms of harassment or intimidation. The Board prohibits sexual harassment of students, employees or other persons, at school or at school-sponsored or school-related activities. San Francisco Unified School District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; or on the basis of a person's association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.
Minorities, Women, and Persons with Disabilities are Encouraged to Apply
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
Benefits:
San Francisco Unified School District offers a competitive benefits package. 
Click to View San Francisco Unified School District Benefits Information 
Please follow the instructions for the application after clicking "Click Here to Apply" below. You must attach an updated cover letter and resume to the application. Failure to attach the required documents will result in disqualification.

Monica Vasquez
Chief Human Resources Officer

collection1.title: AIDS/LifeCycle Logistics Manager

body.text:
POSITION SUMMARY:
The AIDS/LifeCycle Logistics Manager works with the rest of the Logistics team to develop and manage projects and tasks related to the AIDS/LifeCycle event. This includes developing and managing relationships with event vendors to guarantee best pricing for event needs; year round storage and event supplies management; development, management, and execution of plans for Orientation Day, Opening Ceremony, Closing Ceremony, Upload and Download. The Logistics Manager also supervises the Logistics Coordinator and the Seasonal Logistics Assistant in San Francisco.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Logistics: 
1.Develops and manages relationships with various route and event supplies vendors as assigned by the Logistics Director
2.Manages and maintains the year round storage facilities that house the supplies for the annual event
3.Develops and manages the supplies budget along with the Logistics Director, forecasts the need and purchase of all supplies for the annual event, and strategizes deployment of supplies on event.
4.Plans and executes all aspects of the mobilization (upload) and demobilization (download) for the event
5.Plans and manages all aspects of Orientation Day onsite
6.Plans and manages all aspects of Opening Ceremony onsite
7.Develops and maintains solid working relationships with volunteer Roadie leadership to ensure successful execution of the annual event.
Management/Administrative:
1.Manages the Logistics Coordinator in SF who is responsible for permitting, insurance, notifications, billing, production binders, staff hotels and meals, route hotels volunteer projects, supply ordering.
2.Manages the Seasonal Logistics Assistant
3.Manages the Logistics supply budget
4.Completes status reports for management
Other Skills and Abilities: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, strong attention to detail, and management of employees.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree and two years special event production experience; or four years special event production experience required. Experience coordinating logistics for non-profit organizations or charitable causes preferred. CA driver's license required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Skill in operating office equipment such as a personal computer, copy machine and telephone system. Ability to perform routine bending, stooping, twisting, and reaching. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Required to attend entire mobilization / demobilization of AIDS/LifeCycle, and AIDS/LiefCycle event (a two week period) and various participant events which require several hours of standing, lifting, walking and carrying.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Market: This position is primarily located at 1035 Market Street; San Francisco, however may require traveling to other office locations or off-site meetings as required by the job.
The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required for personnel so classified.
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT:
The San Francisco AIDS Foundation is an Equal Opportunity employer. We actively seek applications from people living with HIV/AIDS, and other disabilities, women, gay men, lesbians, transgender, queer and people of color.
APPLICATION PROCESS:
Please visit our careers page at:
http://www.sfaf.org/about-us/careers/
POSITION OPEN UNTIL FILLED
NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE

collection1.title: Clinical Resolve Supervisor
collection1.body:
Job title: Clinical Resolve Supervisor
Schedule: FTE $55K Starting Immediately
Location: Homeless Children's Network (HCN) 3265 St., Ste. 404, SF
Supervisor: Program Director
Be part of a diverse, strength-based, community oriented team providing individual, group and family therapy to homeless children and youth, ages 0-17 and their families, as well as adults. Homeless Children's Network (www.hcnkids.org) is a community-based organization providing mental health, family support, and community education services to children and families who are homeless. This position will begin immediately until June 30th, 2014 then negotiate after that.
Summary: 
The Clinical Resolve Supervisor is responsible for the overall performance of the clinical services programs. The Clinical Resolve Supervisor supervises all clinical staff, as well as monitors clinical documentation and provides input, in coordination with the Program Director in clinical policies and procedures. 
Responsibilities: 
• Supervision of clinical staff, including weekly individual and group supervision 
• Training of clinical staff, including onsite in-service trainings facilitated by the Clinical Supervisor or professional consultants regarding relevant clinical topics and dissemination of information about trainings in the community
• Recruitment and supervision of interns-including weekly individual and group supervision, communication with intern programs from local clinical graduate degree programs, communication with field supervisors for current interns and completion of required evaluation documentation for interns. 
• Monitoring of all clinical documentation, including all charting, monthly tabulation and billing documents
Minimum Requirements: 
Must be a licensed L.C.S.W. or licensed MFT. Must be licensed and capable of signing off on MFTI and MSW hours.
• Bi-cultural experience and Spanish speaking -- a plus, but not necessary. 
• EPSDT experience required. 
• Applicant MUST have play therapy experience and experience working with families.
How to Apply: 
Please type the position you are applying for in the subject line. 
We will NOT consider applicants that do not include a resume and cover letter.
Due to the high number of resumes we receive, we are not able to respond to each applicant. However, we thank you for considering a position with Homeless Children's Network and with you well in your job search. 
Please submit resume and cover letter addressed to Human Resources via email. Thank you.

collection1.title: Software Engineer - Infrastructure (SOMA / south beach)

body.text:
Do you want to be part of contributing to one of the fastest growing and coolest companies on the planet? Do you want to make a meaningful contribution to its success? If you answered yes to these questions, then this job may be for you!
We'd ask what systems you have managed before or what language you program in or how many years of experience you have, but that's just not how we roll. Are you smart? Do you work your ass off? Can you learn new concepts quickly and without hesitation? Are you fun to hang with for hours on end -- because we'll be spending a hell of a lot of time together changing transportation in urban environments around the world.
We need talented individuals to join the team and help us to create and maintain a 24x7, no downtime infrastructure / system. The right person will be working with great technologies and amazingly smart people to help improve our game changing service. You won't regret spending some time getting to know the Uber team!
Here are the kinds of skills we are looking for:
* Significant programming experience in C, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, etc 
* Experience developing, releasing, and maintaining large-scale software applications 
* Real-time failover principles, processes and architectures 
* Ability to debug programs from an iPhone on the middle of a dance floor 
* Multi-datacenter and other varieties of hybrid infrastructures 
* Systems monitoring, alerting and analytics 
* Ping Pong chops 
* Driven, focused self-starters who take ownership of their work
Bonus points if you have...
* Insightful opinions about systems architecture 
* A GitHub account with some cool projects in it 
* The ability to find and debug a variety of problems during emergency situations 
* Experienced in developing custom solutions for systems monitoring, deployments, continuous integration, etc.
We're bringing Uber to every major city in the world. We need brains and passion to make it happen and make it happen in style.
To apply, please visit: http://grnh.se/v1g73j

collection1.title: Head of Conservation (downtown / civic / van ness)
collection1.compensation: compensation: Generous compensation and benefits package

body.text:
The Asian Art Museum is seeking an experienced conservator with strong managerial, leadership, and communication skills to supervise and coordinate the staff and operations of the Conservation Laboratory for this world-renowned collection.
Reporting to the Director of Museum Services, the Head of Conservation directs and manages the staff and activities of the Conservation department; supervises and performs highly skilled conservation work, including examination, research, treatment, documentation, and preparation for exhibition of Asian art objects. S/he manages all administrative duties related to the operations of the department, and serves as the museum's chief spokesperson on conservation issues.
The Head of Conservation determines standards and procedures for the care of Asian artworks within the museum, in exhibitions, and on loan; devises restoration and preservation methods and techniques; consults with curators, scientists, and external conservators; liaises with outside specialists such as painting mounters and framers; and provides information on conservation matters to museum staff, colleagues and the public.
The ideal candidate will have a significant record of professional accomplishments that may also include publishing and research. Bringing energy and vision, the candidate will be able to anticipate the future needs of the institution and to design effective systems for meeting the museum's obligations with regard to the care and preservation of the collection.
QUALIFICATIONS
• Master's Degree in Art Conservation from a recognized college or university, or a Master of Arts Degree in Art History with a Certificate in Conservation from a recognized Conservation Training Program
• Eight (8) years of verifiable museum conservation experience, beyond the degree or certificate, with the techniques, materials, and equipment used in the conservation of Asian art objects; or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience; experience must include at least two (2) years of supervision
• Demonstrated knowledge of: the technology, materials, and equipment used in the conservation of works of Asian art; procedures relating to the examination and the preventative and corrective treatment of art objects; the environmental and handling requirements for storage, exhibition, and travel of art objects
• Demonstrated knowledge of advanced conservation equipment including polarized light microscopy, x-ray fluorescence, x-radiography and short-wave infrared imaging and digital imaging
• Ability to: examine and determine the condition and conservation needs of works of art; plan, direct, and implement research strategies to determine the date, authenticity, and fabrication of Asian art objects; work collaboratively with Curatorial staff in research project.
• Ability to provide sound advice and recommendations regarding the design of facilities to ensure the proper display, storage, and treatment of works of art
• Ability to: organize and manage complex projects; analyze complicated administrative problems, evaluate alternative solutions and adopt effective courses of action; develop and manage budgets
• Ability to: supervise, direct, motivate, and evaluate staff, interns, and volunteers; establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships with museum staff, visitors, volunteers, donors, and representatives of other museums
• Strong leadership, interpersonal, planning, and organizational skills; excellent written and oral communication skills; effective presentation, negotiation, problem solving, conflict resolution skills
COMPENSATION
Generous compensation and benefits package
APPLICATION PROCEDURE
Apply online at http://asianart.snaphire.com/jobdetails?ajid=DAfA7 or
Send a letter of interest and resume ASAP to:
HUMAN RESOURCES
Asian Art Museum
200 Larkin Street
San Francisco, CA 94102 
FAX: 415.861.2359
* The Asian Art Museum is one of the largest museums in the Western world devoted exclusively to Asian art and culture. Home to more than 18,000 works of art from over 40 Asian countries, we strive to be a catalyst for discovery, dialogue, and inspiration. With Asia as our lens and art as our cornerstone, we spark connections across cultures and through time, igniting curiosity, conversation, and creativity.*

collection1.title: Judicial Assistant (San Francisco)
collection1.compensation: compensation: $4,435 - $5,391 per month (Starting salary may vary between $4,435 and $4,657 per month)
collection1.body:
The California Court of Appeal, First Appellate District, located in San Francisco, is accepting applications for a full-time Judicial Assistant position in Central Staff. This is a limited term assignment for up to two years with a possibility of a regular assignment offer at the end of the term.
The Judicial Assistant will provide a variety of administrative, paralegal, and legal secretarial support to justices and staff. Applicants invited to an interview will be required to complete a timed, in-house assessment.
RESPONSIBILITIES
• Provide support to appellate court justices, court attorneys, and/or other professional staff in the processing of appeals and writs; 
• Prepare final opinions by verifying that all facts referenced in draft opinions are supported by the clerk's and reporter's transcripts, administrative record, exhibits, or other documents; 
• Verify legal authorities cited in draft opinions using resources found in the law library and computer data bases; 
• Edit, proofread, and review draft opinions and court orders for correctness with respect to grammar, spelling, punctuation, content, and organization; conform draft opinions to uniform style using the California Style Manual;
• Organize, maintain and route work, set priorities and follow up to ensure coordination and completion of assigned work; exercise skill in setting priorities that accurately reflect the importance of assigned responsibilities; 
• Work closely with Clerk's Office staff to ensure that materials are received and sent out in timely fashion;
• Communicate with the Reporter of Decisions regarding stylistic requirements and content of opinions; 
• Track cases for timeliness and coordinate case deadlines with staff attorneys and justices;
• Use word processing programs to prepare and edit documents, including draft opinions;
• Proofread and inspect galley proofs of published opinions for accuracy; 
• Answer and screen telephone calls and deliver messages; open and distribute mail; 
• Act as a backup to the Receptionist, which includes being the initial public contact person in the main reception area, answering and directing the telephone calls from multiple lines, and other related clerical duties; and
• Perform other related work as assigned.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Equivalent to graduation from high school and six years of legal secretarial experience, including four years of experience in technical legal research and processing 
OR
Three years as a Judicial Secretary II with the judicial branch. 
Directly related college-level course work may be substituted for the required experience on a year-for-year basis.
Knowledge and Abilities: 
Superior knowledge of proper English grammar, spelling, court procedures, and legal cite checking. Familiarity with the California Style Manual. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, use internal databases, perform advanced word processing functions using recent versions of Word, work under a variety of deadlines, understand and carry out oral and written directions, and work cooperatively with those contacted in the course of work. Ability to communicate effectively in English, verbally and in writing, maintain confidentiality, and use initiative and independent judgment within established procedural guidelines. Must possess excellent organizational skills. Ability to prioritize and coordinate multiple work activities while maintaining accuracy. Must be able to lift 40 pounds.
TO APPLY
In order to be considered, please submit an application and a response to the supplemental questionnaire. The First Appellate District requires that you include a resume with your application. To ensure earliest consideration, please apply by April 18, 2014; however, this position will remain open until filled. 
1. Apply online by visiting our Web site at www.courts.ca.gov/careers. Please include your response to the supplemental questionnaire and attach your resume.
OR
2. Options for obtaining the employment application:
• Please download a copy from the Careers page on our website under the Special Access and Paper Application section, or
• Visit the Court of Appeal, First Appellate District, Reception, 350 McAllister Street, San Francisco, CA 94102 between the hours of 9:00 AM - 4:30 PM, or
• Contact the First District Court of Appeal, Human Resources at 415-865-7369.
Please submit your completed application, response to the supplemental questionnaire, and resume to the following address: 
First District Court of Appeal 
Attn: Human Resources, Req. #: 3834
350 McAllister Street 
San Francisco, CA 94102
415-865-7369
415-865-4272 Telecommunications Device for the Deaf
BENEFITS
Highlights of our current benefits package include:
- Health/Dental/Vision benefits program
- CalPERS Retirement Plan
- Choice of Annual Leave or Sick/Vacation Leave
- 13 paid holidays per calendar year
- 1 personal holiday per year
- Transit pass subsidy 
- 401(k) and 457 deferred compensation plans
- Employee Assistance Program
- Basic Life and AD&D Insurance
The First District Court of Appeal is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

collection1.title: VALET PARKING ATTENDANTS-estimate of $16-$18/hour with tips ($13hr) (SF Bay Area)
collection1.compensation: compensation: $13.00 per hour, plus tips ($3-$5/hour, sometimes more)
collection1.body:
Soiree Valet is the top valet parking company in the Bay Area. We park guests' cars at special events such as weddings or company parties. We also have some work parking cars in parking lots at locations such as shopping malls or hospitals. Our team is growing and we are currently recruiting part-time valet parking attendants. 
This is fun and rewarding team work and there is a lot of flexibility regarding which shifts you can work. You decide what day, what time and how often you want to work; 
work assignments are available on line and you can match your availability with open shifts. 
We are always looking for good, eager workers. Your hustle, attitude, & enthusiasm help make these events a success and you will be rewarded for it. Of course your customer service skills are as important as your passion for driving. 
We provide a higher level of service and project this to the customers. If you are clean-cut with a professional attitude, a clean driving record and background, please apply. 
You will work as part of a team & there is the possibility for promotion in the company. 
Please only respond if you: 
Are at least 19 years old. 
Have the ability to drive a manual transmission (standard/stick shift) on an expert level. 
Have a valid California driver's license with a clean driving record (no more than 1 point in 3 years, no DUI's and no at-fault accidents.) 
Have a conservative, clean cut, professional appearance and demeanor. 
Are available to work some weeknights, some weekends, and/or occasional daytimes. 
The starting pay is $13/hour + tips. Typically tips average $2-$5 per hour, so it is possible to make $18/hour. 
Please call 415-694-7522 to set up an interview. If no one is available to take your call, please leave your name and callback number along with a brief message explaining how you meet our criteria. We will call you back as soon as possible. 
Resumes are also welcomed at hiring@soireevalet.com. If you send a resume please cut and paste it into the body of the email as we will not open attachments. 
Feel free to check our website for more information about who we are and what sets us apart from other valet parking companies: www.soireevalet.com

collection1.title: Project Coordinator (financial district)
collection1.body:
Skidmore, Owings & Merrill LLP's commitment to design excellence--coupled with our sophistication in building technology--has resulted in some of the most important contributions to the built environment of this century. As an interdisciplinary practice, we have award-winning studios in architecture, structural engineering, urban design and master planning, interior design, and graphic design.
Our landmark projects include Sears Tower and John Hancock Tower in Chicago, Lever House in New York, and the Bank of America Headquarters Tower in San Francisco. Recent work in San Francisco includes the iconic San Francisco Airport International Terminal, the Transbay Terminal Area Master Plan, and the St. Regis Hotel & Residences, adjacent to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. 
In keeping with our legacy as pioneers of design and building technology, we are increasingly incorporating building information modeling (BIM) systems into our design process. Our firm was also awarded a patent for a device developed by our structural engineering practice that mitigates seismic damage in buildings. 
Our far-reaching portfolio includes higher education buildings; health care facilities; civic buildings; residential developments; corporate offices; financial institutions; commercial and retail facilities; religious buildings; airports; and recreational and sports facilities. 
SOM is an international practice, with offices in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Chicago, New York, Washington D.C., London, Shanghai, and Hong Kong.
Primary Responsibilities: 
• Contribute to SOM's vision by enabling clear communication among team members, consultants and clients. Promote professional relationships internally and externally.
• Support Project Manager as point of contact for clients, external consultants and vendors.
• Prepare and review project memos, correspondence, contracts and schedules for professional services; communicate daily with team. 
• Schedule client meetings. Record minutes of these meetings and document action items.
• Maintain and update project data (in various mediums including hard copy project files, network drives etc.) in a timely manner to insure accurate reporting of earnings and accurate billings.
• Manage and coordinate multiple schedules, both individual and project specific.
• Initiate and coordinate team travel arrangements.
• Perform various support duties for Project Manager, Project Architect and team, including completion of expense reports, time cards, and calendar management.
• Dedicate the necessary time beyond routine hours (as required, including last minute needs) to assist in meeting business commitments.
Qualifications and skill set: 
• A highly professional, creative and committed individual with proven technical and organizational skills.
• A proven work ethic and the ability to anticipate needs, service clients, initiate decisions and coordinate the activities of others.
• 3+ years professional work experience in an office environment working with and as part of a team, preferably in a professional services organization.
• Prior financial, accounting or bookkeeping experience.
• Strong command of Microsoft Office programs, especially Word and Excel.
• Strong proofreading skills.
• Exceptional written and communication skills 
• Bachelors degree desirable. 
• Prior experience working with an architecture, engineering or construction firm highly desirable.
• InDesign, Photoshop, Autocad, MS Project and Illustrator skills highly desirable.
This position is full time and will be based in San Francisco, California.
To apply, please submit cover letter, resume and portfolio at www.som.com/careers under the SF - Project Coordinator requisition.
SOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer that strictly adheres to all Affirmative Action guidelines and regulations.

collection1.title: Engineers: RSVP here for our Happy Hour at our new SoMa digs! (SOMA / south beach)

body.text:
We are SoMa's hottest new startup and we are building a team of badass engineers to help us take the world's fastest growing e-commerce solution to the next level.
Did you miss us providing breakfast at the bus stops during our #poached campaign? Are you looking for a company that isn't afraid to take risks or think outside the box? Did you hear about us the San Francisco Business Journal, on KGO, or in Business Insider and want to learn more? 
Join us this Thursday evening, April 3rd for #parched - beer, food and live music at our new office in SoMa. Bring your resume and you will also have a chance to win your very own Google Glass.
#parched will be a chance for engineers to find out more about our mission, our team, and our world class e-commerce product. 
This will be a casual happy hour, just stop by when you can. To RSVP, please click the "This Job Is For Me" link and fill out your information. We will then send you details about the event, including time and location.
We look forward to seeing you!
Click Here to Apply: 
This job's for me!

collection1.title: Y work for 1 startup, work for 50K - Software Eng (PHP, Ruby) Product (SOMA)

body.text:
Bigcommerce, the fastest growing SaaS e-Commerce platform in the world, is seeking experienced Software Engineers to join the Product team. You'll work closely with our dedicated team of Software Engineers, Product Managers and Designers to help us improve our industry leading software used by millions of people every day. You can help build the next-generation systems behind Bigcommerce's products, create web applications that power billions in commerce, build high volume servers and be a part of a team that's working to empower merchants around the globe.
What you will do:
• Create web applications using primarily PHP and Ruby
• Implement web interfaces using XHTML, CSS, and JavaScript 
• Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications 
• Work closely with operations and infrastructure to build improve the architecture while building and scaling back-end services 
• Build report interfaces and data feeds
Who you are:
• B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related field
• Knowledge of perl or PHP or Ruby
• Knowledge of relational databases and SQL, preferably MySQL
• Desirable is knowledge of web technologies: XHTML, HTML5 and Angular.js (or similar knockout.js, ember.js, backbone.js)
• Experience building highly scalable web applications a must
• Must be prepared to learn new technologies
• Have a demonstrated ability to get shit done
Why you should work here:
• An opportunity to be both emotionally and financially invested in the fastest-growing company in a fast-growing space
• Knowing you are democratizing e-commerce by helping small businesses owners realize their dreams of selling online
• Three especially cool offices in Sydney, Austin and San Francisco
• A fully stocked kitchen and beer fridge
• Excellent insurance and other benefits
• A fast-paced yet fun environment where we celebrate and reward success
Our Mission
"Be the #1 e-commerce provider in the world by creating and delivering software that changes people's lives"
Our Core Values
Be honest - always
Simplify, simplify, simplify
Clients, not customers
Think BIG
Smart and gets things done
A team on a mission
Click Here to Apply: 
This job's for me!

collection1.title: *Business/Client Development Professional at a cutting edge start up*
collection1.body:
Our client is a fast growing, venture-backed business based in San Francisco. They solve real and challenging problems for a large base of highly recognizable customers. Their success is in a large part due to the collaborative nature of their business and dynamic company culture. They offer competitive compensation, benefits and perks reflect the high value they place on their people. 
Position Summary:
This person is responsible for selling the full spectrum of our products and services, including private-cloud solutions, both to direct and through channel partners.
Primary Responsibilities:
• Represent the company to the customer in all sales-related activities in the role as key client contact
• Develop strategic business plan to maintain current client base and generate new business opportunities through prospecting customer
• Drive revenue and close new business sales by securing demonstrations and meetings with key decision-makers in enterprise companies. Decision makers include a wide range of CXO marketing and demand generation titles, as well as Corporate Communications, IT, Procurement and Sales
• Build strong, lasting relationships with customers by learning their business objectives and needs
• Recommend solutions, prepare and present proposals and negotiate contracts
• Maintain pipeline of forecasted sales to meet sales quotas set by the company
• Achieve and exceed all individual sales targets
• Stay up-to-date on the latest developments, trends, and regulations in the market place by attending sales seminars, meetings and educational activities
• Keep current with all our product information, pricing and contract terms
• Travel, as required, to meet prospects and customers face-to-face
Required Skills and Experience:
• Ability to converse in a knowledgeable manner on various industry topics and Internet technologies in order to sell opportunities to prospective customers
• Ability to create successful sales strategies for our products and/or services
• Ability and skills to develop relationships quickly, both internally within our company and externally with prospect/customers/partners
• Highly developed organizational, planning and management skills
• Comfortable working in a fast-paced, quota-driven environment with changing needs and requirements
Candidates that meet all of the above qualifications should submit their confidential résumé to: Mallory West at: mallory@agency360sf.com
Agency360 thanks you in advance for your inquiry with best wishes for your continued success. Please visit us at: www.agency360sf.com

collection1.title: Are you SaaS-y enough? - System Engineer (Linux, Perl, PHP, Ruby) (SOMA)

body.text:
Bigcommerce, the fastest growing SaaS e-Commerce platform in the world, is looking for a System Engineer to work on site reliability, and be part of the Site Reliability and Operations (SRO) team responsible for ensuring the Bigcommerce platform is available, reliable, and fast, at all times. Through small teams based in Sydney, Australia; San Francisco, CA; and Austin, TX, the SRO team provides 24x7 oversight and support of the infrastructure and services that power the Bigcommerce platform.
What you will do:
• Making sure the Bigcommerce platform meets or exceeds organization goals for availability, capacity, efficiency, scalability, and performance by engineering reliability into software and systems
• Manage the infrastructure running production infrastructure, including Linux servers, firewalls, network infrastructure, database clusters running MySQL, Elasticsearch clusters and a variety of services in Amazon Web Services 
• Rethink and influence strategy and roadmap to handle ongoing performance, scale, and availability requirements 
• Participate in performance analysis and tuning, service capacity planning and demand forecasting 
• Master the Bigcommerce platform so that you can provide end to end troubleshooting to determine the root cause of problems
• Apply in-depth systems analysis to project-based work, design solutions to issues, and evaluate their effectiveness
• Strategize with fellow engineers on complex problems, and make decisions and recommendations about systems improvements after analyzing possible courses of conduct
• Communicate effectively with fellow SROs and other engineering teams, and describe problems succinctly with sufficient detail that you can hand-off an ongoing problem to another team or a peer for completion
• Perform proactive daily system monitoring including reviewing system and application logs as well as responding to, triaging, troubleshooting and remediating incidents
• Use your broad knowledge of systems administration and networking principles preventing and troubleshooting incidents and improving operating procedures
• Repair and recover from hardware or software failures. Coordinate and communicate with impacted stakeholders and clients, escalating where appropriate
• Ensure staging and development environments remain in parity with production
• Manage backups, configurations, documentation, monitoring, logging and much more
• Perform periodic on-call duty as part of a global team
Who you are:
• You are a strong Software Engineer who is passionate about large-scale systems. You work as a member of a team, helping the group come up with a better solution than you would as individuals. Ideally, you have experience with performance, scalability, and reliability issues of 24x7 commercial services
• You're Agatha Christie/Sherlock Holmes with a terminal emulator, possessing excellent analytical skills and intuition when it comes to solving problems in your production environment
• You're obsessive compulsive, in a good way. You want your systems and scripts to be clean, well-documented and comprehensible. Three years later, when one of your peers opens your script, they sing your praises (instead of cursing out loud)
• You're a Zen Master in times of emergency, balancing Excellent Judgement with Bravery when applying fixes for production problems
• You must be able to work independently and multi-task several concurrent problems, perform triage and prioritization as necessary through the exercise of discretion and independent judgment, including marshaling the appropriate and necessary internal resources during high-pressure situations
• You are a self-starter with a strong sense of responsibility and problem ownership who can commit to driving issues to completion; someone who can adapt quickly, and is capable of compiling together working solutions across a broad technology stack and working with engineering teams on long-term fixes
• BA/BS degree in computer science or related field (3 years relevant work experience in lieu of degree)
• At least 3 years of proficiency in operating and troubleshooting in an enterprise Linux environment
• Expert knowledge in shell scripting and at least one of the following languages is required: Perl, PHP, Python, or Ruby
• Ability to rapidly learn new development languages (Bash, PHP and Ruby are all in heavy use)
• Solid communication skills in English, both written and verbal
• Prior experience working in a fast-paced web application environment, resolving multiple interrupt-driven priorities simultaneously
• Excellent analytical skills, coupled with a strong sense of ownership, urgency and drive
• Excellent problem solving skills with the ability to dive into the full stack to resolve issues
• Your peers describe you as a responsible, conscientious, dependable colleague and collaborator
• A team player, fast learner, with a focus on getting shit done
• Deep understanding of internet and networking protocols
• Solid understanding of web application architecture, including TCP/IP and HTTP
• Experience with IaaS technologies and virtualization: AWS, VirtualBox, VMWare, KVM, zones/containers, Vagrant
• Experience with common monitoring tools such as Nagios, New Relic, Graphite and statsd
• Familiarity with version control, we use Git
• Worked with or implemented configuration management using tools like Puppet
• Working knowledge of large-scale web service architectures, including load balancing, caching, CDNs, and clustering technologies
• Configuration and maintenance of common applications such as Apache, Nginx, memcached, redis, MySQL, Bind, Varnish
• Experience in benchmarking and performance evaluation of various permutations of hardware and software
• Experience with MySQL or Elasticsearch a bonus
Why you should work here:
• An opportunity to be both emotionally and financially invested in the fastest-growing company in a fast-growing space
• Knowing you are democratizing e-commerce by helping small businesses owners realize their dreams of selling online
• Three especially cool offices in Sydney, Austin and San Francisco
• A fully stocked kitchen and beer fridge
• Excellent insurance and other benefits
• A fast-paced yet fun environment where we celebrate and reward success
Our Mission
"Be the #1 e-commerce provider in the world by creating and delivering software that changes people's lives"
Our Core Values
Be honest - always
Simplify, simplify, simplify
Clients, not customers
Think BIG
Smart and gets things done
A team on a mission
Click Here to Apply: 
This job's for me!

collection1.title: Assistant Director of Admissions and Recruitment - Education

body.text:
Alliant International University Assistant Director of Admissions and Recruitment - Education Job Description:The Assistant Director of Admissions and Recruitment, reporting to the Director of Marketing and Public Relations for the Hufstedler School of Education (HSOE), will serve as the school's key enrollment management personnel for all HSOE programs associated with the San Francisco campus, which include teacher credentialing programs, school psychology, and school counseling. The incumbent may also provide admissions and recruitment support for HSOE programs offered at other campus locations, while maintaining a commitment to quality customer service.Candidate will implement and contribute to strategies and tactics for lead/inquiry and application generation; identify, develop, and foster relationships and outreach with school districts, pipeline programs, and other key partners; attend graduate and career fairs and key industry conferences/conventions; and schedule and lead in-person and online information sessions and other events for prospective students. Candidate will also be responsible for enrollment management data reporting for assigned programs and assist in marketing research and planning as needed. Additionally, candidate will lead and administer an application and interview process for all program applicants; respond to and log prospective student inquiries and manage all subsequent follow up contacts and tasks; and work with academic program directors and the academic affairs team to counsel and transition applicants toward enrollment.Candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills and relate well to both prospective and continuing students, as well as faculty, administration, staff and the President's Office. S/he must possess excellent communication and relationship-building skills, as well as superb organizational skills, the ability to multitask and follow through, the ability to work independently and also with a team of colleagues, and an aptitude for detail oriented tasks. Candidate must also have means of transportation and ability to attend events and to conduct outreach throughout the Bay Area with key partners and affiliates. Requirements:Candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills and relate well to both prospective and continuing students, as well as faculty, administration, staff and the President's Office. S/he must possess excellent communication and relationship-building skills, as well as superb organizational skills, the ability to multitask and follow through, the ability to work independently and also with a team of colleagues, and an aptitude for detail oriented tasks. Candidate must also have means of transportation and ability to attend events and to conduct outreach throughout the Bay Area with key partners and affiliates.Education:Minimum of a BA/BS degree is required. Experience:Experience in an admissions, recruitment, and enrollment management function is highly desired. Familiarity with or previous professional experience within K-12 schools as a teacher, school counselor, or other role is preferred. Technology Skills:Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, SalesForce or similar customer relations management system, and experience with integrated business software systems in higher education, including relational databases.Other Requirements:Must have vehicle, valid driver's license, and willingness to travel throughout the greater San Francisco Bay Area.Must be available for some evening and weekend work when needed.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to relate well to both prospective and continuing students, as well as faculty, administration and staff. Excellent organizational skills with the ability to follow through and pay close attention to detail.Additional Information:Category: AdministrativeLocations: San Francisco, CAPosted: Mar 31, '14Type: Full-timeBackground Check: Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background check.Salary: Commensurate with experience.Application Instructions:Please submit the following documents via online:Resume/CVCover letter To apply, visit https://www.interviewexchange.com/jobofferdetails.jsp?flush=true&JOBID=47896About Alliant International University:Alliant International University is a nationally ranked and recognized fully accredited learning institution that educates and prepares students to work in a multicultural/international world. With campuses and learning centers across California and in Japan, Hong Kong, and Mexico, Alliant brings a unique global perspective to its curriculum and challenges its students with a practical sense of the world and current affairs. Enhancing Alliant’s multi-cultural atmosphere is the diversity of its nearly 4,000 students from 49 states and over 75 countries.Offering courses of study in a wide range of professional and world-changing fields including psychology, education, business, law and forensics, Alliant provides a vibrant interactive academic environment for its faculty and an exciting job opportunity for all its employees. collection1.title: SECURITY OFFICER (San Francisco)

body.text:
~*~*~COME JOIN OUR TEAM AT PRESTIGE PROTECTION~*~*~
We are a premier and progressive security service provider, looking for quality personnel with excellent customer service skills and a strong security background. We have positions all over the Bay Area and provide competitive pay and medical and dental benefits.
TO APPLY
To be considered for this position, all applicants must apply online through the company's website. Enter http://www.prestigeprotection.net/employment/
JOB SPECIFICS
The Security Officer conducts foot patrols and inspects property against, fire, theft, vandalism, terrorism, illegal activity and deters criminal activity and other unwanted behavior. The Security Officer is responsible for Observing and Reporting and is required to prepare incident reports outlining observations and activity during their assigned shift, and will contact the proper authorities and company representatives as outlined in jobsite post orders.
Location: North Bay, California
This area includes, but is not limited to cities within Marin, San Francisco, and San Mateo
Hours: All Shifts, All Days
Environment* Inside, Outside, Industrial
Experience* 1+ years
Hourly Rate: Pay rates are based on required experience and location of job. 
These rates are available through the company's website where applications are submitted. 
POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Must have a high school diploma or equivalent
Must present a professional image and behave in a professional manner.
Must possess a valid Guard license and be able to provide license during interview process
Must possess a valid Driver's license with a 3 year clean driving record if applying for a driving position 
Must possess a valid TWIC license applying for TWIC required position
Must be able to work in various environments including adverse outdoor conditions such as cold, rain or heat;
Must have constant mental alertness and attention to detail required while setting priorities and following up on assignments
Must possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner
Must be able to use initiative and independent judgment within established guidelines
Must be able to frequently prepare written reports and logs in legible handwriting; may require computer skills
Must be able to read and understand all post orders/operating procedures and instructions
Must be able to handle pressure of working with high volume general public (constantly to occasionally depending on assignment)
Must have reliable transportation to and from work 
Must be willing and able to come to work on time consistently
As a condition of a job offer, Prestige Protection conducts pre-employment drug testing and reference and criminal background check.
ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL FUNCTIONS
Stand or walk constantly (for up to an entire shift) on various surfaces (tile, concrete, carpet)
Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
Occasionally bend/twist at waist/knees/neck to perform various duties
Occasionally lift or carry up to 30 pounds
Run as needed
Constant use of both hands and arms in reaching/handling/grasping/fingering while using phone, notepad, writing reports, and other administrative tasks
Constant use of eyes (correctable vision to normal level required) to observe, read, interact with public and co-workers, view security monitors; includes hand/eye coordination
Read, understand and clearly speak English; constantly use speech and hearing (correctable to normal level required) in communicating with public/co-workers, giving and receiving instructions, using phones
Prestige Protection is an EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY employer: 
Candidates are considered for employment with Prestige Protection without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, veteran status (specifically status as a disabled veteran, special disabled veteran, Vietnam Era veteran, recently separated veteran, armed forces service medal veteran, or other protected veteran) or other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local law.
REASONABLE ACCOMMODATIONS AND THE ONLINE APPLICATION PROCESS: 
Consistent with Prestige Protection's commitment to equal employment opportunity, Prestige Protection provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities who need assistance in applying electronically for a position with Prestige Protection, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship. To request a reasonable accommodation for this purpose, please call 925-485-9535. Please note that this phone number is to be used solely to request an accommodation with respect to the online application process. Calls for any other reason will not be returned. Reasonable accommodation requests are considered on a case-by-case basis.
*Thank you for your interest in Prestige Protection*
P.P.O 16436

collection1.title: Sr. STE/Software QA Tester (San Francisco)
collection1.body:
Senior STE/Software QA Tester
San Francisco, CA
Apply Now
Send Jobvite
Join the Team!
Senior STE/Software QA Tester -- San Francisco, CA
Want the ability to impact millions in how they sign up to listen to music everyday in every way? 
Imagine a company dedicated to bringing music to the people, whenever they want it, wherever they are, on any device? Come work for us and make it happen!
We have a start-up feel with the security of a strong revenue stream. With more than a million subscribers and over 25 million songs world wide on more than 70 consumer electronic products, Rhapsody is the #1 premium subscription music service and leading the digital music service revolution globally. We make it possible for fans to listen to any song, anytime and anywhere. Rhapsody was voted one of Washington's top 100 companies to work for by Seattle Business Magazine and understand that people are our biggest asset.
Rhapsody is looking to fill a senior contractor role on our Content Operations QA team. As a Senior STE, you will be responsible for finding and reporting software defects in our expansive content management system.
The ideal candidate is a seasoned professional (4+ years of experience) who is driven and well-organized, with strong learning abilities and works well in a team environment. To be successful, you must be self-motivated and tenacious, thrive in a collaborative environment, and complete tasks on the agreed schedules.
Among other responsibilities, the person in this position will:
• Write test plans, test entry criteria, and test cases for projects
• Test, hands-on, new functionality and report software bugs
• Performs estimation efforts on projects.
• Provide feedback on how well new features integrated and working within the existing system
• Test and report content problems, such as missing content, music metadata or images
• Provide reports in daily standup meetings, and via email and the bug database
• Verify bug fixes
• Trouble-shoot reported bugs for elusive or hard to reproduce problems
• Ad hoc testing as directed
• Work as directed with QA Lead
• Interact with stakeholders, the QA Lead, other QA testers, developers and program managers to define tactical testing requirements
• Passion for, and commitment to, software quality
• 4+ years of software quality assurance and/or development experience
• 2+ years of experience in database testing
• Advanced knowledge of software testing methodology
• Solid knowledge of SQL and relational databases, including table design and relational database
architecture concepts
• Demonstrated knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL, Perl, shell scripting, as well as UNIX commands,
environments and tools
• Understanding of the software development lifecycle and processes
• Experience with Agile development and test methodologies such as Scrum
• Demonstrated ability to work in collaboration with team members to cross-pollinate ideas and processes
across various components of the system
• A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
• Ability to work on diverse problems where data analysis requires evaluation of identifiable factors
• The skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry practices and
company policies and procedures to resolve a wide range of issues in imaginative, practical ways
Rhapsody offers a highly collaborative, hardworking, open environment where you'll work alongside
extremely creative and dedicated people. The company is headquartered in Seattle, with offices in San
Francisco and New York. We are proud to offer our full time employees an extensive benefits package
including generous paid time off, medical, dental, vision, 401K, telecommuting, subsidized commuting options and more.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people
assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and
skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal
responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Rhapsody International Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

collection1.title: $100/hr. Part-Time LSAT Instructor (financial district)

body.text:
Manhattan Prep seeks expert teachers in San Francisco who have proven their mastery of the LSAT and who can engage students of all ability levels in a stimulating and rigorous learning environment. Teachers are hired to instruct full classes and to tutor students one-on-one, both in-person and online. We provide extensive training and all student and instructor materials, but encourage the development and expression of unique teaching styles. Teaching and tutoring take place primarily during evenings and weekends. This is a part-time position: many of our instructors maintain full-time positions, engage in entrepreneurial endeavors, or pursue advanced degrees concurrently while teaching for Manhattan Prep.
Compensation:
The pay is $100 per hour for all classroom teaching and private tutoring -- up to four times the industry standard. Instructors can expect to teach between 3 and 20 hours per week, depending on market need.
Qualifications:
Applicants must meet the following minimum requirements in order to be considered:
• Score qualification. 99th percentile score on an official LSAT. A scanned image of an official score report must be provided. 
• Minimum 2 years teaching experience & expertise. Classroom teaching preferred.
• A flexible schedule, particularly during evenings and weekends.
• Fluency in English.
All Manhattan Prep instructors must:
• Sign a non-compete agreement. (Note: Manhattan Prep will not hire any candidates who are bound by non-compete agreements with other test-prep companies.)
• Make a minimum 1-year commitment, averaging a minimum 3 hours of instruction per week.
How to Apply:
We ask that all interested candidates who meet the above criteria electronically submit a cover letter, resume, and score report at http://www.manhattanlsat.com/resume_post.cfm
About Manhattan Prep:
Manhattan Prep is a high-end, test-prep company serving college students and young professionals studying for the GMAT (business school), LSAT (law school), and GRE (master's and PhD programs). We are the leading provider of GMAT prep in the world.
Manhattan Prep conducts in-person classes and private instruction across the United States, Canada, and England. Our online courses are available worldwide, and our acclaimed Strategy Guides are available at Barnes & Noble and Amazon. In addition, Manhattan Prep serves an impressive roster of corporate clients, including many Fortune 500 companies. For more information, visit www.manhattanprep.com.

collection1.body:
Sr. SDET
San Francisco, CA
Apply Now
Send Jobvite
Join the Team!
Sr. Software Development Engineer in Test -- San Francisco
Would you like to build technology that millions of people play with?
Imagine a company dedicated to bringing music to the people, whenever they want it, wherever they are, on any device. Come work for us and make it happen! 
Rhapsody is experiencing significant growth in subscribers, expanding internationally, and is always looking to bring in top talent. We have a start-up feel with the security of a strong revenue stream. With more than a million paying subscribers and over 25 million songs worldwide, Rhapsody is leading the digital music service revolution in the US, Europe, and South America.
We are seeking to hire a Sr. SDET on our Applications Services team responsible for ensuring that a customer can always sign up for our service and manage their account. Are you passionate about breaking software, automating to avoid repetitive tasks and someone whose day is not complete unless you bring value to our customer? 
Read on if you fit this description!
You will accomplish these things in your role:
Collaborate with scrum team to create test scenarios of web pages that allow for a bug free experience for customers, automating those scenarios so as to avoid boredom of repetitive testing.
Evaluate current test procedures and automation tools and drive improvements.
Report to all defects found and an analysis of each one, in an agile development environment.
Emphasize customer experience. Continually improve user experience to better drive the quality of Rhapsody.
Assist with test coordination with remote QA team, ensuring they are tasked with appropriate work items.
We need you to have this:
BS/BA degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
4+ years of software quality assurance and/or development experience.
3 years of experience in testing of services, including object-oriented API testing.
Ability to analyze production logs using basic debugging techniques to assist engineers in troubleshooting real time issues.
Strong communication skills, able to effectively represent severity of issues as encountered
Solid coding and automation skills in Java, JUnit, Selenium or other relevant programming development skills
Working knowledge of Linux, SOAP protocol, client/server communications, JavaScript and REST.
Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle and processes, including qa processes, software test design strategy and software testing tools.
Extensive automation background preferred.
Ability to extend input and expected data, mock objects and troubleshoot dynamic data problems.
Must be able to work in a fast paced environment and manage time effectively with little management overhead.
If you have these, we will call you tomorrow (unless it's the weekend):
Strong Selenium or extensive experience creating automation frameworks
Knowledge in testing Spring code
Rhapsody offers a highly collaborative, hardworking, open environment where you'll work alongside extremely creative and dedicated people. The company is headquartered in Seattle, with offices in San Francisco and New York. We are proud to offer our full time employees an extensive benefits package including generous paid time off, medical, dental, vision, 401(k), telecommuting, subsidized commuting options and more.

collection1.title: Listing Support Specialist, Rentals - ZILLOW

body.text:
Zillow is looking for a support specialist to handle listing-related issues and escalations within the rental marketplace. It is essential for our rental marketplace to have the highest quality rental listings available, this individual will be responsible for monitoring listings and reports, and provide the human eye to listing issues that software alone cannot resolve. This individual will work daily with real estate professionals (property managers, landlords, and rental brokers), consumers (renters), and internal employees. Must have a strong commitment to resolving customer issues while maintaining a high level of professionalism and customer service.
Primary responsibilities include:
Review and respond to user generated reports regarding the accuracy, availability, and legitimacy of rental listings
Monitor and review listings queue for legitimacy and accuracy, taking proactive steps to increase listing quality prior to listings being seen by users
Reach out to listing providers to determine the legitimacy of their accounts and listings
Respond to customer support tickets regarding fraud and spam issues
Work with operations and product teams to improve listing quality monitoring software
Team Player- is willing and able to openly communicate with all customers (internal and external) and be able to adapt quickly to changes
Requirements:
Previous experience in customer support, preferably with an online consumer site or other web-based company
Strong data analytics skills and ability to find and interpret data trends
Experience using various channels for delivering customer support, including phone and email
Excellent communications and interpersonal skills, able to work effectively and efficiently with customers who have varying degrees of product and technical proficiency
Excellent problem-solving skills, with a technical aptitude, quick and flexible learner, willing to learn and grow in a changing industry
Resourceful, and savvy with internet searches and finding new ways to solve issues
Four year degree preferred
Click here to apply!

collection1.title: Advertising Operations Associate (financial district)
collection1.body:
Job Description -- Ad Operations Associate
Digilant is an independent marketing technology company that provides marketers with a platform to support the entire media buy -- from planning through execution, measurement and optimization -- with ultimate precision and transparency. Originally launched as Adnetik in 2009, Digilant is headquartered in the United States, with offices internationally. Digilant provides brand marketers and agencies with tools to achieve their goals, including brand-building, customer engagement, product introductions, competitive differentiation, direct response and demand generation. Digilant products are available as managed services or through a self-service interface.
The ideal Ad Operations Associate will have an analytical, strategic, and creative mind, as well as firm communication skills, both written and spoken. The position offers full immersion in the digital advertising space, with room for growth and personal advancement, while developing a strong background in the industry, from a media, data, and strategic standpoint.
Responsibilities
• Manage high-level daily activities involved in ad campaigns, including reporting, optimization, analytics, billing/budgeting, and strategic planning.
• Create proposals for advertisers, working with agencies and clients to develop online solutions. 
• Client liaison, providing service around live campaigns, technical issues, and performance goals. 
• Work with product, business development and planning groups to achieve campaign goals, create new offerings and ensure full and ideal delivery.
Desired Skills & Experience
• Strong analytical, communication and strategic inclination
• Ability to work both as part of a team and in an independent fashion
• Online experience a plus, but not necessary
• Strength in numeric analytics and math

Our progressive workplace policies and our commitment to diversity and collegiality create an environment ideally suited to teamwork and collaboration.
