collection1.title: HR & Office Coordinator - Summer Search (financial district)
collection1.compensation: compensation: Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

body.text:
WHY WORK AT SUMMER SEARCH
Summer Search is a dynamic, national nonprofit organization that identifies resilient low-income high school students and inspires them to become responsible and altruistic leaders. Through year-round mentoring, life-changing summer experiences, college advising, and a lasting alumni support network, students are supported to matriculate to and graduate from college while also learning the importance of giving back. Summer Search started in 1990 in San Francisco and has expanded to serve students in North San Francisco Bay and Silicon Valley, Boston, New York, Seattle and Philadelphia. 
Summer Search has a proven program model where 100% of our low-income students graduate from high school compared to 50% of their low-income peers. Ninety-five percent of Summer Search students go on to college, and while 11% of low-income students will earn a college degree nationwide, 90% of Summer Search college students are on track to graduate and earn their degree. Becoming part of the Summer Search team means making a difference in the lives of young people.
In the past five years, the organization has more than doubled the students served as a result of a successful national growth campaign. Today, the organization is in the second year of implementing a five-year strategic growth plan to significantly scale its programs and further advance Summer Search as a force in the education and youth development fields. Specifically, Summer Search is poised to grow to serve 3,500 program participants and 4,500 alumni by 2017. For more information about our organization, please visit our website at www.summersearch.org.
JOB SUMMARY
With plans to grow staff by over 50% in the next four years, Summer Search's Talent Team is leading the organization's strategic focus on talent management and people systems. The HR & Office Coordinator will contribute to the overall success of the organization's internal operations by playing a key role in coordinating HR processes, procedures, and systems. This position will also support the San Francisco National Office by providing essential office operations management. This is an excellent opportunity for a dynamic, tasked-oriented individual that thrives in a fast-paced environment and is interested in growing HR & professional skills while working for a growing nonprofit organization that stands at an exciting inflection point in its history. 
PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
HR Coordination
• Balance daily priorities to provide general human resources administrative support to the national organization
• Oversee benefit administration for new hires and assist with annual open enrollment
• Support the recruiting, hiring and onboarding processes of national and local sites
• Manage HRIS system, HR process implementation, and act as main point of contact for general employee benefit & payroll inquires 
• Provide general support for HR & talent projects as needed
Office Management
• Maintains office equipment, including requesting technicians & recommending maintenance needs
• Oversees office supplies and catering needs, and keeps office in order and organized
• Manages routine day-to-day activities such as incoming and outgoing mail and office events
• Creates procedures and policies for overall office management and daily execution
• Assists various projects on an as needed basis, such as staff retreats, office moves & remodeling 
QUALIFICATIONS 
• Bachelor's degree and 2 years of well-developed HR & office administrative skills with meticulous attention to detail and ability to work within shifting deadlines & priorities
• High level of comfort working in HR/business systems and database operations (payroll processing experience preferred)
• Enthusiastic, flexible personality with the ability to provide superb customer service across a multi-office organization
• Experience working in nonprofit and/or small business environment
• Strong command of Microsoft Office applications, especially Word, Outlook and Excel
• Excellent organization & project management skills
OUR BENEFITS
Summer Search is committed to creating an environment that is supportive of learning, growth and staff development. Our investment in staff includes: 
• Individual, local, regional and national training
• Developing leaders from within the organization
• Culture that supports staff well-being and holistic self-care
• Local and national events to build strong relationships and connection to the national organization as a whole
• Competitive salary commensurate with experience 
• Medical, dental, vision, FSA, life and disability insurance
• 401 (K) Plan and employer matching program after 6 months of employment
• Generous paid sick days, holidays, and vacation package, including a paid winter break 
HOW TO APPLY
Projected hire date is April 2014. To apply to Summer Search, submit your resume with a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in Summer Search and describes your professional HR & administrative experience online at http://newton.newtonsoftware.com/career/SubmitResume.action?id=8a123cf245163cf701451a58d7a0634a&source=Craigslist.
SUMMER SEARCH IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Summer Search strives to reflect the diverse community it serves. Applicants who contribute to this diversity are strongly encouraged to apply.

For a full job description visit: www.tpl.org

Since 1972, TPL has worked with willing landowners, community groups, and national, state, and local agencies to complete more than 3,500 land conservation projects in 47 states, protecting more than 2 million acres. www.tpl.org

collection1.title: Not menstruating and not pregnant. Should I be concerned?

body.text:
Not menstruating and not pregnant -- should I be concerned? Participate in a Clinical Research Study.
The medical term used to describe "absence of periods" is amenorrhea. Women normally do not menstruate before puberty, during pregnancy, and after menopause. When a woman does not get her period when she normally should, it may be the symptom of a treatable medical condition.
If you are a woman age 18 to 40 who has had normal menstrual cycles in the past, but stopped getting your period for three or more months, you may be experiencing secondary amenorrhea.
If this describes you, you're invited to see if you may qualify for The SPRY Trial. The purpose of this research study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of an investigational medication for women with secondary amenorrhea. 
If you qualify, you will receive investigational study medication, study-related medical exams, and laboratory services at no charge. You may also be reimbursed for time, travel, and other expenses.
In order to participate in the trial, women must be evaluated by a trial doctor and meet certain requirements including:
• Being a female between the ages of 18 and 40
• Being premenopausal with an intact uterus
• Be in generally good health
• Be willing to participate in a clinical trial
If you would like to know more about setting up an appointment for pre-screening, please contact:
California Family Health Council 
800-300-5767
researchberk@cfhc.org
To learn more about The SPRY Trial, Please visit www.SpryTrial.com

collection1.title: After-School Professionals Needed (excelsior / outer mission)
collection1.body:
YMCA JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title: Program Leader/Safety and Support
Reports To: Program Director/Site Coordinator 
Status: Non-Exempt Job Grade: I
Status: PT Salary Range: $13-$15/hr DOE
Competency Level: Leader 
THE Y VISION for 2020
The healthiest children in America will live in the Bay Area, building skills and habits for a healthy life, enabling them to reach their highest potential through the strength of the communities we serve, and make a valuable contribution to society.
POSITION SUMMARY
Under the guidance of the leadership staff, The Program Leader will be responsible for designing and implementing a variety of activities for middle school youth. This includes incorporating curriculum activities, speakers, field-trips and leadership opportunities. Program Leaders will pay close attention to youth development principles and restorative practices. 
• Design, outreach for, and implement enrichment programs for youth that include a planned curriculum, field trips, career exploration, youth development principles, and incentives.
• Support SF Team initiatives by using creative strategies to support literacy growth, specifically vocabulary growth. Create incentives and play games with vocabulary development. 
• Coordinate and implement enrichment related special events.
• Perform adjunct safety and support functions during Beacon operating hours, including mediating conflicts, handling emergencies and injuries. 
• Assist with ongoing neighborhood outreach efforts including communication with parents when appropriate or necessary.
• Carry out the mission of the OMI/E Beacon and youth development practices in all program development; continually assess programs to ensure adherence to all program development; continually assess programs to ensure adherence to youth development.
• Maintain a working budget for your programs and adhere to the accounting systems of the Beacon.
• Submit, in a professional and timely manner, Beacon forms including; incident reports, time cards, witness reports, weekly attendance, budgets, etc.
• Supervise volunteers and high school staff. This includes creating goals, providing a valuable work experience and offering support and feedback.
• Assists in implementation of other Beacon special events.
• Use a project-based learning approach, and always have youth working towards that goal. 
• Respond to work related emails in a consistently timely manner. 
• Exhibit professionalism at all times and serve as a positive role model to Beacon youth. 
• Report to work on time, inform supervisor of any impending tardiness, and receive supervisor approval for any alteration to the regular working schedule.
• Support academics in homework time, provide tutoring and maintain behavior management that supports academic growth. 
* Work as a camp counselor in the summer time, providing enriching activities Mon - Friday 8 AM to 4 PM. Part time positions turn to full time temporary in the summer. 
* The Program Leader will provide a positive role model to youth & teens within the philosophy of the YMCA standards and expectations with emphasis on Character Counts. This will be done under the direction of the Program Director..
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Definition: The skills and knowledge required to obtain the position. 
Age: at least 21 
Education: at least 48 College units or the completion of the CBEST Test 
Availability: M-F, 20 to 25 hrs a week 2:30 PM to 6:30 PM daily 
Related Experience: 2 yrs working with Teens 
Language Skills: Bi-lingual (Spanish/Chinese) preferred 
Specialized Skills: Strong knowledge of Middle School
level Math and English. 
Licenses & Certifications: First Aid/CPR 
WORK ENVIRONMENT/MINIMUM PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS 
Definition: A description of the work environment and the physical requirements to execute the job in that environment.
• You must have the physical, visual, and auditory ability to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodations.
• All employees working with the YMCA are considered to have supervisory or disciplinary action relationship over minors. Fingerprints will be taken upon commencement of employment and will be submitted to the Association Office human resources department prior to beginning the first day of work. 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Definition: The role to be reviewed & evaluated.
1. Supervise middle school aged youth as well as student volunteers and paid youth assistants, with first priority in their safety, at all times following risk management policies
2. Participate and encourage positive participation of all students in daily activities and events
3. Lead organized learning activities in enrichment and recreation to help students further develop and strengthen their academic, physical, and social skills.
4. Interact professionally and appropriately with parents, teachers, and school staff.
5. Assist with program data entry and daily sign-in and out procedures.
6. Provide academic support to students after school. Subjects include Math (Intermediate/Advanced Algebra, Geometry, & Statistics), Science (Physics & Chemistry), and Literature (English Composition) work.
7. Implement discipline techniques and classroom management.
8. Participate in cleaning and maintaining the facilities and program equipment.
9. Attend staff meetings and trainings as required.
10. Uphold YMCA policies for safety, supervision, mandated reporting and risk management.
11. Demonstrate the Character Counts values of caring, respect, honesty and responsibility in all dealings with members, guests, volunteers and fellow staff.
12. Demonstrate competencies in and willingness to develop in the Cause Driven Leadership areas of mission advancement, collaboration, operational effectiveness and personal growth.
13. All other duties as assigned by supervisor.
YMCA LEADER COMPETENCIES
Mission Advancement: Accept and demonstrate the Y's values. Demonstrates a desire to serve others and fulfill community needs. Recruits volunteers and builds effective, supportive working relationships with them. Support fundraising. 
Collaboration: Work effectively with people of different backgrounds, abilities, opinions, and perceptions. Build rapport and relates well to others. Seeks first to understand the other person's point of view and remains calm in challenging situations. Listen for understanding and meaning; speaks and writes effectively. Take initiative to assist in developing others.
Operational Effectiveness: Make sound judgments, and transfer learning from one situation to another. Embrace new approaches and discover ideas to create a better member experience. Establish goals, clarifies tasks, plans work, and actively participate in meetings. Follow budgeting policies and procedures, and report all financial irregularities immediately. Strive to meet or exceed goals and deliver a high-value experience for members.
Personal Growth: Pursue self-development that enhances job performance. Demonstrate an openness to change, and seek opportunities in the change process. Accurately assess personal feelings, strengths, and limitations and how they impact relationships. Have the functional and technical knowledge and skills required to perform well; use best practices and demonstrate up-to- date knowledge and skills in technology.
While all competencies are significant the following are critical to success in this position:
• Collaboration: Work effectively with people of different backgrounds, abilities, opinions, and perceptions. Build rapport and relates well to others. Seeks first to understand the other person's point of view and remains calm in challenging situations. Listen for understanding and meaning; speaks and writes effectively. Take initiative to assist in developing others.
• Operational Effectiveness: Make sound judgments, and transfer learning from one situation to another. Embrace new approaches and discover ideas to create a better member experience. Establish goals, clarifies tasks, plans work, and actively participate in meetings. Follow budgeting policies and procedures, and report all financial irregularities immediately. Strive to meet or exceed goals and deliver a high-value experience for members.
EFFECT ON END RESULTS
Definition: List each measurable to be used for rating the level of success in performing each essential function.
• High satisfaction from program participants and school community in services delivered from after school program.
• Participants feel engaged and attended to especially in the areas of academics in accordance to this position.
• Program meets required ADA.
ACKOWLEDGEMENT
This job description is not meant to be all-inclusive. This position description is not a written or implied contract.

collection1.title: RED DOG SEEKS GENERAL MANAGER (SOMA / south beach)
collection1.compensation: compensation: Salary will be based on experience; bonus available; health and PTO are offered.
collection1.body:
Hello!
Red Dog Restaurant, due to open in early May, is seeking a General Manager.
We are located in one of San Francisco's most dynamic and populated neighborhoods, near the ballpark and downtown.
Our dining room has 120 seats with a full liquor license. We will serve craft cocktails and delicious, honest food. We are looking for an ambitious, entrepreneurial individual who can help us grow into a neighborhood hot spot and destination for local workers, residents, tourists and ballpark fans. 
You should love the hustle of working in a busy neighborhood restaurant. We are looking for a hands on manager with experience working in high volume, high quality restaurant with an emphasis on outstanding customer service. Your resume should show experience of at least 5 years working in a similar position and operation.
Your responsibilities will include:
*Recruiting, training and retaining an outstanding team committed to excellent customer service
*Cultivating a hospitable and welcoming environment for our guests
*Create and execute a grassroots marketing plan to reach out to local residents, businesses and concierges to grow our business fast
*Oversee all aspects of daily operations, including financials, administrative, and quality control
*Experience opening a new restaurant is preferred
*Your IT and computer skills should also be top notch
*Demonstrated performance in your previous positions (yes, we will check references)
*A strong desire to grow the business at this location and future locations
*Experience with events and offsite catering is preferred
We have a proven track record of delivering high quality to a lot of people at our Ferry Building restaurant, Il Cane Rosso, and look forward to bringing our brand of delicious farmhouse inspired food to a growing neighborhood.
Red Dog will be similar in concept to Nopa, Delfina, Serpentine and Locanda.
We look forward to hearing from you. Please include a cover letter that describes your experience and why you are interested in the position at Red Dog, your resume and 3 professional references of people you've worked within the past 3 years.
Thank you for your interest and let's open Red Dog!

collection1.title: Community Development Manager, Entertainment (San Francisco, CA)

body.text: Attention all culture vultures! If you're a music and pop culture expert ready to make Entertainment communities a must read -- then we need to talk. Like our fans, Wikia is passionate, high-energy, and collaborative. Wikia is one of the largest Creative Commons-licensed sites in the world, as we maintain over 350,000 wikia communities across an impressive array of subjects, spanning all aspects of movies, TV, books, music, games, and lifestyle topics such as food, fashion and making. We are rated as a Quantcast Top 50, ComScore Top 100, and Nielsen Top 10 Social Media Site and are read by over 110 million unique visitors a month. We need YOU to lead a team of entertainment focused Community Development Associates and drive success in the Wikia Entertainment vertical.  This role will also have a special focus on conquering the next frontier for Wikia. . .music! Along with our Director of Programming, you will plan our entertainment roadmap that will lead to a heightened presence within the music realm. You'll also serve as the lead for all entertainment-related social media accounts, including Twitter, Facebook, and Tumblr. Internally, you will serve as the official "voice" of the entertainment communities to ensure they are represented across our custom programming. You blog, tweet, and are in the know of all the latest entertainment and music #trends. Spotify, Pandora and iTunes you say? You most likely have an account for one if not all three and see the benefits of each.  Team building and achieving company goals as a group is something you take seriously and your mantra is "success through teamwork". A deep appreciation for all things Yeezus, Divergent, and Walter White, make you the go-to person for content generation. User communities are your happy place and you're excited about the opportunity to interact, develop and create a music "scene" for the Wikia user. Unlike most startups, our exciting platform is also coupled with a strong work life balance. You'll have the opportunity to shape the revenue stream of the company, technology, and products, while having fun. For your expertise, we will offer a competitive base pay and full benefits. Our dog-friendly digs are located in San Francisco (between BART and CalTrain) and also come with a stocked pantry and gaming room, where some employees practice yoga at lunch. Joining our mission to build one of the largest and most interesting sites in the world is easy. Send us your resume and social media accounts that showcase your passions and let's start the conversation. Click Here to Apply

collection1.title: Chemical Inventory and Efficiency Expert Wanted for Exciting Blog (Remote)
collection1.compensation: compensation: 3 Posts per Week/$50 Per Post
collection1.body:
Does walking into an inefficient, poorly-organized lab make you see red? Are people always asking you about how to comply with OSHA, with the EPA, with fire codes, and anything else with which you can comply? Is lab organization one of your driving passions? If so, we're looking for you to come write for our blog. We need someone with experience working in a lab, preferably with chemical inventory, who can explain the ins and outs of lab techniques to like-minded readers looking for a definitive source. 
Running a business is about making sure you maximize efficiency while minimizing losses, whether they come from disorganization, mishaps, or regulatory lapses. This blog will help both public and private labs manage themselves in ways that are the most scientifically and economically profitable. 
If this is your area, but are unsure on the writing, don't worry. We have a team of the nicest and most helpful editors you can hope to meet, and we want to work with you. If interested, please send an email with your resume and a cover letter, and include three potential topics you'd be interested in writing about.
If you have a science background, writing experience, and an interest in chemical inventory, we'd love for you to apply.

collection1.title: Senior iOS Developer (San Francisco, CA)

body.text: About Us:Chartboost is the world's largest games only technology platform. We work with thousands of developers around the world and our network has grown to more than 60,000 mobile games. We reach 300 million users across more than 150 countries and drive billions of impressions per month. Chartboost was founded by early employees from the company behind Tap Tap Revenge (acquired by Disney) and our employees come from several leading companies, including Google and Microsoft. We have raised $21M from Sequoia Capital and other investors. We are on fire.We are passionate in everything we do - we work hard, and give everything we've got to make our users love us. We are proud of the product we've built and appreciate the impact it has on other people's businesses and lives. We want to be surrounded by people who are always finding opportunities to try something new and grow. We love data and anything that helps drive intelligent decisions. We are product driven. We care about design, our users and their overall experience. Sound like a fit?  Come join us, dream big, and be part of the team that will change the future of mobile gaming.Responsibilities:Be a mobile specialist. We will look to you to solve hard problems and make our iPhone app fast, elegant and awesome. Build features in our iPhone app. This could include things to do with user-generated content, tying our client code to critical server-side functionality, or even building apps that take full advantage of the rich iPhone SDK API. Interact daily with the systems that are used in professional software development: bug tracking, source control, etc.Requirements:You know Objective-C, C and the Xcode development tools inside out, including instruments and 'lldb'. You write clean and modern code. You hate repeating yourself. You have shipped an iOS or Mac app. You are a decent polyglot. You have used something like Ruby, Python or Lisp before and know how to use that knowledge to improve your Cocoa code. You are an excellent debugger.Nice to Have:Bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science, information systems or related field. Experience working in short, agile, iterative development cycles. You code for fun and have a side project or two you help out with. Experience integrating with third parties - through APIs or otherwise.Perks:The opportunity to help build a company with the founding team. Stock Options - you will have a stake in the future success of Chartboost. Awesome office space in the heart of SOMA. 20 days of PTO and 10 holidays per year, including your birthday!  Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance options. Free breakfast on Mondays, free lunch on Tuesdays and free dinner every evening. Commuter Program and 401k savings plan. Paid company-wide getaways and retreats.Click Here to Apply

collection1.title: Apparel Product Development and Production Manager (Sonora Ca)
collection1.body:
Position Summary
UV Skinz sells peace-of-mind from the sun's damaging rays. We manufacture UV protective sun wear and accessories for all ages and make it a top priority to provide the most fun, fashionable, and affordable sun protection around. Most people don't realize that more than 2 million cases of skin cancer will be diagnosed this year or that 1 in 5 Americans will have some form of skin cancer in their lifetime or that one severe sunburn as a child more than doubles your risk of getting skin cancer as an adult. We want to help change these statistics by bringing products to the market that help families live sun safe while never forgetting how important it is to LIVE and HAVE FUN outdoors! 
During our eight year history we have demonstrated consistently strong growth in sales and company branding and we are realizing the need for some talented personnel. We are seeking a full-time person who can take on the role of the Product Development and Production Manager for our fast-growth company. In this challenging role, you will be responsible for managing and building the product from concept through finishing stages. The emphasis will be on production and helping develop great products that align with our strong, fast growing brand while helping to develop new, efficient business practices for the continually evolving and growing needs of the company. You must possess a strong sense of urgency, tremendous organizational skills, ability to influence, and strong presentation skills. It is preferred that you have a background in apparel technical design, sourcing and production. This position will not be managing people but projects. You must be able to think high-level and execute at all levels. There is tremendous opportunity for growth for the right candidate.
Responsibilities
Product Development/ Technical Design
• Develop product that meets retail price and margin targets
• Work closely with design for fit, construction, trims and color approval
• Maintain open communication with sales and service team for new product and/or product improvement ideas
• Worked in conjunction with design to create spec sheets and development packets to send overseas
• Communicate daily with overseas agents ensuring styles are on required production schedule
• Communicate sample and pattern requirements to factory using tech packs, photos, fit comments, blocks and pattern patterns, etc. 
• Conduct fittings; evaluate garment and pattern to determine compliance of measurements, construction, and fit intent
Production Management/ Sourcing
• Develop and execute Time-and-Action calendars with suppliers from concept to final production to ensure timely deliveries
• Coordinate the development and tracking of products & samples with design staff and merchants
• Issue and update purchase orders as needed 
• Establish and cultivate strong relationships with vendors, design, merchandising, planner and print team for daily communication of projects
• Work closely with management to develop action plan to monitor the timely shipments of product and to ensure product is shipped by vessel while mitigating risk of delivery penalties
• Monitor sampling process and ensure samples are ordered and shipped in accordance to calendar needs, including PP and TOP samples
• Continually identify and select factories for manufacturing of product and build and maintain relationships with current trade managers, vendors, and international factories
Technical Skills Required:
The ideal candidate must have a successful history of clothing production management and product development process. Among the technical requirements are:
• Bachelor's degree in fashion design/merchandising or related experience required
• 3-5 years of related work experience in sourcing, production and product development 
• Knowledge of pattern making, manufacturing construction standards and fit for diverse and complex products
• Extensive experience with creating and managing production schedules
• Knowledge of trade regulations, testing protocols, product integrity, production life-cycles, fabric and product construction
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (basic knowledge of Adobe Suite a plus) 
• Excellent math and calculation skills
• International travel experience strongly preferred
Key Attributes of the Ideal Candidate:
• Ability to be flexible/adaptable in a fast-paced, rapidly changing and growing environment
• Be results oriented, focused, driven to achieve targets, and possess a high degree of urgency
• Ability to work cross-functionally across many teams with a strong sense of teamwork
• Demonstrate proactive problem solving skills
• Ability to communicate with all levels of the organization as well as multiple overseas vendors, including strong communication via email

collection1.title: Executive Director (Bay Area)
collection1.body:
The California Network of Child Advocacy Centers (www.cncac.org) is seeking a full-time Executive Director. {NOTE: the organization is in the midst of a name change to Children's Advocacy Centers of California (CACC)}. CACC is a network of Children's Advocacy Centers and Multi-Disciplinary Teams engaged in the investigation of child abuse allegations throughout the state. CACC supports of the establishment, growth and development of CACs through training, technical assistance and networking opportunities, and advocates at the state level.
The Executive Director (ED) of CACC will work with and at the direction of the Board of Directors to develop and implement a strategic plan that will advance the mission of CACC and support its member agencies. The ED will be responsible for managing operations, supervising and ensuring the success of staff members and consultants, and ensuring compliance with grants. The ED will manage an annual budget of approximately $380,000. The Executive Director is the public face of CACC and will form, build, and strengthen relationships with CACC members, partner agencies, and stakeholders across the state. The ED must have flexibility to travel both throughout California as well as to attend national meetings and conferences. The Executive Director will work from a home office or from a shared community office space if preferred. While significant presence is required in the Bay Area and to a lesser degree in Sacramento, the organization is open to considering candidates who may reside in another area of the state.
Minimum requirements for the position are:
• Bachelor's Degree 
• Minimum of 5 years of management experience in a nonprofit organization or government agency 
• Demonstrated experience in developing budgets and in fiscal management and oversight 
• Experience in grant and/or contract administration
• Familiarity with foundation and government funding sources and philanthropic communities
• Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills
• Experienced in researching, writing, and securing grant funding
• Successful rack record in building and maintaining effective partnerships with diverse stakeholders
• Proficient with Microsoft Office applications, Filemaker Pro, and Quickbooks.
• Access to reliable transportation for local and regional business travel (mileage to be reimbursed). Valid driver's license and automobile insurance.
• Must pass a background check clearance 
About the organization: Children's Advocacy Centers of California (CACC) is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) membership organization dedicated to helping local communities respond to allegations of child abuse in ways that are effective and efficient -- and put the needs of child victims first. CACC provides training, support, technical assistance, and leadership on a statewide level to local child advocacy centers and multidisciplinary teams throughout California responding to reports of child abuse and neglect. CACC is an Accredited State Chapter of the National Children's Alliance.

collection1.title: Product Demonstrator (downtown / civic / van ness)
collection1.body:
Dyson Ltd is a British technology company, founded in 1993 by Sir James Dyson, which designs and manufactures vacuum cleaners, hand dryers, bladeless fans and heaters. It sells machines in over 50 countries and employs 3,100 people worldwide. The company prides itself on engineering products which work in different and better ways than their predecessors. Dyson's founder, James Dyson, famously created 5,127 prototypes of his first machine, the vacuum cleaner, in a workshop behind his house, before developing one that he considered worked perfectly, the DC01.
PURPOSE OF THIS JOB 
Demonstrators work part-time as members of the Field Sales team to engage consumers in an energetic and confident manner and provide them with knowledgeable information about Dyson products in select retail locations (i.e. Costco, Bed Bath and Beyond and Best Buy) or events across the United States. The most important part of a Demonstrators' job is to create a positive experience with the store and the consumers; assisting in the sale of Dyson products to achieve company specified sales goals. Demonstrations occur on Saturdays, Sundays and some weekday holidays. Demonstrators must work a minimum of 3 out of 4 weekends per month within an assigned market. 
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES AND SUPPORTING ACTIVITIES: 
Increase overall awareness and sales of Dyson products through in store and event demonstrations
â€¢Conduct planned demonstrations in assigned retail stores to achieve specified sales goals
â€¢Capture consumers' attention to participate in high energy, captivating in-store demonstrations and model all aspects of Dyson's brand, culture, and passion for technology
â€¢Be a credible product and brand expert by educating consumers on the benefits and features of Dyson products and actively listening to consumers to confidently recommend appropriate Dyson products and comfortably over objections 
â€¢Maintain responsibility for all demonstration and other POP material
â€¢Assist with training of new Demonstrators as needed
Communicate clearly, accurately, and in a timely manner with accounts, peers, and District Demonstration Manager
â€¢Actively monitor Dyson's online reporting system to contribute quality feedback and report/confirm attendance
â€¢Capture accurate demonstration data and communicate opportunities to District Demonstration Manager per established guidelines
â€¢Build and maintain strong relationships with store personnel 
INDIVIDUAL QUALIFICATIONS
Experience and Education Skills, Competencies and Requirements
â€¢HS Diploma or GED required
â€¢Bachelor Degree a plus
â€¢1 year experience in a public interfacing role required
â€¢Experience in a retail sales environment required 
â€¢Must have Windows Operating System of XP SP3 or above or Mac Operating System 10.5x or above. 
â€¢Must have Internet Explorer 7.x or above, Firefox 3.x or above, or Safari (Mac)
â€¢Ability to work a minimum of 3 out of 4 weekends per month, including up to an hour a week for administrative work
â€¢Must have a professional demeanor
â€¢Ability to understand the Dyson brand and uphold its integrity at all times
â€¢Strong communication and presentation skills essential
â€¢Charismatic and outgoing personality
â€¢Good understanding of retail business operations; local market knowledge is a plus 
â€¢Must have intermediate computer skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office 
â€¢Must be self-motivated and be able to work well independently
â€¢Must be available to attend and actively participate in team meetings conference calls 
â€¢Must have a valid drivers license with good driving record; reliable transportation, and ability to travel within designated region
â€¢Ability to lift, push, and pull up to 30 lbs., potentially overhead
â€¢Access to a private computer and a cell phone with ability to send/receive text messages
â€¢Ability to stand on your feet for up to eight hours at a time
Dyson is an Equal Opportunity Employer AA m/f/v/d

collection1.title: Equinox NOW HIRING: Membership Advisors (San Francisco)

body.text:
We are currently seeking Membership Advisors for our state-of-the-art facilities in San Francisco!
It's not work. It's life. Discover inspiring career opportunities and unlimited potential for growth at Equinox. We are America's leading luxury fitness and lifestyle company that achieves the extraordinary every day. We create an integrated approach to the well-balanced life -- from personal training to group fitness to rejuvenating wellness treatments.
Our company is in a rapid growth mode while integrating new brands into the fold. Equinox lifestyle concepts and products include full service spas, healthy gourmet cafes, upscale, stylish clothing boutiques and a newly launched web magazine, Q Blog. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, Blink, Pure Yoga and Soul Cycle, are all recognized in America for inspiring and motivating members and employees to reach their goals and exceed their own performance expectations. In addition to our new Toronto location we have more than sixty locations including New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Miami, Boston, Dallas and Washington DC, Toronto and London.
Join us and discover a dynamic work environment built around helping others maximize their potential, where limitless opportunity is cultivated by the highest in industry standards across training, education, marketing, media and sales.
Responsibilities:
Membership Advisors are responsible for achieving or exceeding individual sales goals, renewals and ancillary service goals by pre-planning the month with strategic outreach, in-club lead generation and securing member referrals. Under the management of a General Manager, the support of a Regional Manager and a sales team of 3-4 individuals, Advisors must display, have knowledge of and participate in all the club's services, programs, and products. Advisors must keep current in knowledge of key competitors by staying abreast of trends and "shopping" competitors to compare facilities and sales trends. Above all, Advisors must have the ability to build rapport and lasting relationships with prospective and current members in order to build a strong referral base and retain members.
Qualifications:
-The desired candidate must possess the following attributes:
-Professionalism
-An entrepreneurial spirit
-Confidence to perform on an incentive based salary
-Excellent verbal and written communication skills
-Enthusiastic, energetic, personable and friendly disposition
-Ambitious, hardworking and passionate about the fitness industry
-Empathy and good listening skills to utilize for selling
-Enjoy working within a team
-Strong time management skills and practices
-Very organized with great follow-up skills
-Willing to work evenings, weekends and holidays
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:
-Advisors receive the following compensation and benefits:
-Base salary along with sales commission opportunities for:
-New membership sales (no cap),
-Renewal membership sales
-Ancillary sales (spa, personal training, pilates)
-Team sales achievements (club and market opportunities)
-Health Insurance -- medical and dental benefits after 90-days
-401K plan and company match following a year of employment
-Transit Spending Account (TSA)
-Complimentary Club membership
-Vacation time, sick leave and personal days
-Discounts on all Equinox products and services including Personal Training, Private Pilates, Spa Services and Shop items
ARE YOU A FIT:
-If you are interested in applying, please:
-Submit your resume and cover letter as attachments (in Word or PDF format) via the link below
https://jobs-equinox.icims.com/jobs/2702/login?iis=Equinox+Career+Site
-Include a brief statement as to "Why you are the ideal candidate for this role."

collection1.title: Finance Administrator (SOMA / south beach)
collection1.body:
JOB DESCRIPTION
PPR Worldwide - The Finance Administrator will primarily be responsible for performing billing related duties and accounting processes for the organization, which includes financial reporting to ensure invoicing and revenue recognition is accurate and complete and in compliance with client contracts as well as Sarbanes Oxley controls. The Finance Administrator will help support the companies San Francisco, Washington DC, Austin and New York offices. The ideal candidate needs to be a team player and must possess the ability to prioritize multiple initiatives and activates in a fast paced environment. 
RESPONSIBILITIES
Prepare client invoices and ensure contractual and SOX needs are met. 
Assist with client budget reporting to internal staff.
Assist Finance Team with month end closing procedures.
Prepare internal PO's between sister organizations relating to client work.
Audit employee expense reports for reimbursement.
Prepare 3rd party vendor purchase orders, as needed.
Other operational administrative duties, not limited to the above. 
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors in Finance, Accounting or equivalent work experience.
Strong understanding of Accounting practices and principles 
Familiarity with computerized billing/accounting systems. 
Able to work in a team environment and maintain positive relationships with all levels of the organization. 
Superior computer skills including proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Excel and Outlook.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
We like working with people who can demonstrate that they are; proactive thinkers, enthusiastic, engaging and reliable. Must be able to present well and act professionally 
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
PPR operates ten offices in North America and Asia-Pacific staffed by more than 200 communications professionals. PPR has served and continues to serve global clients including McDonald's, Dell, Emirates, Microsoft, ALDI, Chevron and ExxonMobil, among others. Originally founded in 1970 in Australia by Peter Lazar, PPR is part of the Y&R Group family of companies and owned by WPP, the world's leading communications services network. 
Y&R Group announced the North American launch of PPR in March 2013. PPR Worldwide has its headquarters in New York, and offices in San Francisco, Austin and Washington, DC. The full-service public relations agency offers strong technology, consumer, corporate and crisis communications capabilities. 
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Application:
To apply, send a cover letter and resume.
PPR is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

collection1.title: Product Development Associate at boutique management consulting firm (financial district)
collection1.body:
Curious about people? Want a job sculpted to your strengths and passions?
HSG is a San Francisco-based, high-growth, boutique consulting firm helping game-changing leaders at Fortune 1000 companies like DIRECTV and CalPERS achieve their business objectives faster. HSG's product line solves distinct business challenges, and our newest endeavor, the Team Insights service, is changing the way employees experience working in teams, and how leaders manage their teams and leverage them to achieve greater success. To support the increasing demand for the Team Insights service, HSG is seeking a Product Associate to expand our in-house analytics and reporting capabilities. The ideal candidate will have passion/experience in data analyst, engineering, or product development positions. This is a high-impact role with big growth potential that offers the opportunity to help shape our company from the ground up as we grow. 
Our vision is to enable a world where people are understood. Understanding in the workplace leads to better alignment with the type of work an individual is best suited for, and better interpersonal and team dynamics. When this is accomplished, the individual, their organization and society as a whole benefits. Not only do we counsel our clients on how to achieve this goal, but also we strive to embody and emulate these ideals within our company. Through a relentless focus on shaping each employee's role in a way that best aligns their function with their strengths and passions, we position them to achieve success, growth and satisfaction. 
Primary Responsibilities
• Expand in-house analytics and reporting capabilities
• Assist in new product user research and collecting existing product feedback 
• Requirements definition for new product features
• Configure existing software platforms to user requirements
If you were the Product Associate, last week you would have:
• Researched software options for building a central database 
• Observed a Fortune 500 CIO's team session to assess for client needs
• Adjusted code to produce customized reporting capabilities for an upcoming client engagement
• Reconfigured Salesforce software to allow for clients to be automatically sent a company newsletter
Desired Skills and Experience
• Undergraduate degree (statistics, engineering, computer science, research-based social science degrees preferred)
• Experience in data analyst, engineering, or product development positions 
• Familiarity with programming (R or Qualtrics experience a plus) 
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Impeccable attention to detail
• Ability to create replicable and scalable solutions to analyze data
• Evidence of an appreciation and understanding of Web 2.0 and mobile technologies.
• Experience managing vendors and working with others to refine concepts into real products.
• Proficiency with software such as Excel, R, LaTex, Qualtrics, Salesforce, HTML, CSS, WordPress
• Ability to travel (<20%)
Qualities
• Inherent curiosity about people and interpersonal dynamics
• Team player who thrives during group collaboration (sports experience is a plus)
• Entrepreneurial, roll-up-the-sleeves type person
• Independent, critical thinker who is also open-minded to the opinions of others
• Values constant growth and learning

collection1.title: SMART Summer Program Assistant Teacher (mission district)
collection1.body:
About SMART
SMART is a San Francisco based educational non-profit organization supporting students in 5th -- 12th grades on their journeys into four-year colleges. SMART helps to close the achievement gap by providing our students with intensive social, emotional and academic support through our comprehensive and intensive eight year program. 93% of SMART scholars attend college, forever altering the trajectory of their lives. SMART's wrap around student supports include:
PLACEMENT SERVICES PROGRAM (5th Grade)
Step-by-step guidance with private school application and financial aid process
Three-year scholarship to one of our 21 partner private schools, beginning in 6th grade
8th graders are supported to ensure placement into top college-preparatory high schools
MIDDLE SCHOOL ACHIEVEMENT PROGRAM (6th -- 8th Grades)
Mandatory 2x a week After-School Program focusing on academic and life skills
Each student matched with a tutor and mentor
Six week academic summer program 5th -- 9th grades 
COLLEGE ACCESS PROGRAM (9th -- 12th Grades)
Mandatory weekly programming for high school students
Individualized academic support to ensure eligibility to attend 4 year college
College guidance and application support
About the SMART Summer Program
Once accepted into the program, SMART begins preparing students for the academic rigor of private schools. Rising 5th and 6th grade SMART scholars attend a full-time, six week academic summer program that provides intensive academic enrichment in order to support our student's transition to a more demanding independent school environment. Each day is divided into a morning of academic programming in the core subjects and an afternoon of fun electives.
Teaching Assistant Positions at the SMART Summer Program
The primary responsibilities of a summer program assistant teacher include:
• Contribute to the design of a rigorous curriculum that meets the program's as well as state standards 
• Help to plan, prepare, and implement lesson plans that utilize a variety of instructional strategies and differentiate teaching based on the diverse and individual needs of all students 
• Implement classroom management techniques to create a nurturing, safe, and structured environment 
• Maintain high expectations for students' academic achievement and conduct
• Lead afternoon enrichment activities such as language, drama, music, PE and art
• Help develop and administer a variety of assessments to measure students' growth towards content standard goals
• Analyze informal and formal student assessment results and use information to drive and inform instruction
Position Qualifications
• Possession of or progress towards gaining a valid teaching credential
• Demonstrated success working with students from educationally underserved areas
• Ability to instruct English language learners (Candidates with CLAD/BCLAD highly encouraged)
Salary: Competitive & Commensurate with experience 
Date & Location: Monday, June 16 -- Thursday, July 24 at Mission Dolores Academy
How to Apply: The submission of at least the following documents is required.
• Resume
• Letter of Introduction

collection1.title: MCAT (Biology, Chemistry, Physics) Instructor (San Francisco)
collection1.compensation: compensation: Varies by qualifications and experience.

body.text:
Part-time MCAT Prep Instructor
Why Work for Kaplan? 
Admit it, you know you love standardized exams and you also love teaching. What better way to combine those two loves than teaching for Kaplan part-time? 
At Kaplan, we embrace our inner-nerd and get excited about things like scaled scoring and upcoming test changes. If you identify with those things and want to impact students' educational goals, you should join our team!
Sure, the pay will be great for a part-time job and the schedule is flexible, but the most rewarding thing about teaching for Kaplan is helping your students achieve their educational and career goals! And if you find that you're really digging the test prep scene, there are career growth opportunities to develop and expand your role with us!
Perks of Working for Kaplan: 
Flexible schedules! Classes meet on evenings and/or weekends with non-teaching hours completed from home. 
Opportunity to build your resume with unique experiences. Develop your professional and presentation skills while working part-time 
Earn performance based raises 
Prep time is compensated 
Moving? Starting graduate/medical school? Transfer locations and keep your job. 
Kaplan instructors receive a free prep course! Kaplan gives the gift of knowledge to either you or a loved one. 
So, what exactly do Kaplan instructors do? 
Select their own schedules: At the start of each test cycle, your faculty manager will work with you to select the best teaching assignments for your availability. Our MCAT courses are 12-sessions long, but we offer once, twice, and three-time per week schedules, meaning there's a schedule that works for everyone. At the end of each cohort, you'll start fresh with a new schedule and a new group of students.
Spend half their time working from home: In addition to teaching, you'll have paid out-of-class responsibilities too. You'll receive detailed lesson plan for each class, but have the ability to get creative in your delivery once you've mastered the material. You will also spend time answering students' emails and reviewing their performance. The best part? You can complete these activities at anytime of the day and from anywhere you choose!
In charge of their own raises: Our instructors start at a teaching hourly rate around $18 per hour! In addition, we have a pay-for-performance program that allows you to receive increased pay when you receive excellent end-of-class student evaluations. You'll earn between $1,450-$1,750 over the duration of your first teaching assignment and it's only up from there!
Have the opportunity to be promoted: Nearly every full-time Kaplan employee started as an instructor. We love to hire from within and recognize talent. As an industry-leader, our employees enjoy job security and opportunities for full-time advancement.
Love their boss and coworkers: Join the Kap-family! Although we may be a geographically diverse workforce, we're a connected and engaged community. 
Make a difference in students' lives: Kaplan helps individuals achieve their educational and career goals. We build futures one success story at a time. If you like the idea of transforming lives, build your career at Kaplan. As the leader in educational services, we help people achieve their academic and career goals each day. 
Who works for Kaplan? 
The Student: Students make excellent Kaplan teachers! Whether you are an undergrad, Graduate working on your PhD, or just taking some time off from school, you should teach for Kaplan! Just think, while your roommate is clocking hours at University Dining Services, you'll be building your public speaking skills and gaining professional experience.
The Science Educator: You already enjoy teaching the sciences and have previously performed well on standardized exams, teaching for the MCAT could be the next great opportunity! You'll enjoy the additional teaching time in the evenings and weekends while sharing your knowledge in the sciences and the MCAT.
Your nerdy friend who is super into standardized test preparation (wait, is that you!?): Admit it, you know you rocked the MCAT. Don't be ashamed, some of us just love standardized exams. Whether you worked hard to earn your score, or you are naturally gifted at speaking the language of the MCAT, deep down inside you know you had fun prepping for it.
Your mom, next door neighbor, and barista: The point is that anybody can make a great Kaplan instructor. Amazing Kaplan instructors are dynamic, engaging and can make something as scary as the MCAT fun and manageable. We have an extensive training program that provides ongoing feedback to develop your teaching skills. That means as long as you're an amazing presenter, you can still rock the Kaplan classroom without formal teaching experience. 
Qualifications. Does this sound like you? 
You are an expert on the test you will be teaching, meaning that you have scored at or above the 90th percentile on the MCAT. For candidates who don't already possess qualifying scores but have a strong background in the undergraduate sciences and a proven history of high performance on standardized exams, we are happy to provide an opportunity to take a qualifying MCAT. 
Let's face it, SN2 reactions can be a little boring to most. But you look forward to the challenge of using your charm, wit, and engaging personality to get your students excited to learn. 
You are organized and a self-starter. You will be self motivated through your training and prep, which you do from home. You are confident that you will have the motivation and drive to prepare independently. You thrive in a virtual workforce. 
Remember, you don't need previous teaching experience to apply! You are engaging, dynamic and genuinely interested in teaching. You're dedicated to bringing that level of excellent instruction to our students. 
You are "computer literate". We utilize an online medium throughout the application process, training, and on-going professional development. Our virtual interview process allows the ease of submitting your presentation samples and interview from the comfort of your desk. No sitting in traffic required! 
We receive a large number of applicants to our positions and our students deserve only the best. 
If you are ready to be a teacher for Kaplan and meet our requirements, apply online HERE today! Our application only takes 10 minutes to complete.
Kaplan is an Equal Opportunity Employer

body.text:
Financial Analyst
We are looking for a rock star to join a strong but nimble finance team. You must be able to hit-the-ground running and exude personality that thrives in a creative environment. You must be able to take direction, work independently and in a team environment, and be an ultimate problem solver. If you are not the typical boring numbers person, then we want to hear from you! 
Who We Are
FCB SF is a 90-person full-service advertising agency in San Francisco with a sister office in Los Angeles. Our clients include Electronic Arts, Levi's, Taco Bell, Navi, Air New Zealand, Dockers, Del Monte, Pacific Gas and Electric , Habitat for Humanity, and Kikkoman. We are located in the middle of the old SF ad district, across from Levi's Plaza and close to delicious hamburgers at places like Hillstone (formerly Houston's) and margaritas with beautiful views at places like Pier 23.
What We Do
In any given year, we produce a number of complex, multiplatform campaigns for EA titles, like Dead Space (Your Mom Hates Dead Space), Mass Effect, Star Wars, and others governed by lengthy NDAs that promise physical harm to those who divulge. At the same time we also produce international online film pieces for Dockers and traditional brand campaigns for Del Monte, as well as work for Kikkoman and PG&E.
The Opportunity
Build your career at one of the best-kept secrets on the West Coast. We're one of the most innovative offices in a globally recognized agency, acting as an independent, smart, nimble shop attached to a mother ship (with the money to help us take the bigger risks with higher returns). 
The Role 
The Financial Analyst reports to the West Coast CFO and works closely with the Client Finance team and Corporate Shared Services. The Financial Analyst is responsible for coordinating all aspects of the agency's reporting processes and financial planning and analysis. This includes development, implementation and ongoing management and preparation of the analysis, budgeting, estimating and forecasting processes. 
Responsibilities include:
• Annual Budget and Revised Estimates ("REs") due to IPG and FCB Corporate
• Month-End Analyses
-Report of mapping of all unbillable job expenses to P&L to ensure mapping to correct g/l account
-Report of intercompany segment costs and send to Client Finance and CFO for review
-Report of mapping of all Concur expenses to jobs and P&L to ensure reporting and billing are accurate
-Update of BTA clearing balance sheet account
-Staff salary plan
• Monthly Close
-Prep ETC analyses files for client revenue recognition
-During and post monthly close, provide income statement analysis/reporting for the CFO
-Prepare monthly freelance cost accrual 
-Assist CFO with general monthly close journal entry prep and submission
-Prepare monthly Business Commentary 
• Assist CFO with response to corporate requests and analyses
• Work with CFO and department heads to prepare annual overhead budgets
• Assigning General Ledger coding to overhead A/P and invoices not associated with a purchase order.
• Run weekly A/R and WIP aging reports 
• Intercompany Service Requests ("ISRs")
• Freelance and agency timesheet management and reporting
• Process new vendor paperwork
• Provide ad hoc and/or ongoing support to Client Finance group with reporting
• Substitute for A/P coding and other finance functions to ensure covered when staff are out-of-office as well as provide PeopleSoft back-up for the HR team
• Provide excellent customer service to all employees, clients, and vendors
The Compulsories
Successful candidates for this position require at least 3 years of finance and/or accounting experience. The specific knowledge, skills and abilities required include the following:
• Communication -- Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Business writing skills are an absolute requirement
• Accounting -- Basic understanding of financial statements and reporting. 
• Analysis - Forward-thinking, innovative, problem-solving, analytical mind-set mandatory
• Computer Programs -- Expert in spreadsheet applications, particularly Microsoft Excel, Access, and other database applications. Hyperion and SAP experience a plus. Competent usage of agency financial systems is required 
• Presentation - Must have experience presenting data and have ability to prepare and present clear and concise analyses
• Education -- Bachelor's in Accounting or Finance
TO APPLY, VISIT https://careers-fcbjobs.icims.com/jobs/33683/financial-analyst/job
It is the policy of Draftfcb to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. EOE/AA/M/D/V/F

collection1.title: Business Development Associate for boutique management consulting firm (financial district)
collection1.body:
Curious about people? Want a job sculpted to your strengths and passions?
HSG is a San Francisco-based, high-growth, boutique consulting firm helping game-changing leaders at Fortune 1000 companies like DIRECTV and ON Semiconductor achieve their business objectives faster. HSG's product line solves distinct business challenges, and our newest endeavor, the Team Insights service, is changing the way employees experience working in teams, and how leaders manage their teams and leverage them to achieve greater success. To support the increasing demand for the Team Insights service, HSG is seeking a Business Development Associate to team up with the Director of Sales to grow the number of new institutions using our service. The ideal candidate will have successfully executed lead generation (cold calling and email campaigns), is highly organized, fearless of rejection, and enjoys "hunting" for new opportunities. This is a high-impact role with big growth potential that offers the opportunity to help shape our company from the ground up as we grow. 
Our vision is to enable a world where people are understood. Understanding in the workplace leads to better alignment with the type of work an individual is best suited for, and better interpersonal and team dynamics. When this is accomplished, the individual, their organization and society as a whole benefits. Not only do we counsel our clients on how to achieve this goal, but also we strive to embody and emulate these ideals within our company. Through a relentless focus on shaping each employee's role in a way that best aligns their function with their strengths and passions, we position them to achieve success, growth and satisfaction. 
Primary Responsibilities
• Schedule meetings with prospective clients (senior executives at Fortune 1000 companies) by executing email campaigns and conducting cold calls
• Prospecting and lead generation (e.g. accruing information to build org charts)
• Collaborate with the Product team to conduct interviews with C-Suite executives to obtain feedback about products in development, as well as generate leads
• Exploratory fact-finding and thorough research on prospects in order to assemble comprehensive prep packages for sales meetings (including, but not limited to, previous positions, company financials, key organization initiatives)
• Drive the sales process from start to finish 
• Manage Salesforce database
• Recruiting (~10% of time)
If you were the Business Development Associate, last week you would have:
• Conducted online research on executives who have recently taken on new roles, and sent a congratulatory note and invitation to learn more about our service
• Developed creative messaging for an email campaign and deployed the materials via Salesforce
• Joined the Director of Sales on a prospective client call with a Fortune 500 Chief Marketing Officer
• Joined the Director of Product on a call with the Chief Information Officer of a Fortune 500 company to get input on a product currently in development
Desired Skills and Experience
• Undergraduate degree (psychology or business preferred)
• 1+ year inside/outside sales experience
• Exceptional interpersonal skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to travel (10+%) 
Qualities
• Inherent curiosity about people and interpersonal dynamics
• Team player who thrives during group collaboration (sports experience is a plus)
• Entrepreneurial, roll-up-the-sleeves type person
• Independent, critical thinker who is also open-minded to the opinions of others
• Values constant growth and learning

collection1.title: SMART Summer Program Teacher (mission district)
collection1.body:
About SMART
SMART is a San Francisco based educational non-profit organization supporting students in 5th -- 12th grades on their journeys into four-year colleges. SMART helps to close the achievement gap by providing our students with intensive social, emotional and academic support through our comprehensive and intensive eight year program. 93% of SMART scholars attend college, forever altering the trajectory of their lives. SMART's wrap around student supports include:
PLACEMENT SERVICES PROGRAM (5th Grade)
Step-by-step guidance with private school application and financial aid process
Three-year scholarship to one of our 21 partner private schools, beginning in 6th grade
8th graders are supported to ensure placement into top college-preparatory high schools
MIDDLE SCHOOL ACHIEVEMENT PROGRAM (6th -- 8th Grades)
Mandatory 2x a week After-School Program focusing on academic and life skills
Each student matched with a tutor and mentor
Six week academic summer program 5th -- 9th grades 
COLLEGE ACCESS PROGRAM (9th -- 12th Grades)
Mandatory weekly programming for high school students
Individualized academic support to ensure eligibility to attend 4 year college
College guidance and application support
About the SMART Summer Program
Once accepted into the program, SMART begins preparing students for the academic rigor of private schools. Rising 5th and 6th grade SMART scholars attend a full-time, six week academic summer program that provides intensive academic enrichment in order to support our student's transition to a more demanding independent school environment. Each day is divided into a morning of academic programming in the core subjects and an afternoon of fun electives.
Teaching at the SMART Summer Program 
SMART seeks dynamic educators to teach our students. The primary responsibilities will include: 
• Teach the academic skills, foster the intellectual habits, and cultivate the character traits needed for our students to thrive in independent schools, college, and life 
• Contribute to the design of a rigorous curriculum that meets the program's as well as state standards 
• Plan, prepare, and implement lesson plans that utilize a variety of instructional strategies and differentiate teaching based on the diverse and individual needs of all students 
• Implement classroom management techniques to create a nurturing, safe, and structured environment 
• Maintain high expectations for students' academic achievement and conduct 
• Develop and administer a variety of assessments to measure students' growth towards content standard goals
• Analyze informal and formal student assessment results and use information to drive and inform instruction
• Lead afternoon enrichment activities such as language, drama, music, PE and art
Position Requirements
• Possession of a valid California Teaching Credential in subject area of instruction or multi-subject credential
• Demonstrated success working with students from educationally underserved areas
• Ability to instruct English language learners (Candidates with CLAD/BCLAD highly encouraged)
Salary: Competitive & Commensurate with experience 
Date & Location: Monday, June 16 -- Thursday, July 24 at Mission Dolores Academy
How to Apply: The submission of at least the following documents is required.
• Resume
• Letter of Introduction

collection1.title: Executive Director, Project Glimmer
collection1.body:
ABOUT THE POSITION:
The Executive Director will provide vibrant entrepreneurial vision and leadership that will continue to build Project Glimmer. The Executive Director is responsible for the organization's consistent achievement of its mission and financial objectives.
Reporting directly to the Board of Directors, the Executive Director will be responsible for setting strategy and building partnerships to meet Project Glimmer's ambitious growth and revenue goals. The Executive Director will work in close partnership with the Board in the areas of strategy, vision, fundraising, and financial management.
Project Glimmer is based in San Francisco CA, you will be working from your own home.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Provide vision, oversight, and direction for the achievement of Project Glimmer's mission through building, planning, and executing innovative programs, models, and plans.
• Serve as lead fundraiser and, with the support of the Board, develop and implement a financial plan for long-term sustainability.
• Accounting and Banking (check deposit, paying invoices, entering donations into Salesforce and issuing tax receipts).
• Maintain and execute communications strategy for community partners, funders and board members, including social media strategy and website updates and maintenance.
• Plan and coordinate Boxing Joy volunteer events.
• Support and coordinate logistics for fundraising events such as Glimmer Drives and the annual Pre-Holiday Luncheon.
• Lead online fundraising campaigns and corporate sponsorship outreach. 
• Manage Project Glimmer's Board members, Young Professional Committee members and other volunteers. 
• Implement the strategic vision and oversee the measurement and reporting of benchmarks for delivery on the vision, mission, and programmatic goals.
• Manage social media and the press.
CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS:
• Demonstrated success leading and managing an organization or volunteer movement.
• Strong entrepreneurial drive with a passion for growing nascent organizations or companies -- self-starter.
• Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to develop productive working relationships across a wide variety of individuals and groups including funders.
• Creative and collaborative work style, with the ability to motivate and inspire volunteers to drive the organization forward.
• Technical Savvy - experience (or the ability to learn) WordPress, Salesforce, Google apps, Twitter, Facebook.
• Experience with fund raising, grant writing and driving financial decision-making preferred.
• Bachelor's degree required, advanced degree preferred.
• Available to work on nights and weekends if required.
ABOUT PROJECT GLIMMER:
We're a Bay Area non-profit helping women and girls through simple acts of giving. Since our founding, Project Glimmer has given more than 45,000 gifts to thousands of at-risk women and girls through our community partners across the Bay Area. Learn more at our website at www.projectglimmer.org
HOW TO APPLY
Please reply with a cover letter and your resume.

collection1.title: Bank Teller - Full Time (downtown / civic / van ness)

body.text:
To Apply: https://accountmanager.providentcu.org/index.asp?i=jobsListing
Why Provident
Provident Credit Union is member-owned, trusted, financially sound, technologically advanced, and provides "world class" value, convenience, products and services to all members. We are headquartered in Redwood Shores, CA and have 18 branches located throughout California, in the San Francisco Bay Area, Eureka, and Folsom. 
Job Purpose
The Member Service Representative (MSR) will have a strong working knowledge of Credit Union products and services with the primary responsibility for transaction processing, record maintenance and providing excellent service in order to meet the objectives of the Credit Union. The MSR will be proficient in identifying sales referrals and cross--sell opportunities by effectively using available resources to increase business, strengthen member relationships and increase member loyalty. The MSR will be consistent in achieving individual sales, service and production goals. The MSR works under the supervision of the Assistant Branch Manager or Branch Manager.
Duties
- Accurately and efficiently process member transactions.
- Identify and make sales referrals.
- Cross-sell Credit Union products and services.
- Follow risk management guidelines when processing transactions.
- Provide exceptional level of member service.
- Perform other duties as directed.
- Previous banking experience preferred. 
About Provident Credit Union 
Currently the 82nd largest credit union in the US (18th largest in California), Provident Credit Union was established in 1950 to serve the California Teachers Association. Headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area, Provident Credit Union now serves more than 93,000 members from over 1200 employer groups and maintains branches throughout California, and nationwide.
EOE

collection1.title: Experienced Bodyman Technician (Sant Rosa)

body.text:
Our Company 
We are a family owned and operated multiple-franchise auto dealer group in California's North Bay. We operate nine dealerships representing ten of the top new automotive brands in the world, with locations in Petaluma and Santa Rosa. As a strong, secure leader in the automotive industry for over 50 years in the North Bay, we've been dedicated to providing an exceptional experience, not only for our customers, but for our employees as well. Deeply rooted and involved in our Sonoma County communities, we pride ourselves in maintaining a position of integrity, fair and honest dealing. 
The Opportunity 
We recently built a new state-of-the-art Collision Center to expand our business. We have an immediate opening for an experienced Bodyman Technician at our BMW Body Shop.

• Ability to complete small spot repairs 
• Ensure a high level in customer satisfaction
• Experience working on high tech vehicles with computer technology systems
• Work well with deadlines
• Written and communication skills
• Aluminum repair preferred but not required

collection1.title: BILINGUAL SOCIAL WORKER/THERAPIST (visitacion valley)
collection1.body:
Alternative Family Services, a Foster Family, Adoption and Mental Health
Agency,serving children and families throughout the Bay Area, has a full-time position for a Bilingual Social Worker/Therapist.
Our San Francisco County based mental health program is designed to provide children in the child welfare or juvenile justice system and their families with community based and/or in-home therapeutic services. This program is based on a culturally competent, family-centered, strength-based approach to treatment. 
QUALIFICATIONS: 
B.B.S. registered MFT/ACSW Intern or Licensed
Able to obtain fingerprint and government background clearances
Spanish/English bilingual required
Experience with in-home or community based services for children and families and working with kids who are on probation or wards of the juvenile court
Experience with the implementation of evidenced based or evidenced based informed models of service delivery
Experience in social services and non-profit organizations preferred
Experience with EPSDT Medi-cal funded programs is a plus
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct assessment, diagnosis, and treatment plan development to each client on caseload
Provide counseling, intake, clinical case management, advocacy, linkage, support and individual and family therapy for clients and families
Write progress notes on a daily basis to document delivery of service 
Maintain client charts to ensure compliance with Medi-cal regulations 
Provide emergency response and available to work evenings and weekends as needed
Driving Requirements: This position requires the employee to work out in the community and within foster homes throughout the Bay Area. Thus, position requires employee to possess a valid CA driver's license and valid automobile insurance with his/her name on the verification card as an insured driver on the policy at all times. Position requires daily access to a car in safe working order. AFS provides mileage reimbursement.
WE OFFER: 
A competitive salary and benefits package 
A professional and supportive work environment 
Please email your cover letter and resume with the subject line: JOB CODE 2014-03 or fax to 707-576-9700
Please visit our website at www.afs4kids.org
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin or disability.
