collection1.title: Junior Pricing Analyst (financial district)
collection1.body:
Job Description
Compass Analytics is a leading provider of mortgage analytics and services to mortgage bankers, traders, and banks. Compass provides mortgage valuation and risk management analytics to the broad mortgage industry and employs its own analytics and trade desk to provide outsourced valuation and hedging services.
Compass is actively seeking a Junior Pricing Analyst to join its team in its downtown San Francisco office. This position is responsible for collecting market prices and data, generating statistics and understanding the terms, models and required data of a variety of financial derivatives. The position will also be responsible for assisting in trade execution. As this position will involve trading, the hours required are similar to east coast market hours. 
Desired Skills & Experience
Requirements: High undergraduate GPA in finance, physics or math program. Candidate must have a strong work ethic and excellent problem solving and analytical skills. Attention to detail and communication skills are a must, as is a capacity to analyze and solve issues quickly. Ideal candidate will be a recent college graduate experienced with Excel, SQL, Bloomberg or other information services. The candidate will be considered for advancement only after displaying proven aptitude, acquisition of business knowledge and ability/willingness to train replacement.
Interested candidates should submit a formal resume, cover letter explaining your interest in this position, GPA and SAT (or ACT) scores and must be authorized to work in the USA.
• Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. 
• Please, no phone calls about this job! 
• Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.
Company Description
Compass Analytics, with offices in San Francisco, CA and Washington, DC provides valuation, hedging and accounting solutions to mortgage originators, bankers, servicers, investors and secondary marketing departments. Compass provides its pipeline customers the necessary tools and counsel to optimize profits including best execution, rate sheet, margin, pooling, investor file creation, hedge selection, accounting, and purchase advise reconciliation tools. Compass's servicing (MSR) valuation tools are integrated into its pipeline tools to enable full best execution analysis including MSR retain/release, cash/MBS, and specified pool best execution. Compass clients also use Compass's MSR tools to value, hedge and generate accounting entries for their servicing portfolios as well as gaining a much greater understanding of the drivers of MSR values and risk. In addition to licensing its analytics, Compass uses its analytics internally to provide outsource hedge execution services, drawing on Compass's considerable expertise and access to market color. 
Additional Information
Type: Full-time 
Experience: Entry Level
Functions: Finance 
Industries: Financial Services

collection1.title: IT Support Specialist (SOMA / south beach)

body.text:
Do you know Macs? Live them, breathe them, spend most of your days fixing them? If so, then we want you! We are hiring an IT Support Specialist, i.e. a Mac Wiz, to work closely with our employees to ensure smooth sailing for all things IT. The successful candidate will know Macs inside and out, have superb customer service skills, professional work habits, and a calm, friendly "deskside" demeanor. StumbleUpon is a fast paced, high-energy environment and our IT Support Specialist is our go
Job Description
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
On-boarding new employees: building systems, installing printers, scanners and VPN
Managing the badging system
Provide ongoing technical support for our internal IT systems - this includes configuring and troubleshooting issues with employee's laptops, desktops, application software, office network equipment, etc
Office IT management - inventory management, software licenses, and working with ISPs
Troubleshoot and resolve problems with basic network and operating system installations and configurations
Datacenter Support -- as needed help setup Unix systems at our datacenters - this includes racking, hardware troubleshooting, cabling, labeling, etc
Assist in company wide events with video and audio setups and teleconferencing.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
AA or BS in Information Technology
2-3 years of IT helpdesk support with Macs
Familiar with printer setup and basic maintenance/repair
Experienced in desktop/laptop system setup and basic maintenance/repair
Must be a self-starter and able to work under minimal supervision
Must be able to keep sensitive information confidential at all times
Server maintenance including hardware upgrades and replacements a plus
Comfortable with Linux command line and basic CLI tools
Able to lift up to 40 pounds, type for long periods of time, and work in loud datacenter environments
About StumbleUpon
StumbleUpon is a discovery engine that finds the best of the web, recommended for each user with an element of fun, novelty and surprise. Our recommendation technology is adaptive, shuffling between recommendation methods in real-time, depending on a person's evolving preferences, interests, or mood.
Our Paid Discovery platform lets advertisers target users when they are interested in the content. With Paid Discovery, users don't have to be convinced to click on an ad; instead they are delivered directly to an advertiser's web page. This creates a faster and more immediately engaging connection between the advertiser and customer. More than 100,000 brands, publishers and other marketers have used StumbleUpon's Paid Discovery platform to tell their stories and promote their products and services.
#4 referrer of social traffic to content sites
75000 new pages added daily to our index
35 million registered users and we make 450 million recommendations each month
Just to give you a taste of our work environment, check out this link:
http://techcrunch.com/2013/07/02/stumbleupon-cribs-video-tc/
Click here to apply.

collection1.title: AP Specialist Needed at Growing Real Estate Investment Trust! (financial district)
collection1.body:
Want to work for a real estate investment firm located in the heart of San Francisco's Financial District? We are a looking to add an experienced Accounts Payable Specialist to our world-class accounting and finance department! Reporting to the Accounts Payable Manager and Controller, this candidate will be a fundamental contributor to our full cycle accounts payable invoicing and processing/reviewing expense reports. Volume can fluctuate but, you should have recent experience with handling a minimum 100-200 invoices a week. Successful team members where ability to work in fast paced/dynamic environments and pick up new things quickly! 
As the Accounts Payable Specialist you will be responsible for the following:
• Matching, batching, coding and entering invoices
• Entering, posting and reconciling batches
• Researching and resolving issues with customers or vendors
• Updating and reconciling sub-ledger to the general ledger
• Assisting with preparing accruals and reconciling to the general ledger
• Maintaining accounts payable aging analysis
• Performing general ledger posting and monthly/year-end reconciliations
Position Requirements:
The ideal accounts payable candidate must have 5+ years of recent matching, batching, coding and entering invoices. Successful candidates should possess strong interpersonal and customer service skills, ability to work in a team environment. Proven attention to detail and an ability to work under tight deadlines is a must! Proficiency with excel skills (v-look up and pivot tables) and working experience with a cloud based ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, Great Plains, NetSuite, XERO, Intacct, etc.) will be considered an asset. Temporary hourly compensation can range from $20/hr to $25/hr DOE.

collection1.title: Primary English Teacher (haight ashbury)
collection1.body:
The Lycée Français de San Francisco is looking for a Primary English Teacher with ECE for the 2014-2015 school year. 
The Lycée Français de San Francisco is a French immersion College Preparatory school in the San Francisco Bay Area, providing a challenging educational environment, based on the French national curriculum. Our program is designed to provide students with a structured, well-assimilated body of general knowledge while encouraging the development of analytical and critical thinking skills. Our students earn an American high school diploma, as well as prepare for the French Baccalauréat which qualifies them to attend European universities.

Full-time employee 
Location 
San Francisco, Haight area - Ashbury Campus

collection1.title: Senior Java Software Engineer (financial district)

body.text:
Tightrope Interactive is seeking a Senior Java Software Engineer with 7-10+ years of relevant experience for a full-time position in our San Francisco headquarters (or Cold Spring, New York office).
As the premier provider of intelligent software distribution, monetization, and analytics solutions, our unique, patent-pending technology platform is constantly evolving, with more patented products/features planned. This role is an opportunity to be the technical leader in innovating through the design and development of extremely large-scale, web-based systems, supporting 50 million users/month (and growing). Creativity and technical excellence are critical attributes for this role, with the ideal candidate being an elite software programmer having a passion for innovation and achievement. There's no shortage of interesting work and problems to solve so, if that's what you're looking for, Tightrope Interactive is the right place!
Duties and Responsibilities
Work in small, agile teams, designing & developing new features for an existing, large-scale, Java-based content/product management system
Collaborate with Product Management to identify, prioritize and document detailed product requirements
Drive continual improvement to system architecture and application code
Lead development efforts in optimization of existing systems (scalability, reliability, availability)
Required Qualifications
Expert Java programming skills a must
7-10+ years of Java-based server-side software engineering
Expert knowledge of Java, big data, MySQL, Hibernate, Apache, Lucene, and MVC
Proficiency with general *nix system administration & networking
Excellent applied optimization skills (application performance optimization, query optimization, system optimization, stress/load testing, etc.)
Extensive experience with web technologies - including HTML, XHTML, PHP, AJAX, JSON, and JavaScript
Knowledge developing Web Services, JAXB, WSDL, SOAP - XML
Highly motivated and self-sufficient with excellent written and oral communication skills
B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent
Desired Additional Qualifications
Experience with JPA, Mozilla Rhino, Mono, Commons, Open-CSV, c3p0, Ehcache, Google-Guava, Google-Guice, and Maven
Advertising technology industry experience
M.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent
Compensation and Benefits
Compensation depends on experience and consists of base salary and a target bonus opportunity. Tightrope Interactive provides medical, dental, life and disability insurance, pre-tax commuter benefits, a 401(k) plan, and paid time off.
About Tightrope Interactive
Tightrope Interactive is an innovative online marketing firm. We have been delighting clients since 2006 by consistently delivering beyond expectations. Every day, our teams craft and manage digital media campaigns, create effective websites and landing pages, and analyze our offerings for optimal performance. We know it takes more than strategic thinking to make it in the digital world, and that's why we "walk the rope" with a unique balance of creative spark and technical skill.
Our Lead Generation team connects students with the right school through our flagship online portal, Education180.com. Our Downloadable Products team enables software developers and download sites to increase their revenue with our advertiser-based installer platform, WebInstall.com.
Tightrope's offices are situated in the heart of San Francisco and the soul of New York. We embrace diversity and support a work/life balance. Working here requires a healthy blend of passion, commitment, flexibility, and teamwork. Think you have what it takes? We'd love to hear from you!

collection1.title: Financial Advisor (financial district)

collection1.title: Web Project Manager (financial district)
collection1.compensation: compensation: Competitive salary plus quarterly bonus opportunity and benefits

body.text:
Tightrope Interactive is seeking a smart, proactive leader to become the new Project Manager for our Downloadable Products team in our downtown San Francisco headquarters. You will be coordinating all the moving parts and pieces to create successful campaigns for offers such as open source products and games bundled with monetization components.
Duties and Responsibilities
Lead the development of websites and landing pages for marketing campaigns (mostly SEM)
Lead the department testing and optimization program, including test analysis
Know the ins and outs of our proprietary download management system and create product bundles for new campaigns and tests
Be a knowledge expert and an evangelist for your projects and your department
Be the first point of contact for troubleshooting; investigate and solve issues ranging from technical bugs to tracking discrepancies
Coordinate QA for all your projects; be the person accountable for bug-free final products
Serve as Scrum Master for the engineering product development team
Lead project-related meetings and check-ins
Required Qualifications
Experience managing or participating in web design projects (e.g., sites, landing pages, Facebook pages) that target multiple browsers and operating systems
Superior process coordination skills: able to comprehend the vision for the final product and break it down into actionable components for a team involving stakeholders, designers, copywriters, and engineers
Innate ability to identify and implement process efficiencies
Basic web troubleshooting skills (e.g., diagnose why tracking in HTML isn't working)
Optimization and testing experience (e.g., A/B tests, multivariate tests) and familiarity with testing platforms such as Optimizely, Mixpanel and Google Analytics desired
Excellent communication skills; comfortable running meetings
Knowledge of Scrum or similar Agile process desired (previous experience as Scrum Master is ideal)
Compensation and Benefits
Compensation depends on experience and consists of base salary and a target bonus opportunity. Tightrope Interactive provides medical, dental, life and disability insurance, pre-tax commuter benefits, a 401(k) plan, and paid time off.
About Tightrope Interactive
Tightrope Interactive is an innovative online marketing firm. We have been delighting clients since 2006 by consistently delivering beyond expectations. Every day, our teams craft and manage digital media campaigns, create effective websites and landing pages, and analyze our offerings for optimal performance. We know it takes more than strategic thinking to make it in the digital world, and that's why we "walk the rope" with a unique balance of creative spark and technical skill.
Our Lead Generation team connects students with the right school through our flagship online portal, Education180.com. Our Downloadable Products team enables software developers and download sites to increase their revenue with our advertiser-based installer platform, WebInstall.com.
Tightrope's offices are situated in the heart of San Francisco and the soul of New York. We embrace diversity and support a work/life balance. Working here requires a healthy blend of passion, commitment, flexibility, and teamwork. Think you have what it takes? We'd love to hear from you!

Other career opportunities

Facebook page
LinkedIn page
All interested candidates must apply through our careers website. CLICK HERE TO APPLY.

collection1.title: Affiliate Manager (financial district)
collection1.compensation: compensation: Base salary plus uncapped commission and benefits

body.text:
Tightrope Interactive is seeking an ambitious Affiliate Manager for our Downloadable Products unit to identify and close new publisher partners. We have been in the install monetization space since 2008, much longer than our competitors, and have refined our product to be the market leader. Our installer is used by premier publishers such as Download.com, Yahoo! Downloads and Tucows and it consistently outperforms competitors in head-to-head trials. We have a winning product and the high-profile partners to prove it, now we're looking for an Affiliate Manager who can leverage these strengths to bring in more publishers and share in the profits these partnerships produce.
Duties and Responsibilities
Identify potential strategic / high volume partners and develop relationships with them
Sell primarily to publishers but also keep an eye out for attractive advertiser partnerships
Grow our Downloadable Products business by closing deals that "move the needle"
Minimum Qualifications
1+ years of Affiliate Management or Business Development experience in internet or software industries
Bachelor's Degree in marketing, business, or a related field
Highly motivated and self-sufficient
Ability to learn new software quickly (we have some web-based software tools that have been developed in-house)
Excellent organization, communication, and social skills
Willingness to travel as much as needed to successfully execute this role (likely to average less than 25%)
Additional Desired Qualifications
Experience in downloadable products industry
Contacts with large software publishers/marketers (CNET, Softonic, WinZip, Bittorrent, Conduit, Brothersoft, Avast, AVG, etc.)
Familiarity with internet marketingPresentation experience
Compensation and Benefits
Compensation consists of base salary and an uncapped commission based on a percentage of the profit generated by the publisher deals. Tightrope provides medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, pre-tax commuter benefits, a 401(k) plan, and paid time off.
About Tightrope Interactive
Tightrope Interactive is an innovative online marketing firm. We have been delighting clients since 2006 by consistently delivering beyond expectations. Every day, our teams craft and manage digital media campaigns, create effective websites and landing pages, and analyze our offerings for optimal performance. We know it takes more than strategic thinking to make it in the digital world, and that's why we "walk the rope" with a unique balance of creative spark and technical skill.
Our Downloadable Products team enables software developers and download sites to increase their revenue with our advertiser-based installer platform, WebInstall.com.
Tightrope's offices are situated in the heart of San Francisco and the soul of New York. We embrace diversity and support a work/life balance. Working here requires a healthy blend of passion, commitment, flexibility, and teamwork. Think you have what it takes? We'd love to hear from you!

collection1.title: Contract Medical Sales Rep - Long Term Care, Skilled Nursing (San Francisco, CA)
collection1.body:
Contract Medical Sales Representative - Acute Care, Skilled Nursing, Assisted Living
Excellent opportunity for those looking to break into Medical Sales. 
Seeking a hard working, professional with good sales presentation/communication skills. Person must be detail oriented, customer focused, persistent, and not afraid to get in front of people and cold call. 
This position is a 100% commission only opportunity.
The call points include: Acute Care Hospitals, Long-Term Acute Care Hospitals, Skilled Nursing Facilities, and Assisted Living (Nursing Home) Facilities. Also open to other individuals use to 100% commission only sales opportunities (Insurance , Real Estate Agents, Individuals possibly running a pre-existing business with flexibility, etc).

collection1.title: PHILZ COFFEE - Driver & Warehouse Team Member (bayview)
collection1.body:
What you will be doing:
~ Delivering and driving to Philz Coffee retail store locations and some wholesale customers; cargo van and 16' box truck. Ability to navigate to stores around the bay area and maneuver through traffic appropriately.
~ Picking orders for retail stores. Attention to detail to ensure accuracy of orders picked to ensure accurate quantities where items are stored in multiple package dimensions (e.g., 4-lb bags, 1-lb bags, etc.)
~ Package shipment for online and wholesale shipments: apply item labels to generic bags, fill bags of coffee with beans, fill corrugated boxes with bags of coffee, insert appropriate paperwork, and apply appropriate shipping label.
~ Packaging product using machinery: utilize machinery to fill bags with coffee with appropriate amount of beans, and to seal poly and/or foil bags.
~ Providing first class customer service is the cornerstone of our business, regardless if you are serving our customers in our store or delivering products to our store. Philz Coffee team members are expected to provide world class customer service to both our internal and external customers.
Requirements:
~ 1+ years' experience working in a medium to large warehouse environment.
~ While a commercial license is not required, proof of a clean CA DMV record and valid CA driver's license are required.
~ Forklift experience; forklift certified preferable, but not required.
~ Must have basic math skills (adding, subtracting multiplication), writing, reading and comprehension.
~ Attention to detail to ensure accuracy on quantities of products shipped.
~ Intermediate to advance P.C. skills.
~ Basic office equipment (fax, printers, etc).
~ A High School diploma or equivalent work experience preferred.
~ Able to lift heavy boxes over 50 lbs.
~ Good command of the English language.
~ Team work oriented and flexibility in work schedule.
~ Ability to stand for long periods of time.
~ Ability to use fingers, hand, reach and bend down.
To apply: Email your resume, and application to the confidential email above. Use the code "Warehouse" in the subject line of your email. For an application and additional information about Philz Coffee, check us out at www.philzcoffee.com. 
Philz Coffee provides group health insurance, paid time off, holiday pay, discounts on all Philz Coffee products and merchandise. Philz Coffee is an equal opportunity employer, that values a diverse workforce. "Like" us on Facebook, Follow us on Twitter and check out what are customers are saying about us on Yelp!

collection1.title: Critical Intervention Specialist-SF, Marin, San Mateo Counties
collection1.body:
Creating Behavioral and Educational Momentum (CBEM) is a growing agency that is looking for dedicated, responsible, and professional individuals to provide Critical Intervention Services to persons diagnosed with developmental disabilities that may also have co-morbid mental health disorders. This is a full time position.
A Critical Intervention Specialist provides acute crisis response as well as critical case management to prevent crises from occurring. We serve persons of all ages (i.e. children to elderly). Applicants should be interested and comfortable working with persons of all ages with varying disabilities and needs. Previous experience working with persons with developmental disabilities or experience providing mental health services is ideal.  
We are seeking applicants to work in San Mateo, SF and Marin counties. A requirement of the CIS position is the ability to work in all counties and to commute across the three counties regularly. 
Job tasks include but are not limited to:
• Intensive Case Management duties that include daily submission of case notes, collaborating with circle of support and collateral contacts weekly, and visiting the identified client at least once a week.
• Carry a 24/7 week-long hotline rotation once a month and respond in person to crisis situations.
• Manage a caseload of clients in a critical situation.
• Develop Preliminary Behavior Assessment and Needs Assessments of clients.
• Develop Progress Reports for client on caseload.
• Provide training to group home or adult residential staff, circle of support, care-providers and family members on behavioral techniques aimed at preventing, arresting, or stabilizing behavior problems while maintaining the individual at their home. Implement positive programming strategies.
• Counsel and stabilize client in critical situation/incident.
• Maintain consistent communication with your Supervisor, group home staff, day program staff, care providers, family members and client's circle of support.
• Maintain written records (enter into CBEM's database) of interaction regarding clients in the form of case notes, case reviews, stabilization plans, face sheets and updates. Documentation needs could change based on client and/or contractual guidelines.
• Rotate on-call responsibilities with other team members as scheduled by your Supervisor.
Our CIS Team includes a Program Director, Administrative Clinical Coordinator, Critical Intervention Clinical Specialist, Critical Intervention Specialist as well as Behavioral, Psychological and Psychiatric Consultants.
Qualifications, Skills and Other Requirements:
• A Master's Degree, preferably in Psychology, Counseling, Special Education, Social Work or a related field.
• Bilingual applicants preferred (Spanish a plus)   with the ability to speak, read, and write fluently.
• The CIS must live within our geographic region so that they can respond within one (1) hour to a critical situation.
• Applicants should be interested and comfortable working with persons of all ages with varying disabilities and needs.
• Must have a reliable means of transportation and be willing to commute to various settings to meet with circle of support and the identified client (i.e., family homes, Adult Residential Facilities, day programs, schools, hospitals, etc.).
• Ability to meet time sensitive deadlines as well as weekly billable hour expectations, ability to utilize email and text messaging to communicate with the CIS and Administrative team, as well as circle of support.
• Ability to work effectively with a team, as well as possess strong time management skills, and be able to work independently.
• Ability to generate visual intervention tools, specifically designed for the identified client.
• Experience working with persons with Autism and experience utilizing ABA strategies preferred.
• Previous experience working with persons with developmental disabilities or experience providing mental health services is ideal.  
• Thrives in a fast paced environment
• A high degree of professionalism and ability to effectively collaborate with others.
• Ability to work within a Systemic, Strength-based, Person Centered Framework.
• Ability to develop and implement comprehensive treatment/ stabilization goals and plans designed to address the specific needs of the identified client and to prevent further crises from occurring.
• Strong clinical observational skills, and the ability to assess functions of behavior and antecedents in order to implement preventative behavior intervention strategies. 
What CBEM offers our full time employees:
• Compensation: $1,666.67 semi-monthly
• MFT, MSW or Psy.D. interns the option to receive supervision hours toward licensure at no cost.
• Comprehensive training program to all new hires. 
• A bundled medical, dental and vision plan, vacation, sick and holiday pay.
Through our PEO partner Insperity all full-time employees receive Basic Life and Accident Insurance. There are also other "Optional" Benefits available through our Insperity Partner.
To learn more about our company please visit us at www.cbemllc.com
To apply to this position please send a cover letter and resume and include in the cover letter the days of the week that you would be available to work. 
Please write in the Subject Line of your email: SM, SF, Marin CIS. 
We hope you understand that we cannot respond to all applicants who have applied for a position, but we will make contact with those who meet the qualifications of this position.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

collection1.title: Share your tech expertise w/kids as a summer instructor!

body.text:
Spend this summer doing what you love while imparting your expertise to kids. Galileo Learning is looking for tech gurus to share their love of technology through teaching cutting-edge curricula. With a wide variety of classes, including Video Game Design, Mobile App Design, Web Design, Circuits & Electronics, Music Producers, Computer Programming, and more, you're sure to find a class that fits perfectly with your interest and expertise.
Do what you love and make a lasting impact.
Lead Instructors are pivotal to the summer experience of Galileo campers, providing instruction and inspiration, fostering the type of learning environment which allows kids to explore and develop vision, courage, collaboration, determination, and reflection. We provide outstanding curriculum and all materials, giving you the freedom to tailor your classroom's look and feel, and to focus on bringing learning to life!
Lead Instructor positions are limited and fill quickly on a rolling basis. Apply or learn more today! 
$475-675 per week (Monday-Friday), depending on subject, program, and experience 
Locations throughout all regions of the Bay Area
6-10 week commitment, depending on location (day camp program, housing not provided)
What is Galileo?
Galileo, now in our 13th year, is an innovation-focused education company which runs four summer programs at over 40 sites throughout the Bay Area. Our mission is to develop innovators who envision and create a better world, and we reach this mission through our unique pedagogy, the Galileo Innovation Approach. We nurture creativity, curiosity and expression in campers, and believe in giving staff the opportunity to contribute their strengths toward the success of a program and company invested in their personal and professional growth.
Why Work at a Galileo Camp This Summer?
Galileo is a summer job, but it is also a community, a career path, an educational movement, and inspiration to create positive change in the world through the work we choose. You'll learn, laugh and build every moment of camp: set goals, then achieve them; receive thoughtful feedback about your work; make lasting friendships; and sing, dance and play every day.We were recently named one of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the SF Business Times for the fourth year running, and over 97% of our summer staff said they would recommend working for us. Learn more about what makes a summer at Galileo unforgettable.
Ready to work hard, play hard, inspire, and contribute?
Galileo is currently accepting applications for over 1,200 summer positions.
Our hiring process is competitive, and positions fill quickly on a rolling basis.
APPLY TODAY.
Galileo is always looking for exceptional leaders to become Camp Directors. Camp Directors assume total leadership of camp locations, and are the faces of Galileo in the communities they serve. Our hiring process for these incredible positions begins in the spring for the following season; if you are interested, learn more today or indicate your interest on your application for a summer staff position.

collection1.body:
We're hiring!
About us: We strive to support everyday consciousness--in diet choices, in ingredients, in preparation. Whether you're an herbivore, carnivore, or omnivore makes no difference to us. collection1.title: Part to Full-time Group Dog Walker (San Francisco)

body.text:
This is a great opportunity to join the team at a well established dog walking, training & pet sitting company. The dog walker position will start as part-time & grow into full-time as your client base builds. Pet sitting & individual dog walks are available as supplemental income as well, with potential opportunity to move into dog training as time & experience grows. 
This is a long-term contract position, requiring a minimum commitment of one year, not a temporary job. To apply, please email (no phone calls please) a personal cover letter & tell me about yourself, your experience with dogs & why you want this job. Please include your contact phone number to be considered. If you have already obtained your group dog walking permit with the city, please let me know that. It is not required that you are permitted to apply, but completing the process will be required once you are hired. 
You are: 
• Comfortable with dogs of all shapes, sizes, breeds & personalities. 
• Aware that daily group dog walking is a lot harder than it sounds. 
• Available during weekday daytime hours. 
• Financially secure enough to tolerate the (paid) training period. Training time will vary depending on your level of experience & comfort in a group dog environment, as well as your availability during weekdays to train -- usually around 3-4 weeks. 
• A good driver. You have a valid driver's license, know your way around San Francisco & are comfortable traveling to all areas of the city. You do not need to have your own vehicle to transport dogs -- but please let me know if you do. 
• Able to thrive in a sometimes chaotic, unpredictable work environment. 
• Calm in a crisis. Able to think on your feet.
• Extremely responsible & reliable. Good common sense & a sense of humor required.
• Honest & mature. You pay attention to detail & present yourself professionally.
• A team player with a strong work ethic. 
• Planning to reside in San Francisco for the long term, and are seeking to walk dogs for the long term. , 
• Not afraid of the poop factor & don't mind getting cold, wet, muddy & stinky when required. 
We are: The Whole Pet: http://thewholepet.net/ 
No phone calls -- Email replies only please. Replies that do not include a personal note or cover letter as well as a contact phone number will not be considered.

collection1.title: Take Your Leadership Skills to New Heights! Camp Director with Galileo

body.text:
"Being a Galileo Camp Director called on me to be my best self. I grew in skill and confidence as I built my own vision to inspire a community of learners, doers and thinkers. I've always been motivated by the call to be the change I want to see in the world; Galileo taught me how."- Marie, Former Camp Director
Galileo is looking for outstanding leaders to direct current or new Camp Galileo and Galileo Summer Quest sites for the 2015 season. The Camp Director assumes overall leadership of a camp location, including staff selection and management and day-to-day operations. Camp Directors provide leadership and instructional supervision for staff, interact daily with families and community members, and are truly the face of Galileo in the communities they serve. Camp Directors also work closely with their teams, developing the creative, fun, and wacky traditions that make each camp unique.
What Makes This Experience Exceptional
Create Lasting Impact: Camp Directors are the face of Galileo in the communities they serve, developing meaningful, multi-year relationships with staff members, campers and families.
Inspiring Children: From the classroom to camp games, envision and create an environment that emphasizes fun and learning, and inspires the next generation of innovators.
Building a Team: Select and hire outstanding professional and aspiring educators, then lead and mentor your team to bring your summer vision to life! Develop your leadership skills through observation and giving feedback, bringing out the best in your staff.
Professional Growth: Receive abundant support, from Galileo and from veteran Camp Directors.
Significant Income: Earn $10-13,000 in your first year, with 20-40% annual increases.
Who We're Looking For
Commitment: Because of the important role Camp Directors play in the communities they serve, ideal candidates are interested in a commitment of at least 3 summers.
Leadership: Camp Directors select and manage a team of 15-40 staff, and must be motivational, inspirational leaders.
Experience: We are looking for candidates with college degrees, who have several years of experience working with children, and demonstrated leadership and management ability.
Passion for Working with Kids: Galileo is an innovative learning community, a place where risks are encouraged; it is also tons of fun. Camp Directors must embody these aspects of camp and role model a love of working with children.
Creativity: Every camp location has its own personality, influenced greatly by the Camp Director.
Organization: Camp Directors must be detail-oriented and accountable.
Spring/Summer Availability: The Camp Director position fits around school-year employment or graduate school. Camp Directors work 10-15 hours per week from January to early June (plus several weekend retreats), then 6-8 weeks full time during the summer.
If you are passionate about education,and ready to take the first step toward a transformative summer experience, visit http://www.galileo-camps.com/jobs/being-a-camp-director/ to learn more about being a Galileo Camp Director.
POSITIONS ARE LIMITED AND FILL ON A ROLLING BASIS. LEARN MORE AND APPLY TODAY! http://www.galileo-camps.com/jobs/being-a-camp-director/.
SUMMER STAFF POSITIONS
Not available for a Camp Director position? Galileo hires close to 1,300 summer staff, with positions available for people of all experience levels. Learn more by visiting www.galileo-camps.com/jobs/summer-jobs today! 
Galileo, now in its 13th year, is an educational organization that runs four summer programs at 40+ locations throughout the Bay Area: Camp Galileo (Pre-K- 5th graders); Galileo Summer Quest (5th-8th graders); The Tech Summer Camps (4th-8th graders); and Chabot Space and Science Camp (3rd-7th graders). Our mission is to develop innovators who envision and create a better world, and we reach this mission through employment of our unique pedagogy, the Galileo Innovation Approach. At Galileo, we nurture creativity, curiosity and expression in campers, and believe in giving staff the opportunity to contribute their strengths toward the success of a program and company invested in their personal and professional growth.
Galileo Learning has been ranked one of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the SF Business Times for four years running, and over 97% of our summer staff say they would recommend working for us. Being a Galileo Camp Director means joining an educational movement by becoming part of an organization that is a model of innovative learning in the communities we serve. Our mission is achieved not only through working with campers each summer, but in nurturing the careers of current and aspiring educators. Our Camp Directors bring this vision to life.

collection1.title: Brand Manager, Aperol (financial district)

body.text:
TITLE: Brand Manager, Aperol
DEPARTMENT: Marketing
REPORTS TO: Sr. Marketing Director - White Spirits
LOCATION: San Francisco, CA
GENERAL DESCRIPTION
Campari America is looking for a dynamic Brand Manager to introduce Gruppo Campari's biggest brand in sales value into the US market, Aperol. Aperol is the perfect aperitif. Bright orange in color, it has a unique taste, thanks to the secret recipe, which has never been changed since 1919! This role offers a rare opportunity to manage an established, popular brand in Europe and now ready to evolve presence in the U.S. market where the mixologist community has already embraced with passion. 
If you have demonstrated experience as a brand manager leading a luxury US consumer products brand, driven by creative passions, we want to hear from you. Candidates must have a proven track record executing across the marketing mix, managing multi-million dollar budgets: breakaway consumer communications via national advertising and promotional campaigns, new product innovation and introductions, packaging design, on premise promotions and know how. 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
STRATEGY & MARKET/CONSUMER INTELLIGENCE
â€¢ Development and implementation of the strategic and operational brand marketing plan (short and medium term)
â€¢ Ownership of the brand's P&L in a marketing driven organization
â€¢ Generation of consumer insights and intelligence to inform strategy and execution
â€¢ Analysis of all sales, market and consumer research data to manage, control and advance the brand, for example using Diver, Nielsen, and NABCA, execute analysis of market, brand, competitor and consumer trends and develop/implement recommendations as needed to address business issues and drive sales.
COMMUNICATION PLANNING
â€¢ Lead integrated communication planning process within global and US market brand parameters, achieving performance objectives.
â€¢ Ensure all materials are consistent with strategy, on time & within budget, legally compliant and developed with input from both Sales and Regional leadership team.
PROGRAM/PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION
â€¢ Develop, manage and execute consumer & trade engagement plan including but not limited to on/off premise programs, special events and sponsorships.
â€¢ Lead development and activation of POS, VAP, Premiums and other selling tools to support brand and/or portfolio programs while assuring acceptable ROI.
â€¢ Participate in a robust New Product Development pipeline, and manage launch of new expressions within portfolio.
â€¢ Participate in and/or selectively lead other assigned projects important for brand or portfolio development.
BRAND FINANCIAL REPORTING
â€¢ Responsible and accountable for brand financials, including budget development and variance reconciliation. Manage brand budgets keeping A&P spend within established limits and providing timely reports and analysis to the company on Spend, Committed and Uncommitted A&P budget.
â€¢ Develop and present Quarterly Business Reviews.
QUALIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:
â€¢ Bachelor's degree; MBA in Marketing or Business preferred.
â€¢ 5+ years experience in brand management with on a large consumer products brand; spirits background experience preferred.
â€¢ Strong strategic and analytical skills with strong financial/business acumen. Entrepreneurial spirit.
â€¢ A demonstrated capability driving growth through innovation, successfully leading new product launch design and implementation.
â€¢ Excellent knowledge of the full marketing mix: 
â€¢ Proven track record of consumer engagement planning, innovative thinking, program development and execution and a strategic approach to brand building programs.
â€¢ Knowledge of delivering memorable brand experiences, social media campaigns, advertising campaigns, media planning, and brand tracking tools.
â€¢ Expertise in multi-cultural marketing
â€¢ Ability to interact and influence internal and external stakeholders at all levels to create cross-team collaboration while driving projects to conclusion.
â€¢ Experience in managing advertising, creative, and promotional agencies.
â€¢ Ability to identify problems and offer solid, fact based recommendations.
â€¢ Strong leadership, conceptual, and creative skills.
â€¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong presentation skills.
â€¢ Proficient in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
â€¢ Experience in using syndicated research (i.e. Nielsen).
OTHER REQUIREMENTS:
â€¢ Ability to travel up to 20% of the time.
â€¢ Ability to be self-directed; thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
To apply, please submit an online application here: http://ch.tbe.taleo.net/CH09/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=SKYY&cws=1&rid=258

collection1.title: Marketing Manager (San Francisco)
collection1.compensation: compensation: Base salary plus amazing benefits

body.text:
JOB SUMMARY: 
The Marketing Manager is responsible for planning and implementing all marketing efforts one of O'Reilly Media's major content areas focusing on web performance and operations: http://velocityconf.com/velocity2014 This includes conferences, books, and a variety of related content. The Marketing Manager is extremely organized, with excellent project management skills, strategic marketing vision, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. A strong communicator with proven writing skills in addition to marketing and technical savvy, the Marketing Manager will also reach out on a grassroots level, gaining the involvement of key community members and organizations in conference marketing efforts through social media as well as traditional marketing channels. The Marketing Manager is proactive and self-directed, yet able to work as part of a close-knit team. Travel to all assigned conferences is a necessary component of this position. 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
• Create and implement a marketing plan for each event and product that encompasses outreach via online, print, email, and individuals.
• Provide written concept for each conference web site, using the online site as a primary vehicle to drive registrations. Collaborate with others on writing and tasks, as needed.
• Develop marketing materials and disseminate as needed. Ensure that content is accurate and drives conversions.
• Research and develop relationships with key influencers and groups to gain their involvement in for promotions and activities.
• Manage ongoing email blasts to promote event and products, including list selection and oversight of freelance writers.
• Explore new marketing opportunities, channels, and vehicles.
• Analyze and track results of marketing efforts (i.e. website statistics, list growth, customer/registration information, survey data, etc.) to improve effectiveness.
• Strategize with program chairs/committee members, Sales, and other O'Reilly departments on integrated marketing ideas and tasks.
• Execute all onsite marketing duties at every event, including attendee experience, surveys, and slides.
• Coordinate with the Sales team to ensure that sponsors are properly acknowledged and marketing portion of sponsor agreement fulfilled.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
• Excellent organizational and project management skills 
• Strong writing skills with a demonstrated ability to write clear and compelling copy on technical subjects
• Knowledge of web and print production process and materials
• Knowledge of O'Reilly conferences, products, and services 
• Familiarity with trends and issues in technology industries, particularly as it relates to programming languages, operating systems, and Internet software
• Knowledge of the marketing best practices, for print and online
• Strong command of grammar, spelling, and style 
• Proficiency with word processing applications, spreadsheet applications, and email 
• Familiarity with social networking and other online marketing tools
• Must be able to work within tight deadlines
• Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and shift priorities as necessary
• Aptitude for learning new tools and programs, such as SiteCatalyst, iPost, ExpectNation, GoogleDocs
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
• Four year degree in Business, Marketing, or Management, or equivalent experience
• Must be able to travel up to 25% of the time, including weekends and holidays
Please click here and send us your cover letter and resume.

collection1.title: Ritual Coffee is seeking awesome Accounting Admin (SOMA / south beach)
collection1.body:
Ritual Coffee Roasters
Accounting Administrator
OVERVIEW OF THE ORGANIZATION 
Ritual Coffee Roasters is a San Francisco-based coffee roasting company with four retail coffee bars. Ritual is known for outstanding quality at all levels. The mission of Ritual Coffee Roasters is to be a destination for people who love coffee while building a sustainable business and investing in the communities that support us, both locally and globally. Ritual is a growing, high-energy, fast-paced collaborative work environment where communication, self-direction, creativity, fun, and the willingness to pitch in wherever needed are highly valued.
Since 2005, Ritual has been growing and expanding. In order to increase our level of customer service and quality as we continue to grow, we are looking for an organized and enthusiastic Accounting Administrator to help ensure that our infrastructure is prepared. We are also looking forward to having the Accounting Administrator handle administrative tasks to enable the owner/ founder to focus on the larger vision for the company.
For more information on Ritual, please visit www.ritualroasters.com.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Ritual is seeking a qualified Accounting Administrator to join our roastery team and help us maintain and improve our infrastructure. In this role, the Accounting Administrator will be responsible for administrative tasks associated with operations of the business as a whole. The Accounting Administrator will report to the owner/founder and work closely with the Roastery team. 
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Â· The Accounting Administrator will be responsible for day-to-day bookkeeping, payables, and office management. 
Â· The Admin will also be responsible for human resources, insurance, and benefits.
Responsibilities include: 
Â· Day-to-day administrative functions of the business at large, including processing of employee paperwork, insurance, payroll, answering the phone, and any other issues of the business. 
Â· Overseeing accounts payables and maintaining strong vendor relations. Assist co-workers with transactions such as purchase orders in QuickBooks.
Â· Banking and Cash Management: Coordinate and resolve any banking issues and balance statements on a monthly basis, including company expense reports.
Â· Coordinates with wholesale dept. on AR, bookkeeper, owner on day-to-day GL, and payables checks. 
Â· Cross-training with the rest of the wholesale team means ability to take orders, answer customer questions, process payments, create deposits, communicate with Roasting and Production departments.
Â· Cross-training with Production means ability to help Production pack orders, create shipping labels, track packages.
Â· Human Resources: Process all necessary documentation for new employees and retiring employees. Maintain HR files and contacts with benefits providers. 
Â· Insurance. Coordinate and prepare annual insurance programs, coordinate with brokers, manage programs including health insurance, business insurance, workers comp, liability and auto insurance. 
Â· Management of company credit cards, phones, office supplies, vehicle fleet, and office management. 
Â· Maintain compliance with all local, state, and federal compliance including health department, State Board of Equalization, EDD etc. 
Â· Working hand in hand with the owner to help move the business forward in its strategic plan.
QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE
â€¢ Administrative experience as an office manager/administrative manager 
â€¢ Fluency in QuickBooks Pro is essential, Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office
â€¢ Strong written and verbal communications skills
â€¢ Ability to work in an independent, self-directed environment while at the same time demonstrating a willingness to take strategic direction and work as part of a team
â€¢ Detail oriented
â€¢ A passion for small business and quality products
â€¢ A high degree of ethics and obsession with customer service and satisfaction
â€¢ Interested in participating in coffee education, coffee tastings
â€¢ Knowledge of Adobe Illustrator and In Design a plus
â€¢ A Bachelor's degree or commensurate experience.
LOCATION
The position is based in San Francisco.
COMPENSATION
Commensurate with experience. Ritual also offers a benefits package including medical insurance, dental insurance, commuter benefits, and sick pay after 3 months.
TO APPLY
Please send a cover letter explaining your interest and qualifications and a resume to address email address above. Please no phone calls.

collection1.title: Web Editor UCSF Medical Center (San Francisco)
collection1.body:
Job Summary 
Under the supervision of the Managing Web Editor and Web Services Manager, the Web Editor develops and maintains content for consumers, patients and doctors on UCSF Medical Center's websites at www.ucsfhealth.org and www.ucsfbenioffchildrens.org, The Web Editor writes and edits content, advises doctors, nurses, administrators and others on content development. The Web Editor coordinates and implements the medical center and UCSFBCH social media strategy and tactics.
The Web Editor also works with the Web programmer and freelance designers to identify and implement revisions to improve site usability, and assists in the supervision of freelancers including writers, developers and photographers.
Required Qualifications 
Web Skills
• College degree and at least four to five years' experience in web content development.
• Basic knowledge of HTML
• Web publishing and an understanding of site architecture
• Knowledge of content management systems and Associated Press Style
• Ability to work under deadline to edit and evaluate health news appropriate for consumers, patients and referring physicians; skills to research and edit pertinent information; and skills to work with patients and doctors
• Knowledge of health care services and terminology
• Attention to detail, good communication skills, solid news judgment and ability to work as part of a team required. 
Preferred Qualifications 
• Previous experience in communications or journalism, and health care
Licensure/Certification 
N/A
Equal Employment Opportunity 
UCSF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply. Further information about the University of California, San Francisco, is available at diversity.ucsf.edu. UCSF seeks candidates whose skills, and personal and professional experience, have prepared them to contribute to our commitment to diversity and excellence, and the communities we serve.
How to apply
Send your resume and a cover letter explaining your relevant experience and why you're interested in this position.
About UCSF Medical Center
Our legacy of unsurpassed patient care and unceasing mission to integrate high-tech medical research with clinical operations has led to our prestigious standing as one of the top 10 hospitals in the nation according to U.S. News & World Report. As a premier health care institution dedicated to advancing health worldwide, UCSF Medical Center can also be the best place to advance and shape your career.
The medical center's employees are one of the most important reasons why we are recognized as one of the nation's best hospitals. To work at UCSF Medical Center is to be part of an institution that provides the highest caliber of care to patients; a nurturing, dynamic and team-oriented atmosphere in which to best use your skills and talents.

collection1.title: EDM YouTube Content Scout (Remote)

body.text:
BroadbandTV's WIMSIC Network is hiring passionate EDM experts to recruit for the fastest growing music network on YouTube. http://wimsic.tv
About You:
EDM is your passion and your ear for talent is sharp. You're plugged into YouTube not only as a platform for finding emerging talent, but you probably manage a channel and have a finger on the pulse of how things work behind the scenes. You have an always-on, go-getter attitude, and know how to utilize your network and detective abilities to leverage success. 
The Gig:
A WIMSIC Music Recruiter scouts popular EDM channels on YouTube and communicates all of the benefits of partnership with the WIMSIC network to potential channel partners. Once under the WIMSIC network, we work with talent to help them grow to their maximum potential. 
Work from home on your own time, rub elbows with music industry leaders and amazing acts, and earn excellent commission on all channels that you bring on board. Exceptional recruiters have the chance to earn a base salary and advance within the network when consistently exceeding goals and professional expectations. 
Skills/Experience:
Experience in an outbound sales environment. 
Passionate about YouTube and online video.
Experience as a YouTube content creator or channel manager.
Knowledge of EDM with the ability to differentiate between sub-genres a major plus.
Education: Business, Communications, or similar bonus. 
Expectations:
Daily reach-outs to YouTube channels.
Full Time or Part Time hours commitment. (Minimum = 15hrs)
Organization and time management skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Weekly meetings with your Team Lead via Skype or Google Hangout.
Strong understanding and commitment to a remote, telecommuting sales position.
Benefits:
Earn above industry standard commission based on your efforts.
Base salary offered after two months of hitting sales quotas.
Training and ongoing support from WIMSIC.
References and letters of recommendation for future career opportunities.
A flexible work-from-home position to support you and your personal goals.
Full position training & software to support your daily work.
To Apply:
Please forward a cover letter & resume
About Us:
BroadbandTV is an innovative media and technology company that drives success for online video creators by leveraging its proprietary technology and massive online reach. BBTV is one of the world's largest entertainment networks on YouTube with more than 12,000 network partners amassing over a billion impressions per month. The company lives by its core values of Creativity, Collaboration, Care and Drive to foster entrepreneurship amongst independent content creators, and to advance the online video industry. www.broadbandtvcorp.com

Your organizational skills are exceptional.  You have outstanding communication, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills; demonstrable initiative, creativity, and flexibility. You are a whiz with Google Apps, and consider yourself to be quite tech savvy. You embrace change with a great attitude and feel comfortable with ambiguity. You thrive in the fast-paced environment of a start-up. You have a 4 year degree from a university. You are able to work in a high-energy environment and consider yourself to be a strong team player You have a strong desire to solve problems and constantly improve our system to increase efficacy You have positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, and strong writing skillsPerks:New offices in downtown Palo Alto and SOMA (take your pick of which office you want to work out of).  Both are within a short walk to Caltrain. Free CalTrain GoPass - unlimited Caltrain rides Unlimited Vacation time Discount gym membership Stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages Game night twice per month. Bagel Mondays and Froyo Thursdays in the Palo Alto office weekly In office yoga in the SF office twice a month on Fridays (1st and 3rd Friday) Standing hydraulic desks Group/Team outings like Tahoe trip, movie nights, bbq's, etcIf you'd like to help us grow, please submit a cover letter along with your resume!Click Here to Apply

Peet's Coffee & Tea is looking for part-time Retail Associates (morning & afternoon shifts) for our Embarcadero Center store. If you have a passion for coffee and tea and are looking for a fast-paced, fun place to work, we want you to join our team!

Opportunities for advancement

Peet's Embarcadero
Two Embarcadero Center, Suite R2113
San Francisco, CA 94111

collection1.title: Senior Security Analyst/ Reverse Engineering (financial district)

body.text:
Lookout is the security company for the post-PC era. We build technology that protects people, businesses, governments, and critical infrastructure from the growing threats in the post-PC era. Mobile from the start, we take a different approach to security, using the world's largest mobile dataset, cloud technology and the power of our 40 million users to proactively protect the devices and networks that power our connected world.
We're looking to hire senior-level Security Analysts with strong skills in one or more of the following: Security Incident Response, Malware Analysis and Reverse Engineering. As an Analyst in our team, your work will be instrumental in enabling platform and application security across multiple types of mobile devices. 
Responsibilities:
- Identify and prevent current and future threats to user security and privacy, as part of our growing Mobile Threat Network, the largest data set of its kind on the planet. 
- Hunt down and neutralize malware before it affects our users. 
- Process incoming samples and write detection policies to identify them in the wild. 
- Proactively mine the world's largest and most comprehensive data set about mobile applications to find and investigate potential threats. 
Desired qualifications & skills:
- A passion for reverse engineering. You love to take things apart to figure out what makes them tick.
- Solid grasp of reversing mobile platform code 
- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to describe technical mechanics and put them into a humanized context.
- A broad understanding of the security landscape and its business context / impact.
- Comfortable leading internal teams, but also acting externally in support of strategic partners.
- Experience tactically organizing and managing the work of 3-5+ analysts across multiple areas of ownership (malware family, enterprise customer, strategic partner, exploratory research area).
- Ability to synthesize the big picture from the facts on the table:
What is this?
Why is it behaving the way that it is?
What motivation might there be for the actors involved in constructing it?
What relevance does it have to our customers and / or partners.
Toys:
baksmali, IDA Pro, Java, Ruby, Wireshark
For detailed company info, visit www.lookout.com
To apply: https://www.lookout.com/about/careers/detail?gh_jid=2550

• Moderate knowledge of salesforce.com helpful
• Excellent verbal communication skills
• Strong work ethic. The ability to get things done in an emerging, high-growth Company.
• Smart, creative, energetic, conscientious, and enthusiastic persona with strong problem solving skills.
• Team player with a customer-focused attitude.
About Coverity:
Our products find bugs and security vulnerabilities in source code before they can crash software in the key systems of such important things as pacemakers, cars, and cell phones -- and before they can be hacked by malicious attackers. We are considered to be the leader in the embedded software testing space -- and we are rapidly expanding into other industries and markets. Among our 1,100 customers are:
7 of the 10 top global brands
All 10 top aerospace and defense companies
All 10 top consumer electronics companies
8 of the 10 top telecommunications companies
7 of the 10 top software companies
You name a product in your daily life, and it is likely that we made it better by improving the software. We are proud that the software of the Mars Rover Curiosity is "Coverity-clean" and our products contributed to the success of the large Hadron Collider. In addition, Coverity provides free code analysis to open source projects through our SCAN initiative and many top universities use us as part of their Computer Science curriculum to demonstrate software testing at its best.
Our San Francisco offices are newly renovated in an open concept and right next to AT&T Park and the southern freeway. CalTrain and Muni are one block away, and we provide free passes for CalTrain. We use the best computer equipment available, top-of-the-line office furniture and the view from our office is priceless. We are also part of Outside's 2013 100 Best Places to Work!
We offer:
Competitive base salaries
Semi-annual bonuses based on company performance
Health benefits (medical, dental, vision)
Matching 401k contribution program
Monthly commute allowance
Employee referral bonuses of $5,000 per hire
Insurance (travel, life, short/long-term disability)
All the snacks and drinks you want!
Coverity is a meritocracy where people are rewarded based on merit -- if you produce, you will earn more!
IND123

collection1.title: Post-Sales Engineer (SOMA / south beach)

body.text:
Who is Coverity?
Our products find bugs and security vulnerabilities in source code before they can crash software in the key systems of important things like pacemakers, cars, and cell phones -- and before they can be hacked by malicious attackers. We are considered to be the leader in the embedded software testing space -- and we are rapidly expanding into other areas of Development Testing. Among our 1,100 customers are:
7 of the 10 top global brands
All 10 top aerospace and defense companies
All 10 top consumer electronics companies
8 of the 10 top telecommunications companies
7 of the 10 top software companies
You name a product in your daily life, and it is likely that we made it better by improving the software. We are proud that the software of the Mars Rover Curiosity is "Coverity-clean" and our products contributed to the success of the large Hadron Collider. In addition, Coverity provides free code analysis to open source projects through our SCAN initiative and many top universities use us as part of their Computer Science curriculum to demonstrate software testing at its best.
THE POSITION
The Post-Sales Engineer is responsible for assuring Coverity customers achieve long term success with our market leading Development Testing platform. Responsibilities will consist of on-site engagements with leading top-tier software development groups throughout the US. Occasional travel to other geographic regions including Europe and Asia may also be expected. Engagements are varied in profile, according to Coverity and customer needs, however typically involve the following functional activities:
Technical solution enablement (70%)
Following a defined solution plan, take complete accountability for accomplishing hands-on technical tasks for our customers across several core areas:
Deployment and integration of Coverity tooling with customer's software build systems, IDEs, other SDLC tooling, and processes
Creation and implementation of custom scripts to achieve defined workflow objectives
Identify, review and troubleshoot first line technical issues. Collaborate with Coverity colleagues to resolve more complex issues.
Document and communicate the established solution clearly and effectively
Liaise with other Coverity and customer stakeholders to enable dialogue and transfer technical knowledge as required
End user engagement (20%)
Communicating with software engineers, architects and business stakeholders to articulate the methodology, vision and value of the implemented Coverity solution:
Assist customer team in reviewing, understanding and explaining the impact of code level software defects to developers
Presenting to customer stakeholders on best strategies to address and remediate software quality issues to achieve a target state of continual defect prevention
Creating and delivering concise and effective user-awareness material to educate customer's team members on the exact details of the solution deployed for their environment
Capturing and articulating best practices and experiences derived from other engagements to guide customers and effect meaningful change
Custom solution design and development (10%)
Design and implement innovative solutions which go 'above and beyond' to enable a specific customer requirement. For example:
Development of custom static code analysis rules against the Coverity C/C++ SDK
Creation of custom reporting, policies, or metrics to assist in measuring defect elimination performance against objectives
Integration of third party static code analysis results into the Coverity platform using the Coverity third party toolkit API
Candidate profile
The Post-Sales Consultant must be able to engage in a credible and authoritative dialogue with both technical (software developer) and management audiences. 
He/she should be confident acting as an expert trusted advisor on all matters relating to the Coverity Development Testing platform, and should be able to speak with experience on topics relating to software quality, test driven development, software engineering principles and common industry development practices and methodologies.
Knowledge and hands-on experience of common SDLC practices -- evidenced by success in prior roles such as software engineer, configuration manager, or software architect
Hands-on familiarity, as a developer, with at least one (preferably two) of C/C++, Java, C# as part of a significant software project
Knowledge of a sample of commonly deployed open-source and commercial software development tools
SCM (git, Subversion, Clearcase, Perforce, Mercurial),
Continuous Integration (Jenkins, Cruise Control, Team city)
Technologies supporting test driven development (Clover, gcov, Bullseye, JUnit, NUnit, cppunit)
Build scripts (Makefiles, CMake, Ant, Maven)
Issue tracking systems (Bugzilla, Jira, ClearQuest)
An expert level of skill in reading, writing and modifying scripts written in Perl, Python, and shell/batch scripting languages
Comfortable and capable working with both Windows and *nix environments
Professional consultative demeanour, a 'can do' attitude, and a natural aptitude for problem solving
Ability to travel a minimum of 90%

collection1.title: Practice Manager (inner sunset / UCSF)

body.text:
Company: University of California, San Francisco
Position Title: Practice Manager
Department: Department of Preventive and Restorative Dental Sciences
Location: 707 Parnassus Avenue
Position Type: Full Time
Percentage: 100%
Work Days/Shift: 40 hours per week, 8 hours per day
Requisition #: 40419BR
DEPARTMENT OF PREVENTIVE AND RESTORATIVE DENTAL SCIENCES 
The Department of Preventive and Restorative Dental Sciences (PRDS) is the largest department in the School of Dentistry. The Department is comprised of seven divisions including Behavioral Sciences and Community Dental Education; Biomaterials and Bioengineering; Clinical General Dentistry; Patient Care Simulation; Endodontics, Oral Epidemiology and Dental Public Health; and Prosthodontics.
JOB OVERVIEW
The Practice Manager is independently responsible for management and planning of the clinical and business operational services for the Faculty Group Practice (FGP) and the Advanced Education in General Dentistry Residency Clinic (AEGD). Services include the coordination of patient reception, scheduling, staffing and billing as well as providing information on educational opportunities for the residents. The Practice Manager works with the Department Chair, Vice-Chair, Department Manager, AEGD Director, and practice faculty to develop strategic plans for providing quality care and services which are aligned with the School of Dentistry, federal, state and local regulations. The candidate will also perform other related duties.
ABOUT UCSF 
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.
Required Qualifications 
• Bachelor's degree and 3 to 4 years of experience in clinical operations, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
• Demonstrated clinical managerial and clinical billing experience.
• Supervisory experience with working knowledge of human resources and employee and labor relations issues. Demonstrated supervisory experience with union represented employees. 
• Demonstrated financial management skills and being familiar with UC financial policies
• Demonstrated strong administrative and organizational skills.
• Demonstrated strong interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skill with an emphasis in tact and diplomacy and ability to interact with members from various levels of an organization
• Proven superior analytical in analyzing complex and non-routine issues requiring innovative solutions.
• Demonstrated strong problem solving skills in addressing varied issues.
• Ability to assess and respond to audit risk.
• Ability to interpret and apply policies and regulations (e.g., insurance contract, billing,etc.)
• Ability to operate effectively in a changing organizational and technological environment
• Software and computer knowledge.
• Ability to take initiative and follow through independently on projects.
• Ability to meet tight deadlines and last minutes requests efficiently and accurately.
• Demonstrated record of excellent reliability in attendance and punctuality.
• Demonstrated commitment to projects and strong initiative.
• Agile learner with demonstrated ability to manage several projects simultaneously, respond rapidly to conflicting priorities, and handle tasks with high degree of accuracy.
Note: Fingerprinting and background check required.
Preferred Qualifications 
• Familiar with UC financial policies
• Managerial experience
• Dental office experience
In order to be considered for open positions at UCSF, you will need to submit your resume through our online application process. Once you complete the online application process, you will receive an email confirming that your submission has been received. Submitting your resume to UCSF opens the door to many immediate and ongoing job opportunities. Your resume will remain active in our applicant database and you will be able to update it as needed.
To submit your resume online go to: http://ucsfhr.ucsf.edu/careers
Emailed applications are not accepted.
Apply specifically to requisition # 40419BR. Please note ad code ICRL/ 40419BR in the ad code field in your applicant profile.
An email address is required for you to submit your resume. Visit our Human Resources web site at www.ucsfhr.ucsf.edu/careers for information about other job opportunities. UCSF is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply. Further information about the University of California, San Francisco, is available at diversity.ucsf.edu.

collection1.title: Stylist / Optical Sales - $18-$30/hour - SF Bay Area (financial district)

body.text:
LET'S START A REVOLUTION
Do you remember the last time you bought glasses? Have you experienced, first-hand, the eye-popping sticker shock for the high price of your glasses, but also felt the overwhelming and painful experience of buying glasses?
Join our team, and earn $18-$30/hour styling customers and helping them choose the perfect pair of eyeglasses, making them truly happy with their glasses and the shopping experience.
ABOUT US
The Brownie and Madam Optical Co. is an eyeglass brand that caters to the eyeglass buying needs of busy women -- like you. We design, manufacture and sell our finely crafted & fashionable eyeglasses just for women, and sell them directly to our end Customers. By doing so, we are able to eliminate middlemen, and offer high quality eyeglasses to our Customers at superb values. One pair of prescription glasses including frames, lenses and all coatings is just $150.
We style women of the Bay Area in person -- at their office, local coffee shop or eatery, home, or local pop-up shop. Women get a 45-minute personal style session where they get to try on the entire collection, and get individualized styling and feedback from you, as well as other guests or customers.
WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR
Have you overcome a challenge or an obstacle that you're really proud of? Do you believe you have something interesting to say or offer to the world? Do you have your own very unique sense of style, taste and individuality? And do you love to help people and develop friendships? Are you personable, warm, and do you genuinely care about people?
If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you.
YOUR BACKGROUND
This is a styling and service role. We are looking for prior evidence of a role in which you've styled customers, and provided customers with great service.
No optical background is necessary for this role, although it is a plus. We will provide you with a ton of training and support under the supervision of our Founder, Dr. Alpa Shroff (an optometrist who practiced in the Bay area for over 6 years, and was the 2011 Young Optometrist of the year), so that you can style customers with confidence and handle questions.
THE OPPORTUNITY
We are looking for part-time Stylists that can style customers at scheduled events or time slots, usually for 3-5 hours at a time at the rate of $18-$30/hour. We work with you to book you at events depending on your availability and work around your busy schedule whenever possible.
As our business grows, our most successful Stylists may be invited to join us as full-time employees.
TO APPLY
Please provide your resume, cover letter, and time slots during the week (Monday - Sunday, hours of 8 am to 10 pm) that you are generally available.
We will contact you to schedule an interview and audition. An audition is a mock style session where we get a chance to observe your styling skills and customer interaction. 
Successful applicants will be invited to participate in our training program in the San Francisco Bay area. Applicants will also be required to 'shadow' a minimum of 2 actual customer style sessions.
Upon successful completion of the Brownie and Madam training program, trainees will be given the opportunity to conduct customer style sessions for Brownie and Madam.
Stylists must have access to their own working vehicle for transportation (we will reimburse you for gas and parking for style sessions and events), a computer with Internet access, and a smartphone (iPhone, Android).
We look forward to hearing from you.
Visit the following link to apply and click 'Apply Now': 
http://browniemadam.com/careers
